Esto le brindará la oportunidad de generar los ingresos necesarios para solventar las necesidades básicas de su hogar y para llevar el sustento diario; además podrá seguir luchando para sacar adelante a su hijo y brindarle una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Mariana, 36, is the single mother of a son, 4.  She went through a difficult economic situation when the father of her son abandoned her and because of the lack of job opportunities, so she decided to look for a job to generate her own income.  The financial responsibility falls directly on her, so she wants to start her own business, a restaurant where she'll serve breakfast, lunch, and dinner.

She already has a place but to implement her business plan she needs the support of the loan to buy fixed assets (tables, chairs, a stove, a refrigerator, pots, cutlery, dinner service) and ingredients (meat, vegetables, grains, fruit, soda).  She'll have the help of another person.  Her planned schedule is 6:30 a.m. until 7:30 p.m.

Mariana has the advantage of knowing this field because currently she sells fried foods and has taken several cooking classes.  In this business she'll be able to exploit all her potential and apply the knowledge she has acquired.  This will give her the opportunity to generate the income she needs to pay for her basic household needs and support her family.  She'll also continue striving to get her son ahead and give him a better life.

loans.use: to buy fixed assets and ingredients

loans.name: Lonlongnon -Aného-Nlessi Group

texts.fr: Né en 1963 Amévi  vit avec sa famille (femme et 05 enfants) à  Aného localité située à quelques kilomètres de la ville de Lomé. Il est soudeur de profession et en même temps maraicher. Nommé pour être à la tête du groupement LONLONGNON, mr Amévi sollicite au nom du groupe un troisième prêt à WAGES. Ce montant  leur permettra d’acheter des outils de travail afin d’avoir un bon rendement. Ils espèrent augmenter leur surface d’exploitation et assurer aux mieux aux besoins de la famille.
texts.en:
Born in 1963 Amévi lives with his family (wife and five children) in Aneho, a town located a few kilometers from the city of Lome. He is a welder by profession and at the same time a vegetable gardener. 

Appointed to be the head of the Lonlonglon group Mr. Amévi requests on behalf of the group a third loan from WAGES. This amount will allow them to buy work tools in order to have a good crop yield. 

They hope to increase the area cultivated and meet as best they can their family's needs.

loans.use: Buy working tools

loans.name: Nazia

texts.en: Nazia is a 30-year-old energetic married woman. For so many years, she has been doing business manufacturing paper envelopes with the support of her husband. She makes a large quantity of envelopes at home and sells them in the local market. In this way she helps to provide income for household activities. To help her continue operations of her business, Nazia is requesting a loan of PKR 35,000, which she will use to buy bundles of good quality paper to increase her sales. She expects an increase in her business income as she expands. She wishes to utilize part of the profits to provide a better standard of living for her family members.

loans.use: to buy bundles of good quality paper to increase her sales.

loans.name: Betty

texts.en:
Betty is a married woman. She has 1 child aged one year old. 

She describes herself to be determined. She operates a tea farm where she grows tea. She has been involved in this business for 4 years. Her business is located near a tea factory and her primary customers are agents from the tea factory. 

She describes her biggest business challenge to be hail stones that affect tea growth. She will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy manure and also pay for labor. Her business goal is to expand size of the tea plantation within 5 years. She hopes that in the future, she will establish a tea buying centre. This is her first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy manure and also pay for labor

loans.name: Shahmeem

texts.en:
Shahmeem is a 36-year-old married woman and mother of four children. 

She had a difficult time after her husband's business failure and decided to initiate her own business to support her family, for a better future of her family members. One year ago she began business of tailoring in her house. 

She is well known in her town for providing best quality services. However, due to lack of available funds, she is unable to meet the daily demands of her customers. For this reason she contacted Kashf Foundation and applied a loan of Rs. 20,000. With the help of loan, she will be able to purchase more spools of threads with the packs of laces, buttons and ribbons.

She is hoping to increase her earnings and dreams of expanding her business in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase more spools of threads with the packs of lace, buttons and ribbons.

loans.name: Shahbana

texts.en:
Shahbana is a 36-year-old, married woman and a mother of two. She has been running a clothing sales business for many years. She purchases a variety of clothes from the main city and then sells them to the people of her vicinity. She has become famous for selling good quality clothes in her community. 

Shahbana requested a loan of Rs. 25,000 from Kashf Foundation to buy a stock of different clothes for the summer season by taking into account the choices and tastes of her customers. In this way, she will be able to earn more income through her greater sales. She hopes to have a good experience with this new loan and wants to grow her business. She dreams of giving a good and quality education to her children through all her hard efforts in her business.

loans.use: to buy a stock of different clothes for the summer season.

loans.name: Sana

texts.en: Sana is a 23 year-old married woman and a mother of one son. She is striving hard to meet her family’s demands for food, clothing and heath. Her husband is employed in a small restaurant and his income is not sufficient to meet the daily expenditures of the family. That is why she started her business of stitching clothes to contribute in the family income. She is very familiar with the stitching techniques and enjoys a great client list. To cope with the increasing demands of her customers, she requested a loan of Rs 20,000 to buy a stock of threads in different colors along with the packs of buttons and needles. She expects boost in her earnings and wishes to spend the part of profits on the betterment of her family members' lives.

loans.use: to buy a stock of threads in different colors along with the packs of buttons and needles.

loans.name: Nazia

texts.en: Nazia is 40 years old and a vigorous lady. She has been stitching clothes for many years. She stitches for the people of her community and uses the income to support her entire family. However, due to lack of available funds she is unable to meet with the daily demands of her customers. For this reason she requested a loan of Rs 20,000 to Kashf Foundation. She intends to use this loan amount to buy more spools of threads in different colors with the packs of laces, zippers and buttons. It will allow her to stitch up more dresses on time which ultimately helps in generating more income for her. She expects a boost in her earnings and wishes to spend the part of income on the betterment of her family members' lives.

loans.use: to buy more spools of threads in different colors with the packs of laces, zippers and buttons.

loans.name: Shabiran

texts.en: Shabiran is a 42-year-old married woman. She has been successfully running a small general store from the corner of her house. She has one year of experience in this field. During this time she has become famous for providing good quality products. Her husband also assists her by purchasing stock from the market as he has maintained many contacts over the years. She is a mother of 5 children and is motivated to provide her family with good quality food, clothing and health. She wants to grow her business so she requested a loan of PKR 30,000 to buy packs of oil, biscuits and beverages to meet the increasing demand at her store. She is expecting a boost to her earnings and dreams of expanding her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy packs of oil, biscuits and beverages.

loans.name: Tabitha

texts.en: Tabitha is a 30 year old married woman. She has 2 children aged 1 and 4. She describes herself to be committed. She operates a charcoal store where she sells charcoal. She has been involved in this business for 4 years. Her business is located in a viable place and her primary customers are from humble backgrounds. She describes her biggest business challenge to be lack of enough capital to expand. She will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy more charcoal for resale. Her business goal is to open other branches within 5 years. She hopes that in the future, she will open a hotel. This is her first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy more charcoal for resale

loans.name: Sabiran

texts.en: Sabiran is a 51 year old married woman. She has efficiently run her business of milk sales for many years. She has four buffaloes and two calves. She looks after the buffaloes and performs the task of milking them while her husband sells it door-to-door on a daily basis.  By now she has become famous in her town for providing good quality milk. She is also involved in the business of animal sales to generate extra income. In order to increase milk sales, she needs to purchase another buffalo. For this reason she contacted Kashf foundation and applied for a loan of PKR 50,000. She has been in association with Kashf Foundation for seven years and has shown good repayment behavior. She hopes to increase her total production capacity of milk which ultimately will help in generating more cash.

loans.use: to purchase another buffalo.

loans.name: Hameed

texts.en: Hameed is a 42 year old married lady and has been running a small general store in her community for many years.  She offers a variety of grocery items at reasonable prices and has retained many customers who regularly shop at her store. She makes enough to provide for her family. To make her store fully stocked she requested a loan for PKR 40,000 which she will use to buy rice, sugar and flour from the market at lower rates. In this way she would be able to meet increasing demand consistently. She wishes to utilize part of her revenues to increase her business capital.

loans.use: to increase her stock of rice, sugar and flour.

loans.name: Chalni

texts.en: Chalni is a 54-year-old married woman. She has been running a business buying and selling animals for many years. She buys animals (baby goats and calves) at low prices, brings them up and then sells them in the market at higher prices near the occasion of Eid-ul-Azha (a religious event in Muslim countries). Her business is good enough to lead a decent life. For the improvement of her business she contacted Kashf foundation and applied for a loan of PKR 35,000 to purchase two more goats. She is in her 2nd loan cycle and has a good repayment history. She hopes to grow her business and dreams of providing a better standard of living to her family members.

loans.use: to purchase two more goats.

loans.name: Igor

texts.ru:
Игорь уже несколько раз пользовался финансовой помощью со стороны КИВА. В последний раз полученные от КИВА средства помогли Игорю увеличить доход на 3 000 гривен за счет увеличения товарооборота. Особых изменений в бизнесе не наблюдалось за последнее время. 
Игорю понадобилась сумма в размере 10 000 гривен для того, чтобы закупить юбки в качестве сезонного товара под реализацию осенью. За счет увеличения количества товарных единиц Игорь надеется увеличить также количество покупателей.
texts.en: Igor has already used Kiva's financial assistance a few times.  His last loan from Kiva helped him to increase his inventory, therefore allowing him to make an additional 3,000 hryvnia.  There has been no particular changes in his business recently.  Igor now needs a sum of 10,000 hryvnia to buy seasonal merchandise, such as skirts, for resale in the fall.  He hopes to increase his inventory and attract more customers.

loans.use: to purchase skirts wholesale.

loans.name: Mariya

texts.ru:
Мария – из Хуста. Она работает бухгалтером у частного предпринимателя на заправке. Мария – вдова, живет сама. Приходится нелегко, часто финансовое бремя оказывается очень тяжелым. Мария не может выделить крупную сумму, чтобы улучшить свои жилищные условия, хотя ее комната давно нуждается в ремонте. Дело в том, что два раза – в 1998 и в 2001 годах – в районе, где живет Мария, случались наводнения. После этих происшествий делался ремонт, но в некоторых местах штукатурка в комнате продолжает вздуваться.   
Сумма в 18 000 гривен понадобилась Марии для того, чтобы заменить пол в комнате, перештукатурить стены и сделать косметический ремонт в этой комнате, и, тем самым, наконец придать жилью достойный вид.
texts.en:
Mariya is from Khoost.  She works as an accountant for a private company (gas station).  She is a widow and lives alone.  She lives under difficult circumstances and often faces heavy financial difficulties.  

Although her living quarters have been in need of repair for a long time, Mariya doesn't have enough money to improve her living conditions.  The fact is that the area where she lives has suffered from floods twice in recent years (in 1998 and in 2001).  Repairs were performed after these events but the plaster in her living quarters is still peeling off in some places.  

Mariya needs 18,000 hryvnia to replace her floor, replaster her walls and perform additional repairs to finally have a decent place to live.

loans.use: to repair her house.

loans.name: Galina

texts.ru:
Предыдущую сумму, полученную от КИВА, Галина вложила в приобретение спальни для своей семьи. Покупкой осталась очень довольна, семье стало жить намного комфортнее. 
В этот раз она снова обратилась за финансовой поддержкой в размере 4 000 гривен для того, чтобы приобрести кухонную мебель в свой дом, так как старая уже практически разваливается на части.
texts.en:
Galina used a previous loan received from KIVA to buy some bedroom furniture for her family.  She has been very happy with this purchase, as her family's living conditions have become much more comfortable. 

She is once again applying for financial assistance, requesting 4,000 hryvnia to purchase some furniture for her kitchen because her old furniture is practically falling apart.

loans.use: to purchase kitchen furniture.

loans.name: Mejumaa

texts.en: Mejumaa operates a khanga (women wrap clothing) selling business. She sells to her town dwellers, passersby, and neighbors. She faces a major challenge of inflation in her business. With the KES 50,000, she wants to purchase two bales of khangas for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business. She appreciates the support from Yehu and Kiva at large.

loans.use: to purchase two bales of khangas (women wrap clothing) for resale.

loans.name: Vardan

texts.en: Vardan is 41 years old and he lives with his family in Kapan city. Vardan is married and he has four daughters. His elder daughter already works as a sales manager and his other three daughters are still school-aged. Vardan has no higher education and for many years until now he works as a welder. Sometimes he also does private paid welding works in his city, which is also some source of income for his big family. Lately Vardan and his wife became acquainted with their elder daughter’s fiancé, and they announced their marriage. So Vardan asks a loan of 900,000 Armenian drams in order properly to organize that wedding party, with great desire and hope to see their daughter lucky and happy with her future husband.

loans.use: to organize the eldest daughter's wedding party.

loans.name: Julio Enrique

texts.es:
Julio es un hombre de 23 años, es soltero, vive en la ciudad de Ica con sus padres y hermanos, el es una persona muy amable, trabajador y entusiasta, que dedica todos sus esfuerzos por salir adelante; lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos y por la necesidad de trabajar, Julio no ha podido estudiar la carrera de Ingeniería Civil que deseaba.
Por iniciativa propia, Julio trabaja como obrero de construcción en diversas obras de su ciudad, adicionalmente también maneja una mototaxi y brinda servicios de transporte, el trabaja todos los días por un aproximado de 10 horas y cree que le va bien por su buen desempeño y dedicación.
Julio se encuentra muy agradecido con los prestamistas Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada cubrirá los gastos de mantenimiento y reparación de su mototaxi, de esta manera podrá seguir usando su herramienta de trabajo y se esforzara para lograr su gran sueño de tener su casa propia.
texts.en:
Julio is 23 years old, single, and lives in the city of Ica with his parents and siblings. He is a kind, hard-working, and enthusiastic person who puts all his effort into progressing. Unfortunately, because of a lack of economic resources and because he needs to work, Julio hasn't been able to pursue the civil engineering degree he wanted to.

Julio works on his own initiative as a construction worker at different construction sites in his city. Additionally, he drives a motorcycle taxi, offering transportation services. He works every day for approximately 10 hours and he believes that it is going well because of his good performance and dedication. Julio is very grateful to the Kiva lenders, since their help will allow him to pay for the maintenance and repair of his motorcycle taxi. That way, he will be able to continue using his work equipment and he will strive to achieve his big dream of owning his own house.

loans.use: to pay for the maintenance and repair of his motorcycle taxi

loans.name: Elshan

texts.en:
Elshan, 28, is married and lives in the village of Karajala with his wife, two children, and brother. Elshan is a very hardworking, enthusiastic man who focuses all his efforts into getting ahead. Elshan works very hard on his own greenhouses where he grows various of vegetables during the year. His products are very good quality, and he sells his harvests among vegetable retailers. Besides this activity, he owns cows and sells calves seasonally. In addition, Elshan works as a constructor worker and renovates houses on special orders. He works hard all day long to provide his family members with a normal standard of living.

With the received loan, Elshan will purchase a cargo van to start a vegetable-selling business. He will transport his harvest to the capital city open market and sell them for a higher price. Elshan will also purchase fruit and vegetables in bulk at wholesale prices and make deliveries for selling them. The credit will significantly increase his family's income. It is obvious that the family's financial needs are significant, but Elshan will work hard to solve them and give their children a better life. He wants to thank all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase a cargo van to use in his new fruit and vegetable trading business.

loans.name: Tatyana

texts.ru:
Татьяна – из Виноградово. Она уже 8 лет торгует женской одеждой, а во время школьного года также реализует канцелярские товары. Работает сама, без наемных рабочих. 
Татьяне нужна сумма в 21 000 гривен для того, чтобы перед началом учебного года закупить канцелярские товары на реализацию. Полученные средства она планирует снова вложить в развитие бизнеса.
texts.en:
Tatyana is from Vinogradovo. She has been selling women's clothing for eight years now, and during the school season she also sells stationary supplies. She works alone without hired help.

Tatyana needs an amount of 21,000 hryvnia to purchase stationary supplies for sale before the school year starts. She plans to invest the profit into growing of her business.

loans.use: to purchase stationary supplies.

loans.name: Nadezhda

texts.ru:
Надежда из Хуста. Она работает в одном из местных санаториев бухгалтером. У Надежды есть сын. Они живут вместе в небольшом доме недалеко от центра города. В доме у нее три комнаты. Ремонт в комнатах Надежда сделала несколько лет тому назад. 
В этот раз Надежде необходимы дополнительные финансовые средства в размере 10 000 гривен для того, чтобы привести в порядок ванную комнату, сделав условия там удобными и комфортными. Надежда хочет объединить кладовку и ванную, увеличив тем самым размер ванной комнаты. Более того, Надежда хочет поставить насос для воды, так как в городе постоянно проблемы с водоснабжением.
texts.en:
Nadezhda is from Khoost. She works in one of the local spa resorts as an accountant. Nadezhda has a son. They live together in a small house not far from the city center. She has three rooms in the house. Nadezhda has done remodeling several years ago.

This time she needs additional funds in the amount of 10,000 hryvnia to remodel her bathroom and make it more comfortable to use. Nadezhda wants to combine a closet with the bathroom and by that increase the size of her bathroom. Moreover, Nadezhda wants to install a water pump because there are always shortages of water in the town.

loans.use: to remodel her bathroom.

loans.name: Joseph Ben's Group

texts.en:
Pictured here are primary school teachers from the southern city of Bo. They have come to SMT, a partner of Kiva.org, based in Makeni, Northern Sierra Leone to apply for a loan of SLL 13,100,000. With the help of this loan, these teachers will be able to meet their most immediate and most pressing financial needs. And at the end of each month, they can easily repay the loan, using their monthly salaries. It is their school’s bursar who is directly responsible for doing the deductions and making the repayments on their behalf.

Joseph is the featured leader of this group of teachers. Joseph is a native of Njala Konboya. He is married to a housewife and the couple has five children who are attending schools. Joseph has been a professional teacher for 33 years now. He has requested for this loan in order to pay the school fees for his children.

loans.use: to pay the school fees for his children.

loans.name: Dios Proveera Group

texts.es: El grupo está formado por tres socios emprendedores uno de ellos es Juana mujer de 29 años de edad, casada, con dos hijos menores de edad de 8 y 4 años. Su negocio es la venta de ropa ambulante en su  comarca desde hace 1 año. El crédito lo invertirá en comprar zapatos de diferentes estilos nacionales de varon y mujer y sandalias. Martha mujer de 33 años de edad su negocio es una pulpería ubicada en su domicilio y Mauricio hombre de 41 años de edad y su negocio es la venta de frutas.
texts.en:
The group is made up of three entrepreneurs. One of them is Juana who is 29 years old and is married with 2 children aged 8 and 4 years. She has been selling clothing as a street vendor in her region for the last year. 

She will use the loan to buy shoes in different national styles for men and women as well as sandals. 

Martha is 33 years old and runs a small grocery store in her home, and Mauricio is 41 years old and he has a business selling fruit.

loans.use: to buy close-toed shoes in different national styles for men and women and sandals.

loans.name: Artur

texts.en:
Artur is 42 years old and he lives in Kadjaran city. He is married and he has two sons. His wife works as a baker. Artur has no higher education, since after returning from army he has not completed his education at the polytechnic institute. Now Artur works at the copper and molybdenum combine in his city. He also has a private business: in a rented shop he sells wreaths. As Artur mentions, it is a profitable business and he thinks of its enlargements.
Artur asks a loan of 1,100,000 Armenian drams to buy a lot of flowers and other materials that he needs for making wreaths.

loans.use: to buy a lot of flowers and other materials for his wreath-selling business.

loans.name: Mimu

texts.en:
Mimu is a married mother of two children. She lives at her own house that has no electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for her children.

For the past three years, she has operated a clothes-selling business, selling door-to-door to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of the high cost of transportation. She dreams of expanding and establishing a boutique business in the future. 

With the loan that she is requesting of KES 50,000, she wants to purchase two bales of clothes for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase two bales of clothes for resale.

loans.name: Siranush

texts.en:
Siranush is 51 years old. She lives in very beautiful and nice city Dilijan. It is a perfect place with its green and huge forests, and the purest water in the district. As Siranush mentions, it seems to her that she lives in the most beautiful city in the world.  Siranush is married and she has five children. She has higher education and a specialty of economist-engineer. For many years, she has worked in her specialty, but now she works at the local school as an accountant. 

Siranush asks for a loan of 620,000 Armenian drams, since she needs to have dental treatment. She will be very grateful and pleased with this support and she thanks beforehand.

loans.use: to have dental treatment.

loans.name: Benkadi Group

texts.fr:
Constitué exclusivement de 4 femmes mariées, les membres de groupe BENKADI vivent égalitairement dans des familles traditionnelles et nucléaires avec une moyenne d’âge de 33 ans et 4enfants. Elles habitent toutes dans la ville de FAKOLA, quartier KOKO (3ème Région administrative du Mali) et se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et de mariage. 
Les membres du groupe font le petit commerce d’habillements, des galettes, d’atieké et des condiments. 
Dans le but d’augmenter leurs fonds de commerce, les membres du groupe ont intégré  Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 1er cycle de prêt solidaire.
Madame FANTA (1ère à droite assise sur la photo) est la vendeuse d’habits du groupe. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter,  5 pièces des pagnes de bazin  qu’elle teintera.
Elle s’approvisionne auprès des grossistes à Bamako et effectue ses  ventes en détail, au comptant et à crédit, à domicile et au marché, à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Madame compte réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel de 35.000 FCFA qui sera utilisé, pour être réinvesti dans l’activité et aider son mari dans  certaines dépenses familiales.
texts.en:
The members of the Benkadi group are married women who live in equality in traditional nuclear families. They have an average age of 33 and, on average, 4 children. They all live in the town of Fakola, in the Koko district (third administrative region of Mali) and got to know each other through family and neighbourly relationships, and marriage. The group members are small retailers of clothing, pancakes, attiéké (a dish made from fermented cassava couscous) and condiments. The members of the group decided to join Soro Yiriwaso in order to increase their working capital and are on their first group loan cycle.

Fanta (sitting on the right in the picture) sells clothing. She plans to use her loan to buy 5 bolts of damask cloth which she will dye. She gets her supplies from the wholesalers in Bamako and makes her sales for cash or credit, door-to-door and at the market, to a retail clientèle made up of men and women. Thanks to this loan, Fanta expects to make a monthly profit of 35 000 francs, part of which she will reinvest in her business, and part of which will be used to support her husband with some of the family expenses.

loans.use: to buy damask cloth for dyeing.

loans.name: Benkadi Group

texts.fr:
Constitué exclusivement de 4 femmes mariées, les membres de groupe BENKADI vivent dans des familles traditionnelles avec une moyenne d’âge de 43 ans et 3 enfants. Elles habitent toutes dans la ville de BOUGOULA (Préfecture  de la 3ème Région administrative du Mali) et se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et de mariage. 
Les membres du groupe font le petit commerce de friperie, des condiments et de la  restauration. 
Dans le but d’augmenter leurs fonds de commerce, les membres du groupe ont intégré  Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 6ème cycle de prêt solidaire.
Madame DJENEBOU (2ème à gauche sur la photo) est la restauratrice du groupe. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter : 100kilos  de riz et  4 paquet  de condiments.
Elle s’approvisionne auprès des grossistes à FAKOLA  et effectue ses  ventes en détail au comptant et à crédit, à domicile et au marché, à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
DJENEBOU compte réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel de 32.500 FCFA qui sera utilisé, pour être réinvesti dans l’activité et aider son mari dans  certaines dépenses familiales.
texts.en:
The 4 members of the Benkadi group are married women who live in traditional families and have an average age of 43 and, on average, 3 children. They all live in the town of Bougoula (a prefecture of the third administrative region of Mali) and got to know each other through family and neighbourly relationships, and marriage. The group members are small retailers of second-hand clothing, condiments and prepared food. The members of the group decided to join Soro Yiriwaso in order to increase their working capital and are on their 6th group loan cycle.

Djenebou (second from the left in the picture) sells prepared food. She plans to use her loan to buy 100 kilos of rice and 4 packets of condiments. She gets her supplies from the wholesalers in Fakola and makes her sales for cash or credit, door-to-door and at the market, to a retail clientèle made up of men and women. Thanks to this loan, Fanta expects to make a monthly profit of 32 500 francs, part of which she will reinvest in her business and part of which will be used to support her husband with some of the family expenses.

loans.use: to buy ingredients which with to prepare food for resale.

loans.name: Benkadi I Group

texts.fr:
Les membres du groupe BENKADI I sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de   27ans, 2 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles polygames à TOULOMADIO, un des villages  de KEBILA, Préfecture de KOLONDIEBA, 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur troisième prêt avec l’institution, les prêt passés ont été bien remboursés.
La spéculation cultivée est l’arachide  avec MAYAMOU 1ère à gauche sur la photo.
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter des intrants, la semence et payer les frais de labour pour exploiter 2 hectares. 
La production est vendue au niveau du village et  à   KEBILA  après la récolte à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 145.500FCFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The members of the Benkadi I group are married women with an average age of 27 years and, on average, 2 children. They all live in polygamous families in Toulomadio, one of the villages in Kebila, prefecture of Kolondieba, third administrative region of Mali. They are working with the Soro Yiriwaso microfinance institution in order to carry out their farming activities during the rainy season and are on their 3rd group loan. The previous loans have been properly repaid.

Mayamou (standing on the the left in the picture) grows groundnuts. She plans to use her loan to buy agricultural inputs and seeds and to pay the labourers needed to cultivate 2 hectares of farmland. After the harvest, the produce is sold in her village and in Kebila to a clientèle made up of men and women. She expects to make an average profit of 145 500 francs per crop cycle. This profit will allow her to repay her loan and also to support her husband with the daily expenses.

loans.use: to buy agricultural inputs and to pay labour wages.

loans.name: Robina

texts.en: Robina is a 49-year-old married lady and has run a small general store in her community for many years. She offers a variety of grocery items at a reasonable prices and has retained many customers who regularly shop at her store. She makes enough to provide for her family. To fully stock her store, she requested a loan for PKR 25,000 that she will use to buy a stock of rice, grains and flour from the market at lower rates. In this way, she would be able to meet the increasing demand consistently. She is in her third loan cycle and has shown good repayment behavior. She wishes to utilize a part of her revenues to increase her business capital.

loans.use: to buy a stock of rice, grains, and flour for her general store business.

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en: Fatuma is a married woman with four children all of whom attend school. She owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for her family. Fatuma sells cooked food from home to the general public. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. With the KES 50,000, she wants to purchase maize flour, wheat flour, rice and sugar for her business. She decided to join Yehu to get financial assistance to improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase maize flour, wheat flour, rice and sugar for her food production business.

loans.name: Francy Arley

texts.es: Arley es un hombre de 32 años de edad, casado y padre de 2 hijos de 7 y 10 años. Toda su vida productiva la ha dedicado a laborar como empleado en diferentes fincas de la región, realizando labores agropecuarias. Hace 4 años, con la experiencia que había obtenido en sus empleos, decidió iniciar su propio negocio, en la cría y engorde de cerdos para la venta, con el fin de generar sus ingresos de manera independiente, con lo que ha podido solventar las necesidades básicas de su hogar durante todo este tiempo.  Arley es un emprendedor, trabaja largas jornadas diarias y siempre está buscando opciones que le permitan sobrepasar todos los obstáculos que se le presentan por factores externos que a veces son incontrolables, como por ejemplo, la variación e inestabilidad del precio de la carne. Es por esta razón que solicita el apoyo del tercer ciclo de crédito, que será invertido en la compra de lechones de levante, además de insumos como vitaminas y concentrado para su alimentación. Esto le permitirá aumentar su producción y obtendrá mejor margen de ganancia por la venta, con lo cual podrá progresar y sacar adelante a su familia; además tendrá la posibilidad de cumplir el sueño de tener una producción escalonada, para tener ingresos más estables mensualmente y así, mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia y ofrecer mejor educación a sus hijos.
texts.en: Arley is 32 years old, married, and has two children, aged 7 and 10. He has been working as a farmer all his life, in the employ of various farms in his areas. Four years ago, building on the experience acquired during those jobs, he decided to start his own business, namely the raising and fattening of pigs to sell. His goal is to earn an independent income, and he has succeeded to pay for basic household expenses since he started. Arley is full of enterprising spirit: he works long hours every day and is always looking for the best way to overcome obstacles, since setbacks can be caused by external factors wholly out of his control, one example being the fluctuations in meat prices. This is why Arley asks for his third loan with the field partner. He will use the funds to buy piglets to fatten, as well as supplies such as vitamins and feed. This will enable him to increase his production and to have a better profit margin, that he will put towards improving his business and giving his family a better life. It will also get him closer to his dream, which is to raise piglets all year round, in order to have a more stable monthly income to improve his family's standard of living and give his children a better education.

loans.use: to buy piglets to fatten, as well as supplies such as vitamins and feed.

loans.name: Sarabubu

texts.ru: Сарабюбю 52 года, вдова, воспитывает 2 детей (1 дочь, 1 сын). После смерти супруга, Сарабюбю очень долго не могла пережить утрату близкого человека. Нужно было воспитывать и ставить на ноги детей и Сарабюбю решила взять хозяйство и материальную ответственность в свои руки. Сарабюбю имеет среднее образование. Соседи отзываются о ней как о предприимчивой и хозяйственной женщине. Старшая дочь работает журналистом, сын-студент. Дочь помогает материально матери, высылая свою зарплату ежемесячно. Сарабюбю в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи, с 1994 года занимается животноводством и полеводством, начав этот бизнес с 10,000 сом (KGS). Благодаря упорному труду Сарабюбю в хозяйстве имеется: 2 дойные коровы, 1 бычок, 4 овцы, а также имеет земельный надел размером 0,72 ГА, на которой выращивает ячмень. Ее сельхоздеятельность приносит около 9,000 сом (KGS) в месяц, от продажи молока и от перепродажи бычков, что служит основой для покрытия расходов на питание и бытовые нужды семьи. Доходы от хозяйства позволили Сарабюбю вырастить и обустроить детей. В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Сарабюбю обратилась в Микрофинансовый банк «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 120,000 сом (KGS) на покупку бычков для дальнейшего откорма и перепродажи. Доходы от кредита Сарабюбю планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение своего хозяйства, а также, намерена вложить доходы на дальнейшее обучение сына.
texts.en:
Sarabubu is a 52-year-old widow who is raising two children (one daughter, one son).  After the death of her husband, Sarabubu did not have a long time to get over the loss of a loved one.  She had to raise her children to stand on their own two feet, so she decided to take the household and financial responsibilities into her own hands.  Sarabubu has a high school education.  Her neighbors see her as an enterprising and capable woman.  Her elder daughter works as a journalist and her son is a student.  Her daughter helps her mother make ends meet every month.  

Sarabubu raises livestock and grows crops, which have been the family's main source of income since 1994.  She started this business with 10,000 som (KGS), and thanks to her hard work, her farm now has two dairy cows, one bull, four sheep and she also has a .72 hectare plot of land on which she grows barley.  Her business bring her about 9,000 som (KGS) per month from the sale of milk and calves, which covers the basic costs of food and household needs for her family.  

The income from the farm has allowed Sarabubu to raise and provide for her children.  With the goal of developing her business further, Sarabubu has turned to the microfinance bank "Bai Tushum and Partners" for a loan of 120,000 som (KGS) to buy calves to raise and resell.  She plans to invest the income from this loan back into her farm, and also to pay for her son's future education.

loans.use: to buy calves

loans.name: Ashurkhon

texts.ru: Ашурхон является преподователем информатики, а также опытной портнихой, работающей и проживающей в городе Исфара. Ей 40 лет. У нее есть муж, сын и дочь. Дети учатся в школе, а муж работает мигрантом в России. У Ашурхон высшее техническое образование. Она в течение 6 лет преподает предмет информатики в медицинской школе. Одновременно последние два года она занимается шитьем. Ашурхон за неделю вышивает семь женских национальных платьев. Она довольна своими работами. Она любит преподавать и шить. Сейчас Ашурхон хочет расширить деятельность. Она просит кредит для покупки компьютера в свой учебный класс, а также швейной машинки и тканей для шитья.
texts.en: Ashurkhon is a lecturer of computer science and she is also an experienced dressmaker in her city of Isfara.  She is 40 years old and she has a husband, a son and a daughter.  Her children are still in school and her son is a migrant worker in Russia.  Ashurkhon has a higher technical education.  For six years she has been teaching computer science at the medical school.  At the same time she has been working as a dressmaker for the last two years.  In one week, Ashurkhon can sew seven national dresses.  She is satisfied with her work - she loves to teach and sew.  Now Ashurkhon would like to expand her business.  She is asking for a loan to buy a computer for her classroom, as well as a sewing machine and fabric for the dresses.

loans.use: to buy a computer, a sewing machine and fabric to expand her business.

loans.name: Orzijon

texts.ru: Орзижон 43 года, замужем, мать -героиня, воспитывает 6 детей (2 дочери, 4 сына). Орзижон имеет среднее образование. Супруг инвалид. Дети помогают по хозяйству. Семья очень большая и дружная, отношения в семье очень хорошие. 2 старших сына находятся на заработках в России, материально помогают родителям, высылая свою зарплату ежемесячно, остальные дети школьного и дошкольного возраста. Орзижон в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи, с 1990 года занимается животноводством и полеводством, начав этот бизнес с 2,000 сом (KGS). Благодаря упорному труду Орзижон в хозяйстве имеется: 1 дойная корова и 13 овец, а также имеет земельный надел размером 0,72 ГА, на которой выращивает картофель, подсолнух и кукурузу. Ее сельхоздеятельность приносит около 12,000 сом (KGS) в месяц, от продажи молока, перепродажи скота, что служит основой для покрытия расходов на питание и бытовые нужды семьи. Доходы от хозяйства позволили Орзижон поднять уровень жизни. В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Орзижон обратилась в Микрофинансовый банк «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS) на покупку бычков. Доходы от кредита Орзижон планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение своего хозяйства, а также, в будущем намерена сделать ремонт своего дома.
texts.en:
Orizjon is 43 years old, married, and a "hero-mother" who is raising six children (two daughters and four sons).  Orizjon has a high school education, her husband is disabled and the children help her around the house.  Their family is big and friendly, and their family ties are very strong.  The two elder sons are migrant workers in Russia, and they help their parents by sending money home on a monthly basis.  The rest of the children are still in school and pre-school.

As the main source of income for the family, Orzijon has been involved in agriculture and raising livestock since 1990.  She started this business with 2,000 som (KGS) and thanks to her hard work, her farm now has one dairy cow and 13 sheep, as well as a .72 hectare plot of land on which she grows potatoes, sunflowers and corn.  Her farm brings in about 12,000 som (KGS) per month from the sale of milk and livestock, and it is enough to provide food and household items for the family.  The income from her farm has allowed Orzijon to improve her standard of living.  With the goal of developing her business further, Orzijon has turned to the microcredit bank "Bai Tushum and Partners" for a loan of 100,000 som (KGS) to buy calves.  She plans to reinvest the income from the loan back into her farm, and she intends to make repairs on her home in the future.

loans.use: to buy calves

loans.name: Shakhzada

texts.ru: Шахзаде 41 год, замужем, воспитывает 4 детей. Шахзада  имеет среднее образование. Соседи отзываются о ней как о старательной и и трудолюбивой женщине. Супруг и дети активно помогают по хозяйству. Шахзада в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи, с 1999 года занимается животноводством и полеводством, начав этот бизнес с 6,000 сом (KGS). Опыт в разведении и содержании скота, а также в обработке земли очень большой. Благодаря упорному труду Шахзады, в хозяйстве у нее имеется: 1 дойная корова, 2 теленка и 7 овец, а также имеет земельный надел размером 2,0 ГА, на которой выращивает кукурузу, подсолнух и картофель. Ее сельхоздеятельность приносит около 15,000 сом (KGS) в месяц, что служит основой для покрытия расходов на питание и бытовые нужды семьи. Доходы от хозяйства позволили Шахзаде улучшить благосостояние семьи. В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Шахзада обратилась в Микрофинансовый банк «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 30,000 сом (KGS) на покупку овец для откорма и перепродажи. Доходы от кредита Шахзада планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение своего хозяйства, а также, в будущем намерена сделать ремонт дома, в котором проживает вместе со своей семьей.
texts.en: Shakhzada is 41 years old and is married with four children.  She has a high school education and her neighbors see her as an enterprising and hard-working woman.  Her husband and children actively help her around the house.  As the main source of income from her family, Shakhzada has been involved in agriculture and raising livestock since 1999.  She started this business with 6,000 som (KGS).  She has a lot of experience in breeding and raising livestock and also in working the land.  Thanks to her hard work, Shakhzada now has one dairy cow, two calves and seven sheep on her farm, as well as a two-hectare plot of land on which she grows corn, sunflowers and potatoes.  Her farm brings in about 15,000 som (KGS) per month, which is enough to pay for the food and household goods for her family.  Shakhzada is trying to increase her farm's income to help her family.  With the goal of developing her business further, she turned to the microfinance bank "Bai Tushum and Partners" for a loan of 30,000 som (KGS) to buy sheep to raise and resell.  Shakhzada plans to reinvest the income from this loan back into her farm, and she also has plans to make repairs on her home, where she lives with her family.

loans.use: to buy sheep

loans.name: Shamsudin

texts.ru: Шамсудин житель района Дж.Руми юго-западной части Таджикистана. Ему 42 года. Он женат и имеет шестерых детей. Шамсудин зарабатывает на жизнь шофером. У него грузовая машина КАМАЗ, на которой он развозит грузы по месту назначения. Это очень трудная и утомительная работа. Шамсудин хочет сейчас начать бизнес по откорму и продаже крупно-рогатого скота. Он заинтересован в этом бизнесе, так как это прибыльный бизнес и не требует тяжелой работы. У него во дворе дома имеется двухэтажный сарай для содержания скота размером 20х4,5 метра, а также 50 вязок сена. Шамсудин планирует каждый месяц закупать, откармливать и продавать по 4-х голов скота. Чтобы начать бизнес Шамсудин запрашивает кредит в размере 1500 долларов США. На сумму кредита он собирается купить 4-х бычков и телят. На полученную прибыль в будущем он хочет провести ремонт в своем доме и улучшить условия быта.
texts.en: Shamsudin lives in the Rumi region in the southwestern part of Tajikistan.  He is 42 years old and he is married with six children.  Shamsudin works as a driver.  He has a KAMAZ truck in which he transports goods to their destination.  Is is very hard and tiresome work.  Shamsudin wants to start a business raising and selling cows and bulls.  He is interested in this business because it is lucrative and it doesn't require hard work.  At his home, he has a two-story barn (20x4.5 meters) in which to keep livestock and 50 bales of hay.  Shamsudin plans to buy, raise and sell four head of livestock every month.  To start his business, he is asking for a loan of $1,500.  With the money from that loan, he can buy four head of calves and bulls.  He wants to use the income from this business to make repairs to his home and improve his standard of living.

loans.use: to buy four head of steer and calves to start a livestock business.

loans.name: Musavara

texts.ru: Мусавара молодая незамужняя девушка в возрасте 21 года. Она живет с родителями и двумя братьями в районе Хамадони. Ее отец является пенсионером, мать домохозяйкой, а старший брат находится на заработках в загранице. Мусавара сама зарабатывает на жизнь. Она несмотря на молодой возраст, имеет свой бизнес. Мусавара вот уже два года как занимается продажей ювелирных изделий. Ее точка продажи находится на центральном рынке района. Мусавара продает золотые национальные серьги, кольца и цепочки. Ее бизнес хорошо продвигается и приносит ей хороший доход. Мусавара нуждается в кредите для развития бизнеса. Она на сумму кредита хочет увеличить ассортимент золотых изделий, чтобы привлечь больше количества клиентов и таким образом увеличить товарооборот. Часть прибыли с бизнеса она будет откладывать на свою свадьбу.
texts.en: Musavara is a young unmarried woman.  She is 21 years old and she lives with her parents and two brothers in the Hamadoni region.  Her father is retired, her mother is a homemaker and her elder brother is a migrant worker abroad.  Musavara works to earn her own living.  Despite her young age, she has her own business; for two years she has been selling gold jewelry.  Her trading stall is located in the central market of her region.  Musavara sells gold earrings in the national style, rings and necklaces.  Her business is steady and brings her a good income, but she needs a loan to help her increase her business.  With the money from her loan, she hopes to increase her assortment of gold jewelry to bring in more clients and to increase her turnover.  Musavara plans to set aside part of her earnings for her wedding.

loans.use: to buy gold jewelry to sell in hopes of increasing her business.

loans.name: Faith

texts.en:
Faith is a divorced woman with one child who goes to school. She lives in a rental house that has both electricity and piped water. She cites food as her greatest monthly expense.

Faith sells leso women's wrap clothing. Her business has been operational for the last three years. Her potential clients are neighbors and town dwellers. She cites seasonality as a challenge in her business.

With the KES 20,000, Faith wants to purchase 60 pairs of shoes, materials and leso women's wrap clothing for resale. She decided to join Yehu to acquire financial assistance

loans.use: to purchase 60 pairs of shoes, materials and leso women's wrap clothing for resale.

loans.name: Ronah

texts.en:
Ronah is a client who is married to her husband, Rashid. She and her husband reside in the town of Rubaare where she operates a shop that sells soft drinks. 

Ronah has a challenge with having enough space and she also lacks a refrigerator. Since her competitors have the advantage, she has applied for UGX 1,800,000 to enable her to buy a refrigerator, which she will use to store her soft drinks for her customers. This will help her to make more sales and successfully compete with the other sellers. 

Her good customer service is a sure way of making more sales after she buys the refrigerator. Ronah thanks Ugafode and the Kiva lenders for contributing to her business success.

loans.use: To buy a refrigerator for her soft drinks store.

loans.name: Furaha

texts.en:
Furaha operates a fish-selling business. She mentioned seasonality as a challenge in the business and she dreams of becoming a wholesaler of fish in the future. 

Again she comes to you requesting a loan of Kshs 50,000 to purchase four sacks of fish to sell and to cover the cost of transport to her place of work. She joined Yehu to access loans to boost her business and she appreciates the support.

loans.use: to purchase four sacks of fish to sell and to cover the cost of transport to her place of work.

loans.name: Harriet

texts.en:
Harriet is 29 years old and lives in the town of Mpigi in the Kampala North region of Uganda. She is single and has three children, with two of them currently in school. For the past five years, Harriet has been working hard to manage her retail shop, which sells sugar, soap and salt. 

To help expand her business, Harriet has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more essential commodities like milk, bread, sugar and soap for resale, and it will help Harriet to generate greater profits and pay school fees for her children and other family needs. Harriet hopes that in the future she will be able to expand the business into a wholesale shop. 

Harriet is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Harriet who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more essential commodities like milk, bread, sugar and soap for resale.

loans.name: Teresa De Jesus

texts.es: Teresa es originaria de la ciudad de León. Es casada y madre de tres hijos. Es de oficio comerciante, se dedica a la venta de tortilla y frijoles desde hace seis años. Tiene como otra fuente de ingreso trabajo de albañilería que realiza su esposo lo cual es de mucha ayuda para gastos del hogar. Solicita el préstamo para comprar materia prima al por mayor como: maíz y frijoles con el fin de elaborar tortillas y frijoles cocidos. Comercializa sus productos de manera ambulante en diferentes puntos de la ciudad y en su hogar. Su meta futuro es mejorar la infraestructura de su casa para tener mejor calidad de vida. Su plan próximo es cancelar el crédito y seguir trabajando con el financiamiento que le otorga kiva a través de MiCredito.
texts.en:
Teresa is originally from the city of León. She is married and has three children. Teresa is a saleswoman; she has been selling tortillas and beans for six years. Her husband works as a mason, which represents an additional source of income for the family and helps her cover the home expenses.

Teresa is requesting a loan to buy ingredients in bulk, such as corn and beans, in order to prepare tortillas and cooked beans. She works as a street vendor in different spots in the city and at home. Her goal for the future is to make some home improvements to have a better quality of life. In the short term, she will pay the loan and continue working with the financial support she receives from Kiva through MiCredito.

loans.use: to buy ingredients in bulk, such as corn and beans.

loans.name: Pamela

texts.en:
Pamela is a married woman and has been blessed with two kids who attend school. She lives at her own house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees. 

She operated a fish-selling business, which has been operational for over two years. She mentioned seasonality as a challenge in the business. She dreams of becoming a wholesaler of fish in the future. 

With the Kshs 20,000 Pamela wants to purchase sacks of fish for resale. She joined Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of fish for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy feed for her cows.

loans.name: Asha

texts.en:
Asha is thankful for the previous loan, which helped her to buy beauty products for her business.

Here again she comes to you requesting a loan of KES 50,000 to buy shampoo, conditioner, hair braids and to repair her blow-dry machine, which was spoilt. She appreciates the help.

loans.use: to buy shampoo, conditioner, hair braids and to repair her blow-dry machine.

loans.name: Michael

texts.en:
Michael is a 48-year-old married man. He has three children with ages ranging from 18 years to 25 years. He describes himself as determined. 

He operates a farm where he keeps dairy cows and poultry and also does farming. He has been involved in this business for 10 years. His business is located in a good area  and his primary customers are local residents. He describes his biggest business challenge as lack of enough funds to boost business. 

He will use the KES 50,000 loan to buy animal feeds, fertilizers, seeds and other farm inputs. His business goal is to be a large-scale producer of farm products within five years. This is his first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy animal feeds, fertilizers, seeds and other farm inputs.

loans.name: Kashi

texts.en:
Kashi operates a charcoal selling business, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby. She faces stiff competition from other charcoal operators in her business.
 
With the KES 50,000, she wants to purchase sacks of charcoal for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business and she appreciates the support.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of charcoal for resale.

loans.name: Ismael

texts.es:
Ismael tiene 67 años de edad, es casado y es padre de 6 hijos.  Desde muy pequeño se dedico al trabajo agrícola, siempre en compañía de su padre y sus hermanos a la edad de 16 años falleció su padre y siendo el mayor tomo la responsabilidad de sus demás hermanos, trabajando propio y ajeno con  mucho esfuerzo tenían unos bueyes con los que trabajaba y llevar el alimento diario a su familia.

A sus 23 años se caso pero siempre ayudaba a su madre. De su matrimonio tuvieron  6 hijos ya todos en la actualidad ya tienen su propia familia, 4 de ellos trabajan con él en la agricultura cultivando 28,000 metros cuadrados de maíz en compañía de sus hijos ya que ellos tienen su propio hogar y solo vive con su esposa.


El lugar en donde el cultiva esta  a 1 kilómetro de su casa todos los días tiene que madrugar para terminar todo el trabajo que es necesario en el cultivo, en ocasiones trabaja el día completo y hasta por las noches tiene que desvelarse, debido a que hay algunas plagas que llegan de noche. Los 28,000 metros cuadrados,  las trabaja con sus 4 hijos  ellos lo hacen en menores proporciones; pero le ayudan a su padre ya que él, les proporciona las tierras para trabajar.

Los fondos del crédito serán utilizados para la compra de insumos agrícolas; abonos, fertilizantes, pago de mosos y para preparar la tierra para el cultivo, se espera favorecer mejor el cultivo de maíz y lograr al final de la cosecha una mayor producción y tener mejores ingresos para él y su esposa.

 Con mucho esfuerzo y trabajo desea construir una mejor vivienda, poseer un pequeño ahorro comprando animales bovinos, a través de las ganancias que tenga en la agricultura.
texts.en:
Ismael is 67 years old and is married with 6 children. He has worked in agriculture from a young age, always working alongside his father and siblings. When he was 16 years old his father died and, being the oldest, Ismael took on responsibility for his other siblings, working on his own and other people's land. With a great deal of effort he worked with their oxen to provide the daily food for his family.

When Ismael was 23 he got married but he still helped his mother out. During his marriage he had 6 children who all have families of their own now. Four of them work with him in agriculture, growing 28,000 square metres of corn together. Ismael lives with just his wife, as his family all have their own homes.

The land where he works is 1km from his home and he has to get up early every day to get through all the necessary cultivation tasks. Sometimes he works all day and even has to stay up all night, since there are some pests which come at night. He works the 28,000 square metres with his children. They do a smaller proportion of the work but they help him as he has provided them with land to work on.

The loan will be used to buy agricultural supplies (manure, fertilisers), to pay for farmhands and to prepare the land for cultivation. Ismael hopes to improve his corn crop and manage to produce a bigger harvest so he can have a better income for himself and his wife.

With a lot of hard work and determination he wants to build a better house and to save a small amount of money from the profits he makes in agriculture to buy cattle.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies (manure, fertilisers), to pay for farmhands and to prepare the land for cultivation.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy materials to produce clothes.

loans.name: James

texts.en:
James is a 37-year-old married man. He has three children with ages ranging from one and a half years to 8 years. He describes himself as determined. 

He operates a welding store where he makes and sells metallic doors, gates and windows. He has been involved in this business for seven years. His business is located in an area good for business and his primary customers are local residents. He describes his biggest business challenge as lack of enough money to boost business. 

He will use the KES 20,000 loan to add stock of metal bars to make doors, windows and other items. His business goal is to grow to a big welding workshop within five years. He hopes that in the future, he will earn higher returns. This is his first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to add stock of metal bars to make doors, windows and other items.

loans.name: Judy

texts.en:
Judy is a 23-year-old single woman. She describes herself as determined. 

She operates a boutique where she sells clothes. She has been involved in this business for 1 year. Her business is located in a market  and her primary customers are small-scale buyers. 

She will use the KES 20,000 loan to add stock of clothes for resale. Her business goal is to run a stable wholesale within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will have a stable business. This is her first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to add stock of clothes for resale.

loans.name: Rotich

texts.en:
Rotich is a 29-year-old married man. He has one child. He describes himself as focused. 

He operates a retail shop where he sells household goods such as sugar, cooking oil, wheat flour, etc. He has been involved in this business for three years. His business is located in a shopping centre and his primary customers are small-scale buyers. He describes his biggest business challenge as small capital. 

He will use the KES 50,000 loan to add stock of sugar, maize and wheat flour, cooking oil and other items. His business goal is to operate as a wholesale within five years. He hopes that in the future, he will lead a good life. This is his third loan with SMEP DTM. Previous loans were repaid successfully.

loans.use: to add stock of sugar, maize and wheat flour, cooking oil and other items.

loans.name: Gustavo Adolfo

texts.es:
El señor Gustavo vive en un barrio de Danli, al oriente de Honduras, vive junto a su esposa y sus 2 hijos.
Don Gustavo su fuente principal de ingresos proviene de su negocio, se dedica a la venta de papas fritas, yuca, tajaditas de plátano con repollo, papitas de pollo, etc. vende en una carreta acondicionada para la venta de sus productos, se coloca a la orilla del boulevard donde transita mayor número de personas.
Don Gustavo está solicitando el crédito para la compra de repollo, queso, plátanos, salsas, papas, yuca, etc.  Porque quiere abastecerse de insumos y así estar preparado para el festival del maíz que es el evento clave para mejorar sus ventas y obtener mejores ganancias, tiene 10 años de dedicarse a este negocio, es una persona muy amable, luchadora, dinámico lo que le ha permitido seguir adelante con su negocio y captar más clientes, uno de los deseos que  tiene es tener su negocio bien establecido y su propia casa. 


 
Danli, Honduras  - Julio 2013
texts.en:
Gustavo lives in a neighborhood of Danli, Eastern Honduras, together with his wife and two children. His main source of income is his business; he sells fried potatoes, cassava, plantain slices with cabbage, potatoes with chicken, etc. He customized a cart to sell his products and stands in a boulevard where many people pass by.

Gustavo is requesting a loan to buy cabbage, cheese, plantain, sauces, potatoes, cassava, etc. He wants to have enough supplies now that the Corn Festival is coming, a key event to improve his sales and make better profits. He has been doing this for ten years. He is a kind, persistent and dynamic person, something that has helped him get ahead with his business and attract more customers. One of his biggest wishes is to have a well-established business and to have a house of his own.

Danli, Honduras – July 2013.

loans.use: to buy cabbage, cheese, plantain, sauces, potatoes, cassava, etc.

loans.name: Mwanarusi

texts.en:
Mwanarusi is married. She owns a house that has no electricity or piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are household consumables.

For over five years, she has operated an open-air food-selling business, selling from home to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her place of business. 

With the 50,000 Kenyan shillings, she wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, tea leaves, and cooking fat. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, tea leaves, and cooking fat.

loans.name: Asha

texts.en:
Asha is very grateful for the previous loan that enabled her to stock her clothing business, and thus, generated profits she used to improve her living standards and even open a food selling business.

She is requesting 100,000 Kenyan shillings to purchase more bales of khangas (women's wrap clothes) and buy wheat flour, rice, maize flour and cooking oil for resale. She joined Yehu to get financial benefit.

loans.use: to purchase more bales of khangas (women's wrap clothes) and buy wheat flour, rice, maize flour and cooking oil for resale.

loans.name: La Florida Group

texts.es: El grupo  “La Florida” está  conformada por 07 mujeres emprendedoras que pasan a su 7mo ciclo, siendo la gran mayoría de ellos vecinos de la zona. Augusta unas de las integrantes casada con 02 hijos independientes. A sus 55 años de edad Augusta se siente feliz pues  ha logrado mejorar su vivienda y mantener el negocio. Actualmente se dedica a la venta de prendas de vestir, lo cual lo realiza en un mercado. Negocio que le ha generado ingresos para su hogar. Su último crédito lo destinará para la compra de casacas y chompas. Su mayor deseo es de comprar su propio stand, pues actualmente lo alquila. El grupo “La Florida” agradece el crédito brindado, pues hace posible su progreso. Augusta se encuentra en la parte posterior es la primera del lado derecho y viste polo blanco y casaca azul.
texts.en: The group “La Florida” is made up of 7 enterprising women that are in their 7th loan cycle, the majority of them being residents of the area.  Augusta is one of the members.  She is married with 2 independent children.  At her 55 years of age Augusta feels happy as she has managed to improve her home and maintain her business.  Currently she works selling clothing items which she does in a market.  The business has generated income for her household.  Her latest loan will go to the purchase of jackets and sweaters.  Her greatest desire is to purchase her own stand as she currently rents one.  The group “La Florida” is grateful for the loan provided as it makes their progress possible.  Augusta is the first on the right side in the back row and is wearing a white shirt and blue jacket.

loans.use: to buy sweaters and jackets.

loans.name: Lita

texts.es: Lita, de 50 años de edad, está casada con Tolentino y tiene 5 hijos de los cuales cuatro ya son mayores de edad e independientes, por está razón solo vive con una de ellas en su casa propia. Lita se dedica a la venta de comidas. Realiza esta función en su casa en donde ha acondicionado un espacio cómodo para atender a sus clientes. Lleva realizando este trabajo desde hace aproximandamente 7 años en este negocio y durante este tiempo trabaja con la ayuda de su hija. Le esta yendo muy bien y genera buenas ventas diarias por tanto tiene buenos ingresos económicos los cuales utiliza para cubrir las principales necesidades de su familia, desde hace un tiempo ha comenzado a expandir su negocio y ahora trabaja también vendiendo desayunos en las mañanas motivo por el cual se le hace necesario adquirir algunos artículos de calidad y otros accesorios que requiere en su cocina para continuar preparando sus alimentos y así brindar una mejor atención al público. En esta oportunidad solicitará S/. 2000, está muy contenta por el apoyo financiero que recibe para seguir adelante, además se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual. Con el monto solicitado comprará ingredientes e insumos al por mayor como arroz, aceite, azúcar, fideos, tubérculos y condimentos para continuar preparando sus comidas.
texts.en: Lita is 50 years old. She is married to Tolentino and has 5 children. Four of them are already grown and on their own, so she lives with one of them in her own house. Lita sells food. She does this in her house, where she has set up a comfortable space to serve her customers. She has been doing this work for approximately 7 years and during that time has worked with her daughter's help. It has been going well for her and it generates daily sales, so she has good income. She uses the income to pay for her family's basic needs. For some time, she has begun to expand her business and now she also sells breakfasts in the morning. This has made it necessary to acquire some quality items and other accessories she needs in her kitchen to continue making her food and thus offer better service to the public. At this time, she is asking for S/. 2000. She is very happy with the financial support she is receiving to get ahead. She is also committed to making her payments on time. With the amount she has asked for, she will buy ingredients and materials wholesale, such as rice, oil, sugar, pasta, tubers and seasonings to keep preparing her food.

loans.use: to buy products such as rice, oil, pasta, tubers and seasonings.

loans.name: Linet

texts.en:
Linet is a 24-year-old married woman. She has two children with ages 1 year and 6 years. She describes herself as competitive. 

She operates a clothes stall where she sells second-hand clothes. She has been involved in this business for three years. Her business is located in a fairly good area and her primary customers are the general public. She describes her biggest business challenge as lack of capital. 

She will use the KES 20,000 loan to add stock of clothes for resale. Her business goal is to be prosperous within five years.

loans.use: to add stock of clothes for resale.

loans.name: Eunice

texts.en:
Eunice is a 34-year-old married woman. She has four children with ages ranging from 4 years to 16 years. She describes herself as kind. 

She operates a poultry farm where she rears chickens for eggs and also for meat. She has been involved in this business for six years. Her business is located in an urban area and her primary customers are the general public. She describes her biggest business challenge as chicken diseases, which affect production.

She will use the KES 20,000 loan to add more chickens and also buy feeds. Her business goal is to expand within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will be happy. This is her first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to add more chickens and also buy feeds.

loans.name: Richard

texts.en:
Richard is a 35-year-old married man. He has three children with ages ranging from 2 years to 9 years. He describes himself as honest. 

He operates a butchery where he sells meat. He has been involved in this business for 15 years. His business is located in an urban area and his primary customers are the general public. He describes his biggest business challenge as interferences by city council. He will use the KES 20,000 loan to add stock of meat for resale. His business goal is to own three more outlets within five years. He hopes that in the future, he will be successful. 

This is his fourth loan with SMEP DTM. Previous loans were paid successfully.

loans.use: to add stock of meat for resale.

loans.name: Meswalehe

texts.en:
Meswalehe has operated a food selling business, selling from home to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of price fluctuation of her business products. She dreams of establishing a hotel in the future. 

With the 40,000 Kenyan shillings, she wants to purchase three bundles of wheat flour, cooking fat and sugar. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business, and she appreciates the support.

loans.use: to purchase three bundles of wheat flour, cooking fat and sugar.

loans.name: Shosi

texts.en:
Shosi is married with two school-going children. He lives in his own house that has electricity but not piped water. His greatest monthly expense is food.

He owns rental houses, and he has been in this business for 10 years. His major challenge is renovation. He is requesting a loan of 100,000 Kenyan shillings to renovate his rental houses. He joined Yehu to get financial support.

loans.use: to renovate his rental houses.

loans.name: Gladys

texts.en:
Gladys is married, and she lives at a rental house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food.

For the past one year, she has operated a clothes selling business, selling from door to door to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of the high cost of transportation. She dreams of expanding and establishing a boutique business in the future. 

With the loan that she is requesting of 40,000 Kenyan shillings, she wants to purchase two bales of clothes for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase two bales of clothes for resale.

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma is a divorced mother of five children. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past five years, she has operated a cashew nuts selling business, selling at wholesale to local neighbors. She faces a major challenge of the high cost of transportation in the business. She dreams of establishing a vegetable stall in the future.

With the 30,000 Kenyan Shillings, she wants to purchase sacks of cashew nuts for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of cashew nuts for resale.

loans.name: Maria  Del Carmen

texts.es: Maria de 35 años de edad es una persona responsable, trabajadora y honesta se dedica a la agricultura desde hace 20 años su principal siembra es el maíz y frijol, comercializa sus productos en los mercados que están cerca de su lugar de residencia con las ganancias que obtiene de sus ventas logra solventar algunos gasto de su hogar, vive en casa propia con su esposo y su seis hijos ellos estudian actualmente, Maria está solicitando un crédito para la compra de abonos, semillas, fertilizantes, controles de plaga, herbicidas, etc. para seguir con su cosecha y darle a su familia una mejor estabilidad económica sin limitaciones algunas.
texts.en:
Maria, 35 years old, is a responsible, hardworking and honest person who has worked in agriculture for 20 years.  Her main crops are corn and beans.  She sells her products in the markets that are near her place of residence.  With the earnings that she obtains from her sales she manages to cover some of the household expenses.  She lives in her own house with her husband and her six children who currently attend school.  

Maria is requesting a loan for the purchase of manure, seeds, fertilizers, pesticides, herbicides, etc., to continue with her harvest and to give her family better financial stability without any limitations.

loans.use: to buy manure, seeds, fertilizers, pesticides, herbicides, etc.

loans.name: Pedro

texts.es: Don Pedro de 43 años de edad, vive en casa propia, junto a su esposa y tres hijos, él se dedica al cultivo de maíz, frijol, y maicillo, desde hace 10 años es una persona responsable, honesta, trabajadora y luchadora con ganas de superarse, es muy conocido por su amabilidad, y buen carácter, sus cultivos son muy demandados pos clientes por su buena calidad y excelentes precios, de esta forma ha logrado solventar algunos de sus gastos y los de su familia, don Pedro solicita un crédito  para insumos agrícolas como semillas, abonos, fertilizantes, herramientas etc. Para poder obtener mayores ingresos y mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Pedro is 43 years old. He lives with his wife and 3 children in a house that they own. 

For the past 10 years he has earned a living cultivating corn, beans and sorghum. He is a responsible, honest, hard-working and determined individual with a desire to succeed. He is well known for his kindness and good character. His crops are in high demand because of their good quality and excellent prices. This way he has managed to cover some of his and his family's expenses. 

Pedro is requesting a loan to purchase agricultural supplies like seeds, manure, fertilizers, tools, etc. This will increase his earnings and improve his and his family's quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, manure, fertilizers, tools, etc.

loans.name: Teresa

texts.es: Teresa, tiene 53 años de edad, es madre soltera de 4 hijos pero solo vive con 2 de sus hijos en su casa construida a base de madera. Teresa se dedica a la venta de comida. Todos los días se encarga de preparar las comidad más exquisitos de la región. Cada mañana se dirige al mercado principal de la ciudad para comprar los ingredientes necesarios para la preparación de las comidad. Su horario de atención se inicia al comenzar la noche y los vende en su casa. Lleva en este negocio cerca de 5 años y lo hace con ayuda de su nuera. Su trabajo le ha permitido incrementar sus ingresos económicos y obtener nuevos clientes que le solicitan siempre innovar las comidad que ofrece. Le agrada su labor porque no le demanda mucho esfuerzo y esto le permite dedicarle el tiempo suficiente a su familia, además ahora vende mucho más que antes ya que sus clientes están acostumbrados a su buena sazón, asegura que sus clientes son muy exigentes y es por eso que ella siempre se esfuerza en comprar los mejores insumos para que sus comidas tengan siempre un exquisito sabor. En esta oportunidad solicitará S/. 2000, por ello se siente agradecida con las personas que le brindan el financiamiento que necesita para que pueda concretar sus planes, por otro lado se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas de manera puntual. Con el monto solicitado comprará productos al por mayor como arroz, azúcar, tubérculos, carne de cerdo, pollo, condimentos y otros insumos para continuar preparando las comidas que pone a la venta.
texts.en: Teresa is 53 years old. She is a single mother of 4 children, but she only lives with 2 of the, in her wooden house. Teresa sells food. Every day, she prepares the most delicious meals in the region. She goes to the main market in the city every morning to buy ingredients to prepare the food. Her business hours start in the evening and she sells from her house. She has had this business for around 5 years and she does it with her daughter in law's help. Her work has allowed her to increase her income and obtain new customers who ask her to innovate the food she offers. She likes her job because it doesn't require a lot of effort and it allows her to spend enough time with her family. She also sells a lot more now than she did before, since her customers are used to her good cooking. She says that her customers are very demanding and that is why she is also strives to buy the best ingredients  so that her meals will always taste delicious. At this time, she is asking for S/. 2000. That is why she feels grateful to the people who are offering her this loan that she needs to firm up her plans. She is also committed to making her payments on time.
