With the amount she has asked for, she will buy products wholesale, such as rice, sugar, tubers, pork, chicken seasonings, and other ingredients to make the meals that she sells.

loans.use: to buy products such as rice, tubers, pork, chicken, seasonings and more.

loans.name: Mwanamisi

texts.en:
Mwanamisi is a married lady. She and her husband have five children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food and fees for the family.

For the past 12 years, she has operated a business selling cashew nuts to local neighbors. She faces a major challenge of high cost of transportation in the business.

With the 40,000 KES loan, she wants to purchase four sacks of  cashews for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase four sacks of cashews  for resale.

loans.name: Simon

texts.en:
Simon is 59 years old and has been running his fish-selling business for 8 years. He is very pleased with this business that God has given him. Even though he supplies fish to his customers, there are always people who come to him for regular buying. 

He currently gets many requests for large quantities of fish, but he does not have sufficient stock to fill those orders.

Simon does not have enough money to buy a large inventory, so he is resorting to ID-Ghana for a loan of 1300 GHS in his eighth loan cycle so that his customers will not go elsewhere. 

Simon is single with two children of school-going age.

loans.use: to buy fish and supply them to his customers.

loans.name: Elidah

texts.en:
Elidah is a married woman with two children who attend school. For the past three years, she has been operating a general store. Her major business challenge is seasonality. Elidah owns a house without electricity or running water and her greatest monthly expense is food for her family. She decided to join Yehu to get financial assistance to improve her business.

Elidah is requesting a 50,000 KES loan to purchase foodstuff such as maize flour, wheat flour, rice, and sugar for her business.

loans.use: to purchase foodstuff such as maize flour, wheat flour, rice, and sugar

loans.name: Mwanajuma

texts.en:
Mwanajuma is a married woman who has been blessed with eight kids. For the past four years, she has sold fish. Her major business challenge is seasonality. Mwanajuma lives in her own house with electricity and running water and her greatest monthly expense is food and school fees. She joined Yehu to access loans to boost her business.  

Mwanajuma is requesting a 25,000 KES loan to purchase sacks of fish to resell. In the future, she dreams of becoming a fish wholesaler.

loans.use: to purchase fish to sell

loans.name: Asha

texts.en: Asha appreciates her previous loan that enabled her add stock to her kiosk. She is requesting a 10,000 KES loan to purchase beans, rice, sugar, and cooking oil for her grocery store. Asha thanks Yehu for their loan policies.

loans.use: to purchase beans, rice, sugar, and cooking oil

loans.name: Mesalim

texts.en:
Mesalim is a married mother of three children, all of whom attend school. She lives in a rental house that has electricity, but no piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees.

For the past five years, she has operated a clothes and shoe selling business, selling at the market to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of stiff competition in her business. She dreams of expanding her business and establishing a boutique business in the future. 

With the loan that she is requesting of KES 20,000, she wants to purchase bales of clothes and shoes for resale. She decided to join Yehu Microfinance Trust to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bales of clothes and shoes for resale.

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma is divorced and has two children, both of whom attend school. She owns a house that has electricity but no piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For the past five years, she has owned a food stall business, where she sells to neighbors and town dwellers. She faces the major challenge of fluctuations in number of clients. Sometimes, she has to throw away perishables, which leads to losses. 

With this loan of 40,000 KES, she wants to purchase goods like sugar, rice, maize and wheat flour and cooking fat. She dreams of expanding her business into a modern café.

loans.use: to purchase goods like sugar, rice, maize and wheat flour and cooking fat.

loans.name: Mwanamkuu

texts.en:
Mwanamkuu sells cashew nuts at the market and sells to town dwellers and passersby. She cites price fluctuations as a challenge in the business. She dreams of establishing a café business in the future.

With the Kshs 30,000 she wants to purchase eight sacks of cashew nuts for sale. She appreciates the continued support.

loans.use: to purchase eight sacks of cashew nuts for sale

loans.name: Celsa Dinora

texts.es:
Celsa es una mujer de 51 años de edad,  tiene un hijo. Desde muy pequeña se dedico a ayudar a su madre en el trabajo pendiente en el quehacer de la casa y para el padre quien trabajaba la agricultura llevándole la comida al trabajo.
Siendo una familia numerosa y de escasos recursos económicos, no pudo optar a estudiar solo logro sacar los primeros grados, pasando el tiempo se caso y formo una familia quien procreando un hijo, pero su compañero de vida, se fue para Estados Unidos quien por algún tiempo estuvo muy pendiente de ella y su hijo; pero desde hace un par de años ya no supo de él, solo que se acompaño con otra mujer en los Estados Unidos.

Su hijo quien tiene 16 años estudia y los fin de semana se dedica a trabajar la agricultura y en otras actividades para que ingrese dinero a la familia.

Ella, se dedica a trabajar la agricultura siempre pagando mosos y con la ayuda de su hijo con mucho esfuerzo a logrado sacar adelante a su único hijo, se a dedicado a esta actividad desde muy joven y cuando se acompaño lo hizo por su cuenta en compañía de su compañero de vida, quienes trabajaban 7,000 metros cuadrados de maíz, siempre las hace pero pagando mosos, los cultivos se encuentran  a un kilómetro de distancia de la casa donde reside.

Los fondos del crédito serán utilizados para la compra de insumos agrícolas: abonos, fertilizantes, pago de mosos y para preparar la tierra para el cultivo, se espera favorecer mejor el cultivo de maíz, con el objetivo de que su cosecha sea abundante. 

 Espera en un futuro sacar adelante a su hijo brindándole el estudio si es posible hasta la universidad, con los prestamos realizados y trabajando con mucho esfuerzo  alcanzara esa meta, las ganancias serán invertidas en su hijo y en el consumo diaria del grupo familiar.
texts.en:
Celsa is 51 years old and has a son. From a young age, she started helping her mother with the household chores. She also helped his father by bringing him the food to his workplace. Since it was a big family with few economic resources, she could not study and had to quit after a few basic courses. With time, she got married and had a son. Her life partner travelled to the United States and for a while was making sure they received some support. However, she has not heard from him for two years, only that he met another woman in the United States.

Her son, who is 16, is a student. During the weekends he works in agriculture and other activities in order to receive some income for the family. She works in agriculture with the help of her son and day laborers that she hires. With a lot of effort, she has managed to help her only son to get ahead. She has been doing this since she was very young. When she got married, her husband helped her to take care of 7,000 m2 planted with corn. She always hires laborers. Her plantations are located 1 km away from her house.

She will use the loan to buy agricultural supplies such as compost and fertilizer and to pay for the labor needed to prepare the land for the crops. She hopes to improve the plantations in order to have a more abundant harvest. In the future, she wants to see her son get ahead and pay for his studies, including the university if possible. With the loans she has received and with her hard work she will reach this goal. She will invest her profits in her son and to cover the family’s daily expenses.

loans.use: to buy compost and fertilizers and pay for the labor needed to prepare her land for cultivation.

loans.name: Deborah's Group

texts.en:
Deborah is the leader of a group is requesting its third loan cycle with ID-Ghana. Her group is comprised of five members who run different types of businesses including selling fresh fish, cooking oil, beans, and Gari (dried cassava paste). Deborah currently runs a business selling fresh fish. She started her business with her first loan through ID-Ghana and has been doing very well. She is pictured standing second from the left in this photograph.

Deborah’s group is requesting a total loan of 2,050 GHS. She will use her portion of the loan to purchase big, fresh fish from the fishing harbor in the city of Tema. Deborah will sell these fish to special order customers. This type of work allows her to earn more profit to reinvest into her business and save money too.

loans.use: to buy fish and supply special order customers.

loans.name: Ayuba's Group

texts.en:
Salone Microfinance Trust (SMT) a partner of Kiva.org based in Makeni, northern Sierra Leone, is very pleased to present to you this group of teachers from Bo, a city in southern Sierra Leone. This group of teachers has come to SMT to apply for a loan of SLL 26,100,000 for the entire group. With the help of this loan, they are being empowered to meet their most immediate and most pressing financial challenges. And at the end of each month, they can easily repay the loan, using their monthly salaries. It is their school’s bursar who is directly responsible for doing the deductions and making the repayments on their behalf.

Ayuba is the featured borrower of this group of teachers. The 42-year-old is a native of Bonthe town, in southern Sierra Leone.  He is married to a trader and the couple has three children who are attending primary and secondary schools. Ayuba has been a school teacher for 16 years now. He has requested this loan in order to buy house-building materials like iron corrugated sheets, cement, etc. for the construction of a dwelling house.

loans.use: to buy house-building materials like iron corrugated sheets, cement, etc. for the construction of a dwelling house

loans.name: Siddique Ahmed's Group

texts.en:
Meet this group of teachers from the city of Bo, in southern Sierra Leone. They have come to SMT, a partner of Kiva.org based in Makeni, northern Sierra Leone, to apply for a total loan of SLL 24,200,000 in order to meet their most immediate and most pressing financial needs. And at the end of each month, they can easily repay the loan using their monthly salaries. It is their school’s bursar who is directly responsible for making the deductions and repayments on their behalf. 

Siddique is the featured leader of this group of teacher. The 40-year-old is a native of Bo city. He is married to a nurse and the couple has two children together. Siddique is a school teacher and has been in the teaching profession for 27 years now. He has requested this loan in order to buy house-building materials like iron rods, cement, etc. for the construction of a dwelling house.

loans.use: to buy house-building materials like iron rods, cement, etc. for the construction of a dwelling house

loans.name: Maria Eugenia

texts.es: María, es habitante del barrio Waspam Sur, una zona con alto índice delincuencial, ahora es madre de seis hijos siendo el mayor de 17 y el menor de 1 año de nacido, todos dependen de ella y su esposo con quien trabajan mutuamente en un carretón halado a caballo, vendiendo de manera ambulante elotes de maíz, atoles de maíz y arroz con leche, todos los mencionados son comidas típicas de Nicaragua, de esta manera María mantiene a su numerosa familia, lo cual es muy difícil para ella porque muchas veces las ventas son malas. Con el crédito que solicita desea construir una parte del muro perimetral este de su vivienda, lo que le permitirá mayor seguridad a sus hijos.
texts.en:
María is a resident of the Waspam Sur neighborhood, which is located in a high crime area. She is now the mother of six children, with her oldest child being 17 and her youngest being only 1 year old. All of her children are dependent on her and husband, who work together from their horse-drawn cart. As traveling vendors, they sell corn on the cob, corn porridge, and rice pudding. All of these foods are traditional dishes in Nicaragua. Since María supports a large family, it can be very difficult since she has encountered low sales on numerous occasions.

With the loan she is requesting, María wants to build a portion of a security wall around her home. This will provide greater security for her children.

loans.use: to buy cement, sand, iron, blocks, and gravel for building a security wall around her home.

loans.name: Dama

texts.en:
Dama is a married woman and has eight children who are adults. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food.

She operates a fish selling business, selling at the market to her neighbors. 

With the Kshs 10,000 she wants to purchase fish, cooking oil, and fuel for her business. She decided to join to acquire financial services for her business growth.

loans.use: to purchase fish, cooking oil, and fuel for her business

loans.name: Mwanatumu

texts.en:
Mwanatumu is a married woman and together with her husband she has two children, both of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food and fees for the family.

For the past 12 years, she has operated a cashew nut selling business, selling retail to local neighbors. She faces a major challenge of high cost of transportation in the business.

With the Kshs 10,000 she wants to purchase one sack of  cashew nuts  for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase one sack of  cashew nuts  for resale.

loans.name: Mwanaidi

texts.en:
Mwanaidi is a widow with two children. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past 12 years, she has operated a cashew nut selling business, selling retail to local neighbors. She faces a major challenge of high cost of transportation in the business.

With the Kshs 10,000 she wants to purchase one sack of  cashew nuts  for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase one sack of  cashew nuts  for resale.

loans.name: Dama

texts.en:
Dama is married and has five children; two are in school, and the rest are adults. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

She operates a fish selling business, selling at the market to her neighbors’. 

With the 10,000 KES loan, she wants to purchase fish, cooking oil, and fuel for her fish business. She decided to get a loan to acquire financial services for her business growth.

loans.use: to purchase fish, cooking oil, and fuel for her fish business.

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Ruth, who lives in the area of AirPort in Margibi County, is married and has four children between the ages of 3 and 12, three of whom are in school. Her husband is a businessman while Ruth, 35 years of age with an eighth grade education, has been selling rice, peppers, vita, sugar, and salt in the local market for 10 years.

A hardworking business woman who spends nine hours a day on her business from Monday to Saturday, Ruth is requesting a loan to purchase more onions, rice, peppers, vita, etc. Her plans are to build her house and educates her children.

loans.use: to purchase more onions, rice, peppers, vita, etc. for her business

loans.name: Janet

texts.en:
This is Janet, from Liberia. She lives in the Airport area of Margibi County. She is 38 years old and she and her fiancee live together, along with seven children between the ages of 1 and 13. Only six of the children are in school and they all live at home. Janet's fiancee works with Firestone. 

Janet was unfortunate in not attending school, so she decided to do business. Over the past ten years now, she has been selling rice, pepper, flour, etc. in the local market. She sells for eight hours from Monday to Saturday. She described herself as hard-working woman.

Janet is requesting a loan to purchase more rice, pepper, flour, etc. for her business. Her plans are to build her house and educate her children.

loans.use: to purchase more rice, pepper, flour, etc. for her business.

loans.name: Enis Emilia

texts.es: La cliente vive en el sector de Suburbio en Guayaquil.  Inició en esta actividad a raíz de que su esposo la abandonara junto con sus 2 hijas.  Luego de esto y como necesidad de tener ingresos para su familia, decidió comenzar a vender ropa y otros artículos, a pesar de que el papá de sus hijas les pasa una mensualidad para sus gastos.  Labora sola desde las 9 am hasta las 10 pm vendiendo en su casa, durante la mañana visita a sus amigos y conocidos para venderles ropa.  Al momento sigue separada de su esposo y sus hijas que son menores de edad, estudian en la escuela fiscal del sector.  Ahora requiere invertir el crédito en la compra de ropa y colas.
texts.en:
This borrower is from the Surburbio sector of Guayaquil. She started her business after her husband abandoned her, leaving her to care for their two daughters. Since she needed income for her family, the borrower decided to sell clothes and other products even though the father of her children sends a monthly payment for their expenses. She works from home alone from 9:00 A.M. to 10 P.M. In the mornings, she will visit friends and acquaintances in order to sell clothes to them.

At the moment, the borrower continues to be separated from her husband. Her young daughters attend a state school in the area. She is now requesting a loan to invest in the purchase of clothing and sodas.

loans.use: to buy clothing and sodas to sell.

loans.name: José Gilberto

texts.es:
Don José, tiene 67 años de edad, vive con su compañera de vida y una nieta, y por problemas de la pobreza en que vivian sus padres no pudieron mandarlo a la escuela, fue por esa razón que solo estudio segundo grado. Se levanta a las 5:00 de la mañana a ordeñar sus vacas, después las lleva al potrero, el cual le queda a unos 2 kilómetros de distancia, por la tarde va a traerlas, para encerrarlas en su corral, les da agua y un poco de pasto, durante el día se dedica a las labores de limpieza, fertilización y control de plagas de su milpa.   
   
Para comprar sus reses, tiene que esperar un camión de los que van para el tiangue,  viaja durante 30 minutos, al llegar observa muchas reses, durante todo el día, hasta encontrar las que le gustan, luego cierra trato con la persona que le vende, carga sus animales en el camión y retorna a casa.  

El préstamo que esta solicitando a Fundación Campo, es para comprar una vaca lechera. Así aumentara su número de animales y obtendrá mayor cantidad de leche, esto incrementara sus ingresos, para la subsistencia de su familia y también tendrá satisfechos a sus vecinos; ya que les venderá leche todo el tiempo. 
 
Don José, esta planificando, comprarse unas vacas de las mejores razas lecheras.
texts.en:
Don José is 67 years old and lives with his life partner and a granddaughter.  Due to the poverty of his parents, who were unable to send him to school, he only finished second grade.  He gets up each day at 5am to milk his cows, and afterwards he takes them to pasture, which is about 2 kilometers away. In the afternoon he goes to pick them up, gets them in the corral, and gives them water and a bit of hay. During the day he works cleaning, fertilizing and controlling the insects in his cornfield.

In order to purchase cows, he has to wait for a truck that takes people to the local market.  He travels 30 minutes and upon arriving observes many cows all day long until he finds those that he likes.  He then completes the deal with the seller, loads the animals on the truck and returns home.  
   
The loan that he is requesting from Fundación Campo is to purchase a milk cow.  In this way he will increase his number of animals and obtain a better quantity of milk.  This will increase his income and provide subsistence for his family as well as satisfaction for the neighbors, since he sells them milk all the time. 
 
Don José is planning to buy some cows from among the best milking breeds.

loans.use: To purchase a milk cow.

loans.name: Sophorn

texts.en:
Sophorn is a married mother of three dependent children, a daughter and two sons. Her children are all still in school. Sophorn lives in the Srey Snom district of Siem Reap. For the past 15 years, she has been a rice farmer who cultivates two hectares and earns about 20,000 KHR per day. Sophorn has borrowed previously from with VisionFund and has successfully repaid her loans which have helped to improve her living conditions.

Sophorn is requesting a 4,000,000 KHR loan from VisionFund to buy insecticide and rice seed for her farm. She hopes to earn more income from her crop to support her family.

loans.use: to buy insecticide and rice seed for her farm

location.town: Siem Reap Province, Srey Snom district

loans.name: Jay Laxmi Group

texts.en:
Jay Laxmi is a Joint Liability Group formed by four women of Chanabeda village of Nuapada district in Odisha, India in the year 2008. The objective of forming the group was to access a loan from Mahashakti Foundation and expand the businesses. 

Sabita, a headstrong and confident lady, is one of these women. She hails from a poor family, living below the poverty line. The lady standing second from right in the photo, raising her hand, is Sabita, She is 27 years old and lives with her husband and four daughters of 11, 9, 4 and 2 years of age. Her three elder daughters are continuing their studies.

 Sabita has been running a Tiffin stall for the last five years in the nearest town, five kilometers away, with the hand-holding support of her husband. Due to good quality items, her Tiffin stall is very popular in the town. Sabita earns a monthly income of 8,000 INR from the above business. With this income, she is hardly able to manage her household and the educational expenses of her children. So, she wants to expand her business by taking out a loan from Mahashakti Foundation. 

With the present loan, Sabita wants to purchase more stock of oil, dough, sugar, etc. This will help her to reduce her purchasing and transportation costs as she has to replenish her stock frequently. Sabita hopes to save enough to give a better education to her daughters. The other three members of the group are Bina, Basanti and Lembumati who are running puffed rice vending, fish vending and soap and washing powder vending businesses respectively.

loans.use: To pay for purchasing more stock of oil, dough, sugar, etc.

loans.name: Elsa Lidia

texts.es:
Doña Elsa tiene 51 años de edad es casada y madre de 9 hijos agricultora y ama de casa con un grado de educación primario cursado hasta el quinto grado ya que las posibilidades de apoyo económico por sus padres no lo permitían. Tiene 9 hijos pero solo 4 viven con ellos, los 5 mayores ya tienen sus propios hogares y dos de ellos le envían remesas ya que decidieron emigrar a estados unidos. De los cuatro que viven con ella el  mayor tiene 20  años y solo pudo estudiar hasta el quinto grado de primaria, el segundo tiene 18 años y el estudio plan básico pero no pudo comenzar el bachillerato por falta de recursos, ambos trabajan con el papa, el tercer hijo tiene 16 años y cursa el primer año de ciclo y la cuarta es una hembra de 11 años y está en cuarto grado. En compañía de sus hijos y su esposo se dedican a la agricultura especialmente al cultivo de café los cuales están ubicados cerca de su casa de habitación. El producto al final de cada cosecha es vendido a un intermediario de la comunidad la cual se dedica a la compra-venta.

Ella ha solicitado un financiamiento con el cual comprara 3 QQ de urea, 3 QQ formula 12-24-12, 2 sacos de fertilizantes, 3 litros de herbicidas, 3 litros de plaguicida con lo cual podrá darle asistencia técnica a sus cultivos de café protegiéndolos de plagas etc.

Ella sueña con poder darle a sus hijos que aun estudian la oportunidad que no pudo darle a sus hijos mayores apoyarlos en lo todo lo necesario para que ellos puedan culminar sus estudios y sean profesionales.
texts.en:
Elsa is 51 years old, married and the mother of 9 children.  She is a farmer and homemaker with a primary school level of education having completed the fifth grade since the financial resources of support by her parents didn’t allow any further.  She has 9 children but only 4 live with them.  The 5 older children already have their own homes and two of them send her remittances as they decided to emigrate to the United States.  Of the four that live with her the oldest is 20 years old and was only able to attend school up to the fifth grade.  The second is 18 years old and attended primary school but was not able to begin high school due to a lack of resources.  They both work with their father.  The third son is 16 years old and is finishing the first year of the cycle and the fourth is a girl of 11 years who is in the fourth grade.  In the company of her children and her husband she works in agriculture, especially in the cultivation of coffee which is located near their house.  The product at the end of each harvest is sold to an intermediary of the community who is engaged in the buying and selling of coffee.

She has requested a loan with which she will purchase 3 quintals of urea, 3 quintals of 12-24-12 formula, 2 sacks of fertilizers, 3 liters of herbicides, 3 liters of pesticides with which she will be able to give technical assistance to her coffee crops, protecting them from pests, etc.

She dreams of being able to give her children who are still studying the opportunity that she couldn’t give to her older children, supporting them in everything that is necessary so that they can finish their studies and become professionals.

loans.use: to purchase agricultural supplies for her coffee crops.

loans.name: Marta

texts.es:
Doña Marta es casada y tiene 44 años de edad tiene un grado de educación primario completo ya que sus padres no tenían los recursos para poder ayudarle a culminar sus estudios a nivel secundaria. Sin embargo le enseñaron a trabajar la tierra el negocio al que ellos se dedican es el cultivo de granos básicos como ser maíz y frijoles y hoy está emprendiendo el cultivo de café esto con el objetivo de obtener más ingresos para su familia. Ella es madre de 2 hijos el mayor tiene 19 años y curso ciclo común y decidió ayudar a su padre en el trabajo del campo y la segunda hija tiene 16 años y está cursando el primer año de carrera en una comunidad cercana. Sus cultivos están ubicados aproximadamente a 5 minutos de su casa de habitación ellos se trasladan diariamente a pie ya que en esta actividad se involucran ella, su esposo y su hijo mayor. El grano que cultivan y cosechan lo venden en la misma comunidad.

Doña Marta ha solicitado un financiamiento con el cual planea comprar chapola 2300 unidades (plantitas de café), también comprara 5 QQ de urea, 5 QQ de fórmula 12-24-12 y 5 QQ de fórmula 18-26-0 y otra parte la destinara para la preparación de una parcela de tierra donde sembrara la chapola.

Uno de los sueños de doña Marta es graduar a su hija para que se pueda valer por sí misma, con respecto a su negocio espera lograr sembrar el café para que a futuro le genere ganancias las cuales invirtiera para ampliar su negocio y así lograr construir un buen patrimonio para sus dos hijos.
texts.en:
Marta is 44 years old and married. She has a primary school education because her parents didn't have the resources to help her finish her secondary schooling. nonetheless, they taught her to work the land. The business they have now is growing basic grains such as corn and beans, and now she is starting to grow coffee in order to obtain more income for her family. She is the mother of 2 children. The oldest is 19 years old. He finished junior high school and decided to help his father in the fields. Their younger daughter is 16 and in the first year of upper high school in a nearby community. Her crops are located approximately 5 minutes from her house. They go there every day, since she, her husband and her son work there. The grains they grow and harvest are sold in the same community. 

Marta has asked for a loan with which she plans on buying 2,300 units of seedlings (little coffee plants). She will also buy 5 quintals of urea, 5 quintals of 12-24-12 formula and 5 quintals of 18-25-0 formula. Another part of it will be used to prepare a parcel of land she has to plant the seedlings.

One of Marta's dreams is for her daughter to graduate so she can become independent. for her business, she hopes to be able to plant the coffee so that in the future it will generate earnings which she will invest in expanding her business so she can build assets for her two children. .

loans.use: to buy agricultural materials and seedlings to plant coffee.

loans.name: Ane

texts.en:
Ane is a 27-year-old, single woman, with no children. To earn a living, she makes and sells barbeque in her community. She has two years of experience with this business. 

Ane needs a loan to buy a box of chicken, soy sauce, onions, sugar, a barbeque oven, sausages, salt, and foam plates for her business. She plans to use her profits to improve her business and also her family's living conditions. 

Ane has been a member of South Pacific Business Development (SPBD) since 2013.

loans.use: to buy box of chicken, soy sauce, onions, sugar, a barbeque oven, sausages, salt, and foam plates for her business.

loans.name: Lituina

texts.en:
Lituina is a 24-year-old single woman with three children. She makes and sells BBQ in her community to earn a living. She has one year of experience with this business. 

Lituina needs a loan to buy boxes of chicken, sausages, mutton flaps, soy sauce, foil, onions, tomato sauce and foam plates for her business. She plans to use her profits to enlarge her business and meet her family's daily needs and wants. Lituina has been a member of SPBD since 2013.

loans.use: to buy ingredients and supplies for her business

loans.name: Noreen

texts.en: Noreen is 18 years old and single with no children. She owns and operates a small store, selling items such as breads, noodles, ice-pops, ice-cakes, and chicken legs. She has been doing this for one year. Noreen needs a loan to buy sugar, flour, bags of rice, boxes of herring, snacks, soft drinks, cigarettes, and noodles for her business. She hopes to use her profits to enlarge her business and to improve her family's standard of living. She became a member of SPBD in 2013 to gain access to capital for her business.

loans.use: to buy sugar, flour, bags of rice, boxes of herring, snacks, soft drinks, cigarettes, and noodles

loans.name: Orinalitara

texts.en: Orinalitara is 22 years old and unmarried with no children. She runs a small business selling chips in her community and has been doing this for one year. Orinalitara has requested a loan to buy dripping oil, an oven, plastic bags, salt, and a sack of raw bananas. She joined SPBD in 2013 to gain access to capital. With her earnings, Orinalitara provide for her family's daily needs and wants.

loans.use: to buy dripping oil, an oven, plastic bags, salt, and a sack of raw bananas

loans.name: Annie

texts.en:
Annie is 38 years old and a widowed woman with four children. She owns and operates a small store selling items such as chicken legs, noodles, snacks, etc. for her business. She has been doing this for three years. 

Annie needs a loan to buy a box of chicken, sugar, flour, laundry powder, diapers, corned beef, snacks, soft drinks, cigarettes, and noodles for her business. She hopes to use her profits to improve her family's standard of living and her business. She became a member of SPBD in 2013 to gain access to capital for her business.

loans.use: to buy a box of chicken, sugar, flour, laundry powder, diapers, corned beef, snacks, soft drinks, cigarettes, and noodles

loans.name: Tapaau

texts.en: Tapaau is a 23-year-old woman who is single with two children. She has a small taxi service business.  Tapaau needs a loan to buy new tires, seat covers, and a taxi registration and to service her taxi. She will use her profits to for her children's education and to upgrade her family's standard of living. Tapaau joined SPBD in 2013 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy new tires, seat covers, and a taxi registration and to service her taxi

loans.name: Faamuamua

texts.en:
Faamuamua is a 22-year-old single woman with no children. She runs a small business selling noddles and snacks in her community and has been doing this for one year. 

Faamuamua has requested a loan to buy sacks of flour, bags of rice, sugar, onions, soy sauce, boxes of chicken, a frying pan, dripping oil, foam plates, plastic bags, big cooking pots and salt. She joined SPBD in 2013 to gain access to capital. With her earnings, Faamuamua will use her profit to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients and supplies for her business

loans.name: Vaoesea

texts.en:
Vaoesea is 41 years old and married, with six children. She has a small garden where she grows cucumbers, cabbages, tomatoes, etc., that she can sell in her community or at the market. She has been doing this for many years. 

Vaoesea needs a loan to buy chemicals, fertilizer, vegetable seeds, a rake, a garden hose and a shovel. She has been a member of SPBD since 2013. Vaoesea will use the profits from her sales to help assist her family financially.

loans.use: to buy chemicals, fertilizer, vegetable seeds, and gardening implements

loans.name: Ulufafo

texts.en:
Ulufafo is a 54-year-old woman who is married, with four children. She runs a small business, selling German buns, donuts, etc., in her community and she has been doing this for many years. 

She is requesting this loan to help her make improvements to her house, so her family can have better living conditions. Ulufafo will use the loan to buy cement, ceiling boards and timber. She will also use part of her loan to buy flour, dripping oil, sugar, yeast and soy sauce. Ulufafo joined SPBD in 2012 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy ingredients and to make improvements to her house

loans.name: Gumercinda

texts.es:
La señora Gumercinda tiene 48 años de edad, es soltera y tiene cuatro hijos que dependen de ella, sus ingresos provienen de la venta de productos de catalogo y tiene 10 años de dedicarse a su negocio.
Doña Gumercinda su negocio está ubicado en su casa de habitación, vende sus productos en su mayoría por encargo y los compra una vez al mes, es una persona muy trabajadora y esta solicitando el préstamo para la compra de cremas, perfumes, lociones, glases, lis tic, polvos, lápiz de ojo, etc. para tener más productos a la venta  y poder cubrir las demanda de sus clientes.
Doña Gumercinda espera que esta inversión le ayude a salir adelante y le brinde los ingresos necesarios para contribuir en su hogar y poder seguir ayudando a sus hijos, su sueño es tener su casa propia.


Tegucigalpa, Honduras – Agosto del 2013
texts.en:
Miss Gumercinda is 48 years old, is single, and has four children that depend on her.  Their income comes from the sale of catalog products; she has 10 years devoted to her business.  Miss Gumecinda's business is located in her home.  For the most part she sells her products by order and buys them once a month.  She is a very hardworking person.

She is seeking the loan to purchase creams, perfumes, lotions, glosses, lipsticks, powder, eye pencils, etc. to have more products to sell and to be able to meet the demand of her customers.  Miss Gumercinda hopes that this investment will help her to get ahead and provide the revenue needed to contribute to the home and to be able to continue helping her children.  Her dream is to have her own home.

loans.use: to purchase creams, perfumes, lotions, glosses, lipsticks, powder, eye pencils, etc. for her business.

loans.name: Mwanajuma

texts.en:
Mwanajuma appreciates the previous loan she took. The loan helped her grow her charcoal business, thus generating profits to improve her living standards.

She is requesting a loan of KES 50,000 to purchase 45 bags of charcoal for resale. She joined Yehu to get financial support.

loans.use: to purchase 45 bags of charcoal for resale.

loans.name: Claudio

texts.en:
Claudio is a 45-year-old married man from Talibon, Bohol. He has three children aged 12,15 and 18. He engages in farming. He works the land and grows rice. He has been growing and selling rice for almost ten years. 

Claudio has requested a loan of 10,000 PHP to buy fertilizer and pesticides to improve his harvest. In the future, Claudio would like to improve his farming business to have a bountiful harvest and to provide his family with good food as well as good living conditions.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pesticides

loans.name: Cristita

texts.en:
Cristita, a 46-year-old married woman from Getafe, Bohol, has two grown children. For almost five years she has run a sari-sari (variety) store selling items such as coffee, cooking oil, soap, sugar, shampoo and biscuits.

Crisita has requested a loan of 8000 PHP to buy a sack of rice, canned goods and soft drinks. In the future, she would like to expand her small store to cater to more customers.

loans.use: to buy a sack of rice, canned goods and soft drinks

loans.name: Danilo

texts.en:
Danilo is a 46-year-old married man from Talibon, Bohol. He has five children. The oldest child is 24, while the youngest is 4. 

Danilo engages in fishing. He catches and sells fish to earn a living. He has been fishing for more than ten years. 

To be more productive in his fishing activity, Danilo has requested a loan of 12,000 PHP to buy a fishing net, floats and lift weights. In the future, Danilo hopes that he can expand his fishing business to pay his weekly dues and send his children to school.

loans.use: to buy a fishing net, floats and lift weights

loans.name: Delio

texts.en:
Delio is a 44-year-old married man from Talibon, Bohol. He has six children. The oldest is 22, while the youngest is 4.

Delio engages in fishing. He catches and sells fish to earn a living. He has been fishing for almost ten years.

To be more productive and to improve his daily catch, Delio has requested a loan of 10,000 PHP to buy a fishing net, a crab net and lift weights. In the future, Delio would like to expand his fishing business to provide his family with good food and a quality education.

loans.use: to buy a fishing net, a crab net and lift weights

loans.name: Mwasiti

texts.en:
Mwasiti is a married woman with four children. She owns a house with electricity and piped water and her monthly expenses are fees and food for the family. 

She operates a green grocery business, which has been operational for five years, to earn a living and support her family. She is requesting the loan of KES 25,000 to buy a crate of tomatoes, Irish potatoes and a sack of green vegetables for sale.

loans.use: to buy a crate of tomatoes, Irish potatoes and a sack of green vegetables for sale.

loans.name: Jay Maa Santoshi Group

texts.en:
In 2010, four women from Risigaon village located in the Khariar block of Nuapada district, one of the poorest districts of India, stepped out and decided to build a secure future for their families with their contributions. They formed a group named Jay Maa Santoshi to access credit from Mahashakti Foundation for development of their existing business. 

Manjula is the one standing on the extreme right with her hand raised in the photo. She is 35 years old and lives with her husband, two daughters of 22 and 16 years old and one son of 18 years of age, who help in her business. Manjula hails from a traditional cloth weaving community. For the last 10 years, she has been running a cloth weaving business with her husband. Now she has one hand loom for weaving saris. Her husband purchases the yarn/thread from a trader  20 km away from her village. They prepare 80 to 100 pieces from a bundle of yarn, which costs around 10,000-15,000 rupees. 

Manjula does the initial processing of the yarn to make it ready for weaving and after that, her husband fits it to the hand loom and weaves the sari. They only weave saris because of the demand in the market. Her family works around 8-10 hours a day and weaves two pieces of sari from it. Manjula sells her products to the local traders on a weekly basis. She earns a monthly income of Rs.5000, which is not sufficient to maintain her family. 

With the present loan, she wants to buy thread/yarn in bulk which will cost around 15,000 INR. Purchasing more stock at a time will help her to reduce the purchasing and transportation costs of the raw materials. Manjula wishes to grow her business and save enough to construct a house and give a better education to her son. Hemabati, Chandrakanti and Jogeswari are the other three members of the group and they also have cloth weaving businesses and Tiffin centres.

loans.use: To pay for purchasing a bundle of yarn.

loans.name: Trishakti Group

texts.en:
In the year 2010, four women from a rural village named Bharuakani of Balangir district in Odisha, India formed a group named Trishakti to access a loan from Mahashakti Foundation and expand their business. Binakumari is one of these women. 

The lady sitting second from right in the photo, raising her hand, is Binakumari, aged 44 who lives with her husband, two daughters of 12 and 9 years, one son of 6 years and her mother in-law. Her family belongs to a Below Poverty Line (BPL) category. People from the BPL category live on less than one dollar a day. 

Binakumari has been running a general store in her house for the last eighteen years. She is also sells milk. Her husband supplements the income from her business. She sells general grocery items like sugar, lentils, biscuits, soap, shampoo, chocolate and stationery such as books, pens, etc. Binakumari was able to increase the variety of items at her general store with her scanty savings and increase her cash flow. Her monthly income from the existing business is Rs.4000/-. Out of this income she has been able to manage her household expenses. As per her statement, she was able to increase the variety of items in her shop but not the inventory. 

Binakumari wants to increase the stock of her business. So the loan amount will be utilized to purchase items like sugar, tea dust, lentils, biscuits, soap, shampoo, chocolate etc. for her general store. This will help her to reduce her purchasing and transportation costs as she will replenish her stock less frequently from the nearest town, 15 kms away. Binakumari hopes to save enough to build a good house for her family as the present house is very small and congested. She also dreams of giving a better education to her children. The other three members of the group are  Dahana, Basanti and Jashobanti who are running a bamboo basket-making and selling business, a general store and a milk business respectively. 

Since the inception of Trishakti group, Binakumari has been heading the group with dedication and sincerity. Other members of the group are also very happy and satisfied under the dynamic leadership of Binakumari.

loans.use: to pay for purchasing sugar, tea dust, lentils, biscuits, soap, shampoo, chocolate etc.

loans.name: Rubiel Ángel

texts.es: Rubiel tiene 53 años, vive con su esposa y sus dos hijos. Desde hace 15 años tiene su propio negocio, con el que genera ingresos para el sostenimiento de su familia. Inició con una pequeña tienda de abarrotes, que poco a poco se fue acreditando y creciendo hasta convertirse en el minimercado que hoy es, ya reconocido en el sector. El cliente cuenta con el apoyo de 3 empleados directos y  trabaja desde las 6:30 am hasta las 7:00 pm, para aprovechar la ventaja de no contar con una competencia fuerte en el sector donde se encuentra ubicado. Rubiel es un señor activo, dinámico y responsable, además se proyecta hacia el cumplimiento de sus sueños, especialmente, hacer crecer su negocio y convertirlo en un supermercado, con más surtido y mejor acreditado. Pero para llegar a ello es consciente que debe seguir trabajando con esmero y dedicación. Esto lo motiva a solicitar el crédito, con el fin de invertirlo en la compra de un moto carro y surtido (productos lácteos, cárnicos, granos, productos de aseo y demás productos de la canasta familiar), con esto podrá tener más variedad de productos disponibles para la venta y además facilitará el transporte de la mercancía, pues podrá implementar el servicio de domicilios lo que aumentará su clientela y por ende sus ventas e ingresos y, en los tiempos muertos del negocio, podrá poner a trabajar el moto carro, generando ingresos adicionales. De esta forma podrá avanzar y tener una estabilidad económica favorable para brindar bienestar y calidad de vida a su familia.
texts.en:
Rubiel is 53 and lives with his wife and two children. He has for 15 years run his a store that provides the income to support his family. Rubiel began with a small grocery store that has grown and attracted more customers, becoming a well-known minimarket in the area. 

Rubiel has three employees and works from 6:30 a.m. to 7:00 p.m., taking full advantage of the lack of serious competition in the area near his store. Rubiel is active, dynamic, and trustworthy; he is striving to realize his ambitions, especially to grow his business, turn it into a supermarket with greater inventory and more customers. 

Rubiel realizes, however, that in order to achieve these goals he needs to keep working conscientiously and with dedication. This is why he's applied for a loan. Rubiel will use the loan funds to purchase a delivery van and inventory (dairy products, meat, grains, cleaning supplies, and other basic goods). The store will then have a greater variety of products to sell and the van will allow easier transport of goods. Rubiel can then launch a home delivery service, boosting the store's customer base as well as sales and income. He can also put the van to use transporting goods when business at the store is slow, generating additional income. All of these improvements will represent progress, stabilizing Rubiel's finances, and improving his family's welfare and quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase a delivery van and inventory (dairy products, meat, grains, cleaning supplies, and other basic goods).

loans.name: Stella M.'s Group

texts.en:
Pictured here are teachers of a school in Bo, a city in southern Sierra Leone. This group of teachers has come to SMT, a partner of Kiva.org, to apply for a total loan of SLL 7,400,000. With the help of this loan, they will be able to meet their most immediate and most pressing financial needs, and at the end of each month, they can easily repay the loan using their monthly salaries. It is their school's bursar who is directly responsible for doing the deductions and making the repayments on their behalf.

Stella is the featured leader of this team. Born in Bonthe, in southern Sierra Leone, Stella is married to a medical officer and the couple has five children together. Stella has been a school teacher for 28 years now. She has requested this loan in order to buy house-building materials like iron corrugated sheets, cement, etc. for the construction of a dwelling house.

loans.use: to buy house-building materials like iron corrugated sheets, cement, etc. for the construction of a dwelling house

loans.name: Mwanasiti

texts.en:
Mwanasiti is a widow with nine children who are all grown-ups. She lives in her own house that has both piped water and electricity. Her greatest monthly expense is food.

She owns rental houses and has been in this business for two years. She cites renovation of the house as her major challenge.

She is requesting a loan of KES 60,000 to renovate her house. She joined Yehu to get financial support.

loans.use: to renovate her rental house.

loans.name: Rosalinda

texts.en:
Rosalinda is married, with six children. Rosalinda is 49 years old and she lives in Libertad Bajo, Sinacaban, Philippines.

Rosalinda is a farmer and, to earn a living, she raises pigs. She has been doing this for 15 years. 

She has requested a loan to purchase additional feed and other agri-vet supplies.

Rosalinda has been a member of Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) for seven years. In the future, Rosalinda hopes to pay for her children's tuition fees.

loans.use: to purchase additional feed and other agri-vet supplies.

loans.name: Gloria

texts.es:
Doña Gloria es ama de casa y agricultora con una edad de 53 años, con un grado de educación primaria cursado hasta sexto madre de 8 hijos de los cuales solo viven 7 ya que una de sus hijas murió, con ella viven los últimos tres hijos, una que tiene 24 años y curso hasta el ciclo común, el segundo hijo que vive con ella tiene 21 años y se graduó de mecánico automotriz y el ultimo que estudio hasta ciclo común, con ellos vive una nieta de los dos hijos que dejo su hija fallecida que está cursando el 2 grado de la primaria. La actividad a la que ella en compañía de su esposo y su familia se dedica es la agricultura al cultivo de maíz y frijoles para consumo una parte y la otra para la venta pero específicamente al cultivo de café siendo esta su mayor fuente de ingresos. Sus cultivos están ubicados aproximadamente a 15 minutos de su casa de habitación y el acceso es por medio de los terrenos de los vecinos ya que no hay acceso hasta su terreno.

Ella ha solicitado un financiamiento para la compra de 3 QQ de urea, 2550 nuevas plantas de café, 3 QQ de fórmula 12-24-12 y 3 QQ de fórmula 18-26-0 con lo cual le dará protección, seguridad y un mayor fortalecimiento a sus cultivos de café y su nueva plantación.

Su mayor sueño es reconstruir su casa ya que está en muy mal estado para que sus hijos tengan un techo más digno. Su mayor meta por alcanzar es seguir haciendo crecer su negocio comprando más terreno para cultivar  y esto considera que lo hará con las ganancias que le genere su negocio.
texts.en:
Gloria, 53, is a housewife and coffee farmer with a 6th grade education. She has 8 children, but only 7 are alive as one of her daughters died. Three of her children still live with her: one that's 24 who finished elementary school; the second one is 21 and graduated as an auto mechanic; and the last one finished elementary school. When Gloria's daughter died, she took in both of her daughter's children who are in grade 2. Gloria, her husband and family are farmers who grow corn and beans for consumption and to sell, but their biggest source of income is their coffee bean crop. The land is located approximately 15 minutes from her house, with no direct access to it they have to access it by way of their neighbor's land.

She is requesting a loan to buy 3 quintals of urea, 2550 new coffee plants, 3 quintals of formula 12-24-12 and 3 quintals of formula 18-26-0, with which she can protect, secure and strengthen her old crops and her new ones.

Her biggest dream is to rebuild her house, as it's in very bad shape, so she can give her children a dignified place to live. Her biggest goal is to continue growing her business by buying more land, which she thinks she can do with the income from her business.

loans.use: buy agricultural supplies for her coffee crops.

loans.name: Karanjung Lestari 2 Group

texts.en: Ni Made and the Karanjung Lestari 2 Group received their third loan with the same members and loan size. The loan will be used to increase the pig business by purchasing superior piglets, local piglets, and feed. Ni Made used her loan to purchase superior feed only because she still has pigs remaining in her cage. Beside using her loan to purchase feed, she also uses it as capital for her other business, fish-selling.

loans.use: to purchase superior feed for her pigs.

loans.name: Isabel

texts.en: Isabel is 50 years old and married. She sells different products in the village of Union. She is extremely grateful to all the lenders who supported her through her past loan, which was a real success and allowed her to buy the merchandise she needed. Therefore, she requesting a loan amounting to PHP 5,000. On this occasion, she needs the money to buy goods such as bags of rice, sugar, fizzy drinks, biscuits, detergents, and other items.

loans.use: to buy bags of rice, sugar, fizzy drinks, biscuits, detergents, and other items.

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita is single and has two children. She is 59 years old and lives in Libertad Bajo, Sinacaban, Philippines.

Teresita sells dried fish and longganisa (a type of sausage) to earn a living and has had this business for three years. She has requested a loan to purchase additional longganisa and dried fish to sell.

Teresita has been a member of PMPC for seven years. In the future, Teresita hopes to save for future emergencies.

loans.use: to purchase additional longganisa (a type of sausage) and dried fish to sell

loans.name: So

texts.en:
So is 35 years old and married with four children who still depend on her income. She owns a farm where she plants and harvests rice and cassavas sell. She has managed farming for almost 10 years. Thanks to her business and perseverance, she is able earns a net profit of KHR 20,000 per day to support her family. Her challenges include the change in prices and the cost of farm inputs applied to maintain the crops.

So has been a client of MFIs or state banks before. This will be her first Kiva loan through HKL to help her improve her production. She is now asking for a loan of KHR 3,000,000 to buy seeds, fertilizers, and herbicides that she will apply in growing crops. With the support of the loan, she hopes to have an abundant harvest in the near future.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizers, and herbicides that she will apply in growing crops.

loans.name: Jeniffer Yaoska

texts.es: Jeniffer a sus 31 años de edad es una madre trabajadora, tiene un hijo de siete añitos, que va a la escuela, ella lo mantiene gracias a su pequeño negocio de pulpería, con lo que intenta salir adelante haciéndole esta inversión por el cual solicita el crédito para comprar granos básicos, cereales, gaseosas, huevos, lácteos, jugos, verdura, carne entre otros que le permitan garantizar las ventas del dia, y así poder cubrir también los diferentes gastos del hogar.
texts.en:
Jeniffer, at the age of 31, is a working mother with a 7-year-old son who attends school. She supports him, thanks to her small general store, by means of which she attempts to get ahead, the goal of this investment.

Jeniffer wishes to purchase basic grains, cereals, soft drinks, eggs, milk products, juices, vegetables, and meat, among other things. This will allow her to assure sales each day and, thus, to cover her different household expenses.

loans.use: to invest in basic grains, cereals, soft drinks, eggs, milk products, juices, and meat.

loans.name: Suyumkan

texts.ru: Суйумкан 58 лет, замужем, воспитывает 3 детей (2 дочери, 1 сын). Суйумкан имеет среднее образование. Соседи отзываются о ней как о старательной и ответственной женщине. Супруг -мелкий предприниматель, сын - строитель, старшая дочь занимается торговлей и младшая учится в школе. Супруг и дети активно помогают по хозяйству. Семья очень дружная, отношения в семье очень хорошие. Суйумкан в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи, с 1976 года занимается животноводством и полеводством, начав этот бизнес с 4,000 сом (KGS). Опыт в разведении и содержании скота очень большой. Благодаря упорному труду Суйумкан в хозяйстве имеется: 2 дойные коровы, а также имеет земельный надел размером 1,71 ГА, на которой выращивает клевер и пшеницу. Ее сельхоздеятельность приносит около 10,000 сом (KGS) в месяц, что служит основой для покрытия расходов на питание и бытовые нужды семьи. Доходы от хозяйства позволили Суйумкан вырастить и обустроить детей, а также улучшить уровень жизни. В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Суйумкан обратилась в Микрофинансовый банк «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS) на покупку бычков. Доходы от кредита Суйумкан планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение своего хозяйства, а также, в будущем намерена сделать ремонт дома, в котором проживает вместе со своей семьей.
texts.en: Suyumkan is 58 years old, married and raising three children (two daughters and one son).  Suyumkan has a secondary education.  Her neighbors thinks of her as a diligent and resposible woman.  Her husband is a small entrepreneur, son is a construction worker, the oldest daughter is involved in sales, and the youngest attends a school.  Her husband and children actively help her wth the business.  The family is very friendly, and the relationships in the family are very good.  To provide the primary source of income for her family, Suyumkan has been invovled in animal husbandry and farming since 1976, having started this business with 4,000 som (KGS).  She has a lot of experience breeding and keeping livestock.  Thanks to her hard work, Suyumkan's farm now contains two dairy cows and also a 1.71 hectare land plot, where she grows clover and wheat.  Her agricultural business yields about 10,000 som (KGS) per month, which serves as the base for covering expenses for food and consumer needs of the family.  The income from the business allowed Suyumkan to raise and situate her children and also to improve her quality of life.  In order to further develop her business, Suyumkan requested a loan in the amount of 50,000 som (KGS) from the Microfinance bank "Bai-Tushum and Partners" to buy bulls.  Suyumkan plans to invest the earnings from the loan into further growing her business and also plans to make repairs at home, where she lives with her family, in the future.

loans.use: to buy bulls

loans.name: Denis

texts.en:
This loan will help Denis purchase materials and tools to advance his flooring business.

Soon after Denis moved from Uruguay to Florida in 2000, he began working in the construction industry to support his wife, daughter, and mother-in-law. He picked up a quick affinity for flooring and has been working with tile, brick, stone and hard wood floors for the past 12 years. In December 2010, Denis decided to begin his own flooring company, Valentina Decorative Floors, offering affordable flooring products and installation. Denis attracts and retains many customers because of his unique business model—he brings the showroom to the customers’ homes, allowing his clients to select their ceramic, porcelain, stone and laminate flooring preferences without having to drive to a hardware store. He provides free in-home consultation and does not subcontract any of his work, ensuring clients that they will work directly with Denis from the first to the last day of the project. 

In the last two years, Denis has received an overwhelming number of interested clients and he is looking to expand his services. This loan will allow Denis to purchase additional flooring products and necessary tools to grow his business. 

To see videos and testimonies of Denis’ work, visit his website at: http://www.valentinadecorativefloors.com/

loans.use: to purchase necessary tools and flooring equipment

loans.name: Heidy Arely

texts.es:
Heidy, está casada y vive con su familia, sus padres, sus dos hijas y su esposo,  no tiene familiares en el extranjero. Ella, se dedica a la venta de productos de la canasta básica, dicha actividad la aprendió de su familia, realiza el oficio de forma independiente y lo desempeña de 6:00am a 7:30pm; una de sus ventajas es la estabilidad que tiene en el negocio y por el momento no presenta mayores dificultades.
El préstamo que solicita le permitirá comprar productos necesarios, tales como: frijoles, azúcar, arroz, sal, condimentos, jabón, entre otros. Esta inversión le ayudara a surtir mas su mercadería y brindarle un mejor servicio a su clientela, asimismo obtendrá mayor utilidad. 
El sueño de ella es crear un record crediticio, ya que es su primera oportunidad y por ello desea crecer en su negocio; ofrecerle una mejor calidad de vida a su familia, también adquirir un lote de tierra mas adelante.
texts.en:
Heidy is married and lives with her family:  her parents, her two daughters, and her husband.  She does not have relatives abroad.  She works in the sale of basic household products, which she learned from her family.  She is an independent businessperson and works from 6:00am to 7:30 pm.  One of her advantages is the stability that she has in the business; at the moment there are not any major difficulties.

The loan she is seeking will permit her to purchase needed products, such as:  beans, sugar, rice, salt, spices, soap, among other things.  This investment will help her to stock more of her goods, provide better service to her customers, and be more useful [to them].  Her dream is to create a credit record.  As this is her first opportunity she hopes to use it to grow her business.  This will offer her a better quality of life for her family, and to acquire a piece of land in the future.

loans.use: to purchase beans, sugar, rice, salt, spices, soap, among other things [for her business].

loans.name: Rahmon

texts.ru: Рахмон трудолюбивый человек. Ему 56 лет. Он женат и на воспитании имеет 5 детей. Дети совершеннолетние и многие из них имеют отдельное домохозяйство. Он является основным кормильцем в семье. Для Рахмона земледелие, то есть выращивание лука, арбуза, дыни и пшеницы не только для него является источником дохода, но и любимым занятием. Его жена, дети и невестки помогают ему введению бизнеса. Он имеет хорошие поля, и вода поливается самотеком из канала. Он планирует развевать бизнес, но  не имеет денег для покупки семена и минерального удобрения. Он запрашивает займ на сумму 1500 долларов США для покупки семена и минерального удобрения. Он ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: Rahmon is a hardworking person.  He is 56 years old.  He is married and raising five children.  His children are of age and many of them have their own households.  Rahmon is the primary provider for his family.  Farming for Rahmon, i.e. growing onions, watermelons, cantaloupe and wheat, is not only the source of income, but a favorite activity.  His wife, children and daughters-in-law help him with running the business.  He has good fields and water that comes from a channel.  He plans to develop his business, but does not have money to buy seeds and mineral fertilizers.  He is requesting a loan in the amount of 1500 US dollars to buy seeds and mineral fertilizers.  He awaits your kindness.

loans.use: to buy seeds and mineral fertilizers for growing onions, watermelons, cantaloupe and wheat

loans.name: Lutfy

texts.ru: Лутфи добросовестная и трудолюбивая женщина. В 2005 году ее муж умер, и ей было очень трудно справляться с семейными расходами, так как от мужа ей не досталось ничего. Она имеет 3 детей. До смерти мужа она нигде не работала и после смерти мужа она начала свой бизнес купле продажей детской одежды. Она имеет свою торговую точку на местном рынке. Недавно на рынке был пожар, и она тоже пострадала от пожара. Она должна обновить товар и увеличивать оборотный капитал на новый сезон и привлечь больше клиентов, так как ей необходимо зарабатывать больше денег для обеспечения своей семьи. Она имеет 3 внуков и старается, чтобы ее внуки росли в достатке. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 3000 долларов США для покупки мужской одежды для нового сезона. Она ждет вашу доброту и надеется на ваше милосердие.
texts.en: Lutfy is a conscientious and hardworking woman.  Her husband died in 2005, and it was really hard for her to handle family expenses because her husband did not leave her anything.  She has three children.  Prior to her husband's death, she did not work anywhere, but after started her own business of buying and selling children's clothing.  She owns a retail outlet at the local market.  Recently, there was a fire at the market, and she also suffered as a result.  She has to update her merchandise and increase her working capital for the new season, and attract more customers because she has to earn more money to provide for her family.  She has three grandsons and tries to make sure that they grow up with plentitude.  Lutfy is requesting a loan in the amount of 3000 US dollars to buy men's clothing for the new season.  She awaits your kindness and hopes for your mercy.

loans.use: to buy men's clothes for the new season

loans.name: Lolina

texts.en:
Lolina is a 58-year-old woman who is married, with seven children. To earn a living, she has a small taro plantation. 

Lolina is asking for a loan to help her pay for her children's school fees. She will also use part of the loan to buy chemicals, a backpack sprayer, bush-knives, and files. 

Lolina joined South Pacific Business Development (SPBD) in 2012 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to pay for her children's school fees and to buy chemicals, a backpack sprayer, bush-knives, and files.

loans.name: Kakadedji Group

texts.fr: Afin d'acheter des tonneaux, des poissons frite et fumés madame Akoessiwavi responsable du groupement nommé KAKADEDJI sollicite un second prêt pour satisfaire ses besoins. Elle est mariée et mère de 05 enfants dont 04 scolarisés. Aidée par 02 personnes, madame akoessiwavi espère construire une maison et agrandir son activité. Les autres membres voudraient rendre leur activité pérenne et assurer un niveau de vie acceptable à sa famille.
texts.en: In order to buy barrels, as well as fried and smoked fish, Akoessiwavi, who is responsible for the Kakadedji group, is requesting a second loan to satisfy her needs. She is married and mother to five children, four of whom are at school. Akoessiwavi hopes, with the help of two other people, to build a house and expand her business. The other members of the group would like to keep their businesses going in the long term and ensure an acceptable life for their families.

loans.use: to buy work tools and retail products.

loans.name: Luis

texts.es: Luís, de 44 años, está casado y tiene 03 hijos con quienes vive en su casa propia. El trabajo de Luís consiste en la venta de plátanos, Yucas y otros productos regionales, durante mucho tiempo tuvo problemas económicos ya que no tenía un ingreso propio de dinero para su casa, es por eso que desde hace 06 años decidió empezar un nuevo proyecto con ganas de sobresalir. Pensó que sus amigos, vecinos o familiares desearían comprar productos de su terreno dependiendo de la temporada en la que se encuentren, es así que inicio su negocio. También cuando esta en su casa se dedica a la venta de distintas bebidas gasificadas de distintos sabores. Le gusta lo que hace, pues le permite tener tiempo para poder estar al cuidado de su vivienda, además que desde que empezó con su negocio le está yendo bien en su economía, ya que tiene dos ingresos para su hogar, desea seguir creciendo, por eso tiene en mente ampliar sus ventas. Este es su primer crédito con Kiva, por ello espera de su colaboración para continuar con sus objetivos, por otro lado se compromete a pagar de manera puntual sus cuotas. Con el monto solicitado de 1000 soles, comprará abono orgánico para sus cultivos.
texts.en:
Luis is 44-years-old, married and has 3 children with whom he lives in his own house. Luis' work consists of growing and selling plantains, yuca, and other regional produce. For a long time, he had economic problems and lacked the money his household required. That is why, some 6 years ago, he decided to begin a new project to help him get ahead. He believed that his friends, neighbors and relatives would like to buy produce from his fields in season. That's why he began his business. Also, he sells soft drinks of different flavors when he is at home.

Luis likes what he does since it allows him time to care for his home. Since he started this business, his economic situation has been doing better. Now, he has 2 sources of income from his home and he wants to keep on growing. That is why he wishes to expand his sales.

This will be his 1st loan with Kiva. To accomplish that, he hopes for your collaboration so that he can continue toward his objectives. In addition, he promises to make his payments punctually. With the solicited 1,000 sols he will buy organic manure for his crops.

loans.use: to purchase organic manure for his crops.

loans.name: Juana Paula

texts.es:
La señora Juana tiene 49 años de edad, es soltera y tiene dos hijos que dependen de ella, sus ingresos provienen de la venta de tortillas y tiene 30 años de dedicarse a esta actividad.
Doña Juana su negocio está ubicado en su casa de habitación, es una persona muy trabajadora y con deseos de salir adelante necesita el préstamo para la compra de maíz, leña y cal, espera con esta inversión obtener los ingresos necesarios para apoyar a sus hijos en los estudios.
Doña Juana espera que su calidad de vida mejore con las inversión y poder seguir apoyando a sus hijos, su sueño es poder en un futuro mejorar su casa y que sus hijos terminan sus estudios para que se conviertan en personas de bien con principios y valores.


Tegucigalpa, Honduras – Agosto del 2013
texts.en:
Juana is 49 years old and is single with two dependent children. Her income comes from selling tortillas and she has been doing this for 30 years. Juana's business is located in her home. She is a hard-working person with a desire to get on in life.

Juana needs the loan to buy corn, firewood and lime powder and she hopes that this will help her to generate the necessary income to support her children in their studies. Juana hopes her quality of life will improve with this loan and she will be able to continue supporting her children. Her dream is to be able to improve her house in the future and for her children to finish their studies so they can become decent people with principles and values.

Tegucigalpa, Honduras – August 2013

loans.use: to buy corn, firewood and lime powder for her business.

loans.name: Sergio

texts.en:
This loan will help Sergio purchase updated office equipment for his consulting business and hire a part-time employee so he can better serve his clients.

Sergio began his own business five years ago with the vision of helping business owners in his local community in Miami Gardens, FL. International Services Providers is a home-based business that provides professional and consulting services to help small businesses with the development of marketing plans and strategy, promotional materials, and employee recruitment.

Looking to help his clients develop the most effective and up-to-date business models, Sergio needs to update his office equipment and software systems. This loan will allow Sergio to invest in new technology and equipment and to also hire a part-time employee in order to accept more clients and grow his business.

loans.use: to purchase updated office equipment and to hire a part-time employee.

loans.name: Natalie

texts.en:
This loan will help Natalie grow her new restaurant in Brooklyn. 

Originally from Trinidad, Natalie moved to the U.S. as a young adult and quickly found a passion for the entertainment and hospitality industry. After working for years as a successful event planner for big parties in New York City, Natalie recently decided it was time to make two big life changes: she became a mother and opened her own restaurant, D’Savannah Restaurant and Bar, in Brooklyn. Pregnant throughout the planning and organization of the restaurant’s opening, Natalie now has both a healthy newborn and a business that is already gaining a loyal clientele. 

D’Savannah specializes in Caribbean style drinks, offers a full bar, and serves small food plates. Natalie is happy that she is able to share her native culture with her New York community and bring in a diverse range of customers to her bar. Natalie did not anticipate D’Savannah to immediately attract such a large number of customers, and she now needs a loan to purchase a larger refrigerator and oven as well as new kitchen equipment in order to keep up with the restaurant’s high demand.

loans.use: to purchase a larger refrigerator and oven and to buy new equipment.

loans.name: Ma. Luisa

texts.en:
This is Ma. Luisa, 41, a resident of Batasan (Commonwealth), Quezon City,  Philippines. She is married to Elenito, a local government employee. They have children. She and her husband manage their household while operating the business. She is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Ma. Luisa operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is a retail store that sells inexpensive items, often with a single price for all items in the store. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a small amount of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns money by buying supplies at wholesale prices and selling by piece. Her regular customers are her neighbors in the local community. She earns a minimum of 500 PHP in sales every day.

She is requesting a 10,000 PHP loan to help her continue operating her business. She will use the loan to buy groceries, toiletries, and beverages to expand her product inventory.

Ma. Luisa dreams of expanding her business. She meets with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and to draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay micro finance loans.

loans.use: To buy grocery items, toiletries, and beverages for her business.

loans.name: Jovy

texts.en:
Jovy is 44 years old and is married with lovely children. To help her husband support their daily expenditures, Jovy engages in the hog raising business. She raises hogs mainly for breeding. 

Currently, Jovy has three sows. She shared that sometimes she can't provide enough feed for the animals, so she is now requesting a loan of PHP 20,000. 

If the loan is granted, Jovy will purchase the needed supply of feed for her sows. She hopes that with the loan, her income will increase so she can save for the future of her children.

loans.use: to purchase the needed supply of feed for her sows

loans.name: Gaudiosa

texts.en:
Gaudiosa is a 48-year-old married woman from Getafe, Bohol. She has three children ages 10, 13 and 17. She runs a 'sari-sari' variety store. She sells various items like powdered milk, sugar, cooking oil, shampoo and noodles. She requested a loan of 12,000 PHP to buy additional stock like canned goods, soft drinks and other beverages, to maintain the inventory of her store and attract more customers. 

In the future,Gaudiosa would like to expand her 'sari-sari' store to provide her family with good living conditions.

loans.use: to buy additional stock like canned goods, soft drinks and other beverages

loans.name: Mariame

texts.fr: Madame Mariame est une femme qui habite dans le quartier ou se situe le guichet. Elle est mariée et mère d'un seul enfant de 12ans. Elle est commerçante de profession et évolue dans la vente de tissus et chaussures. Mariame a une expérience de 2ans dans cet activité et commence sa journée à 17 pour la terminer à 19h car c'est elle qui fait le ménage chez elle à la maison. Elle aide son mari dans la gestion des dépenses quotidiennes de la famille et les frais de scolarité de son enfants. Elle a besoin de ce crédit pour augmenter son stock de marchandises et satisfaire sa clientèle. A l'avenir elle souhaite ouvrir une boutique spécialisée dans la vente de tissus de grandes valeurs afin de pourvoir augmenter ses revenus et améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille;
texts.en: Mrs. Mariame lives near our branch office. She is married and has one 12-year old child. She is a vendor and sells fabric and shoes. Mariame has two years of experience in this work. She works from 5 to 7 PM as she is the one taking care of the household chores. She helps her husband with household expenses and  her children’s school costs. She need this loan in order to expand her merchandise stock and meet customer demand. In the future, she would like to open a shop specializing in high-quality fabric in order to be able to increase her revenues and improve her family’s life conditions.

loans.use: to buy fabric and shoes for resale.

loans.name: Elena

texts.en: Elena is married, has one child, and lives in Maloro, Tangub City. She owns and runs a carenderia business (restaurant) and earns approximately 1,000 PHP each day doing this work. She has requested a loan to buy additional kilos of meat for her business. Elena has been a member of PMPC for five years. In the future, Elena hopes to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy meat for her restaurant

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
This is Rebecca, 57, a resident of Batasan (Commonwealth), Quezon City, Philippines. She is married to Gary, a driver, and they have children. Together with her husband, she manages their household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Rebecca operates a room rental business; it is rented on a monthly basis. She also sells pork for additional income. She earns a minimum of 17,000 Philippine Pesos (PHP) in sales every month.

To help her continue the operations of her business, she is requesting a loan of Php 10,000. She will use the loan for the repair and maintenance of her room for rent. 

Rebecca dreams of expanding her business and hopes to be successful in life. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and draws strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay micro finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for the repair and maintenance of her room for rent.

loans.name: Florencio

texts.es:
Florencio tiene 42 años de edad, vive en la ciudad de Aguaytia, Florencio trabaja día a día como agricultor, el labora alrededor de 9 horas al día, sobre todo porque siempre está pendiente de cómo se desarrolla su cultivo,  también obtiene ingresos transportando carga pesada con el fruto de su trabajo obtiene los ingresos para poder solventar los gastos de su hogar y a si poder sacar adelante a su familia.
