Florencio está muy agradecido con el apoyo que le están brindado los prestamistas kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le están brindando el podrá realizar mejoras en su vivienda, lo cual le permitirá mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia y seguir luchando para poder hacer realidad su más grande sueño:” Terminar de construir su vivienda de material noble”.
texts.en: Florencio is 42 years old and lives in the city of Aguaytia. Florencio’s main job is farming. He works about 9 hours a day, mostly because he is always keeping an eye on how his crops are developing. Florencio also earns some income transporting heavy loads; in this way, he earns money to pay his household expenses and to support his family. Florencio is very grateful for the support he is receiving from Kiva lenders because it allows him to make improvements on his home, which will improve his family’s quality of life, and enables to him to keep working towards achieving his biggest dream: to finish building his home using quality materials.

loans.use: to make improvements on his home.

loans.name: Prudencia Antonia

texts.es:
Prudencia es una mujer de 47 años, es soltera, vive en la ciudad de Huaraz, en el distrito de Carhuaz, ella es una persona muy amable, trabajadora y entusiasta, que dedica todos sus esfuerzos por salir adelante; lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos y por la necesidad que tuvo de trabajar desde muy joven para ayudar a sus padres, Prudencia no pudo estudiar la carrera profesional de Secretariado que deseaba.
Por iniciativa propia, Prudencia trabaja en su pequeño negocio de venta de ropa, tanto para damas, caballeros y niños, ella trabaja todos los días por un aproximado de 10 horas y cree que le va bien por su dedicación y por el trato amable que brinda a los demás.
Prudencia se encuentra muy agradecida con los prestamistas Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá comprar mayor cantidad de prendas de vestir para su venta, así pues ella seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para lograr su gran sueño de tener su casa propia.
texts.en:
Prudencia is a 47-year-old woman. She is single and lives in the city of Huaraz, Carhuaz district. She is a kind, hardworking and enthusiastic person, fighting to get ahead. Unfortunately, due to the lack of resources and the need to work since she was very young in order to help her parents, Prudencia could not study to become a secretary, something she really wanted to do.

Prudencia took the initiative to open a small business selling clothes for women, men and children. She works every day for approximately ten hours and she believes that she is doing well thanks to her dedication and the way she treats others.

Prudencia is grateful to Kiva lenders. Thanks to their help, she will be able to buy a larger quantity of garments to sell and continue working and fighting to reach her goal of buying her own house.

loans.use: to buy merchandise to sell.

loans.name: Nicolas Emilio

texts.es:
Nicolas tiene 57 años de edad y vive en la ciudad de Carhuaz. Nicolas cada día sale a trabajar con mucho entusiasmo, ya que tiene su negocio de venta de bebidas naturales y emolientes, y con los ingresos su trabajo puede solventar los gastos de su familia.

Nicolas esta muy agradecido con los prestamistas kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado el podrá comprar mas insumos para la elaboración de sus bebidas como hierbas al por mayor, así como mejorar su carrito emolientero, de esta manera podrá atender mejor  sus clientes y poder luchar por hacer realidad su más grande sueño:” Ser una gran microempresario”.
texts.en:
Nicolás is 57 years old and lives in the city of Carhuaz. Every day, Nicolás goes to work with enthusiasm; he sells natural beverages and moisturizers. With the income he receives, he covers the home expenses.

Nicolás is grateful to Kiva lenders, since thanks to the help they have given him, he will be able to buy supplies to prepare his beverages (such as different herbs in bulk) and repair the cart he uses to sell his products. This way he will take better care of his customers and will continue fighting to make his dream come true: “to become a great micro entrepreneur.”

loans.use: to buy supplies and repair his cart.

loans.name: Navy Zain

texts.es:
Navy tiene 41 años de edad, tiene una familia la cual está conformada por su esposo y sus 2 hijos de 19 y 6 años a quienes quiere muchísimo y por quienes lucha cada día para poder ofrecerles una vida digna. Navy ha atravesado por muchas adversidades y por ello no pudo estudiar una carrera universitaria, pero le hubiera gustado estudiar la carrera de administración. Para poder solventar los gastos de su familia Navy trabaja como empleada de limpieza en una institución de su ciudad, ella labora alrededor de 9 horas al día, también tiene un pequeño negocio de venta de cosméticos, con el cual tiene un dinero extra y cree que está saliendo adelante con su trabajo porque es responsable.

Navy está muy agradecido con los prestamistas kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado ella podrá realizar mejoras en su vivienda y asi poder mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia, lo que le permitirá seguir luchando para poder hacer realidad su más grande sueño:” Tener un negocio de alquilar de cuartos y darle educación a sus hijos”.
texts.en:
Navy, 41, is married and has two children, ages 19 and 6 who she loves very much and works hard for in order to give them a decent lifestyle.  Navy has faced much adversity in her life and was unable to study to get a university degree.  But she would have liked to have studied business administration.  In order to take care of household expenses, Navy works as a cleaner at an institution in her city.  She works nine hours a day and also has a small business selling cosmetics in order to earn extra income.  She believes she is getting ahead in her work because she is responsible.

Navy is very grateful to Kiva lenders because thanks to their help she will be able to renovate her house and give her family a better quality of life.  This will allow her to continue working toward her greatest goal of "Having a room rental business and be able to give her children an education.".

loans.use: To renovate her house.

loans.name: Yamid Antonio

texts.es: Yamid, a sus 28 años de edad, se dedica a cultivar moras y tomate de árbol, de manera independiente, en la finca donde reside. Esta actividad la aprendió de su hermano mayor desde que era niño, pues toda su vida ha vivido en el campo. Los productos que obtiene de la cosecha son vendidos en la plaza de mercado del pueblo donde reside; de esta manera logra generar ingresos para solventar las necesidades básicas de su hogar. Yamid es un hombre pujante, juicioso, trabajador y se esmera día a día para salir adelante; con gran esmero ha sobrepasado diversos obstáculos que se le presentan debido a los altos costos de los insumos agrícolas y al clima cambiante que le ha ocasionado daño a sus cultivos; sin embargo, esto no lo detiene, por el contrario siempre busca opciones que le permitan seguir avanzando. Por esta razón solicita el segundo ciclo de crédito, como apoyo para continuar con su actividad, éste será invertido en la compra de insumos agrícolas al por mayor (abonos, pesticidas, fertilizantes) con lo que podrá seguir cuidando sus cultivos y sacar una cosecha con productos de buena calidad, que puedan ser vendidos a mejor precio en el mercado; esto se verá reflejado en el incremento de sus ingresos. Así, Yamid espera poder avanzar para cumplir el sueño de ampliar sus cultivos para tener mayor producción, que le permita ofrecer mejores condiciones de vida a su familia.
texts.en:
Yamid is 28 years old and earns a living growing blackberries and tree tomatoes independently on the farm where he lives. He learnt how to do this from his older brother when he was a child, since he has lived in the countryside all his life. The products he harvests are sold in the market square in the town where he lives. By doing this he is able to generate enough income to cover his basic household needs. Yamid is determined, level-headed and hard-working and he constantly tries hard to improve his life. With a lot of effort he has been able to overcome various difficulties which have affected him such as the high cost of agricultural supplies and the changing climate which has caused damage to his crops. However, this does not hold him back but instead he looks for ways to continue making progress.

This is why Yamid is asking for a second loan, as a support to help him in his work. He will use the loan to buy agricultural supplies wholesale (manure, pesticides, fertilisers) which will help him to continue looking after his crops and give him a harvest of good quality fruit, which will sell at a better price in the market. This will be reflected in an increase in his income and Yamid then hopes to be able to work towards his dream of expanding his crop growing so he can produce more, which will enable him to provide better living conditions for his family.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies wholesale (manure, pesticides, fertilisers).

loans.name: Gelsy Suyapa

texts.es:
La señora Gelsy tiene 32 años de edad, vive con su esposo y tiene cuatro hijos que dependen de ella, sus ingresos provienen de la venta de ropa y tiene 7 años de dedicarse a esta actividad.
Doña Gelsy su negocio está ubicado en su casa de habitación, es una persona muy trabajadora y con deseos de salir adelante necesita el préstamo para la compra de blusas, pantalones, vestidos, camisetas y sandalias de todo tipo,para tener mas mercaderia a la venta, espera con esta inversión obtener los ingresos necesarios para apoyar a su familia con los gastos del hogar.
Doña Gelsy espera que su calidad de vida mejore con la inversión y poder asi seguir apoyando a su esposo e hijos, su sueño es en un futuro mejorar su casa y que sus hijos terminen sus estudios.


Tegucigalpa, Honduras – Agosto del 2013
texts.en:
Gelsy, age 32, lives with her husband, and she has four children who are dependent upon her.  Her income comes from selling clothes.  She has been engaged in this business activity for seven years.  Gelsy’s business is located in her house.  She is a very hard-working person, and she wishes to get ahead.

She needs the loan to buy blouses, pants, dresses, t-shirts, and all types of sandals.  She needs more merchandise to sell.  With this investment, she hopes to get the income needed to help her family with the household expenses.

Gelsey hopes that her quality of life will improve with this investment.  She hopes that she will be able to continue supporting her husband and children.  Her dream for the future is to improve her house and for her children to finish their education.

Tegucigalps, Honduras – August 2013

loans.use: to buy blouses, pants, dresses, t-shirts, and  sandals for her business.

loans.name: Melba

texts.en:
Melba is 34 years old and lives in Silanga, Tangub City. She is married with five children. 

Melba has a fish vending business and earns approximately PHP 3,000 each month doing this type of work. She has requested a loan to buy more kilos of fish to sell. 

Melba has been a member of PMPC for two years. In the future, she hopes to improve her living standard.

loans.use: to buy additional kilos of fish to sell.

loans.name: Jacqueline Nina

texts.fr: Jacqueline est une femme de 26 ans, célibataire et mère d'un enfant. elle possède et gère  un stand où elle vend des vivres frais (huile de palme, macabo, igname, citron, patate) dans un quartier de la ville depuis plus de 10 ans. elle sollicite ce crédit pour renforcer son stock de marchandises au vu de la demande grandissante afin d'augmenter ses bénéfices. les bénéfices générés vont être réinvestis dans son activité d'une part et subviendront aux besoins de sa famille d'autre part afin de relever son niveau de vie.
texts.en:
Jacqueline is a 26 year old single mother of one child. She owns and manages a stand where she has been selling fresh food (palm oil, macabo, also known as cocoyam, yams, lemons, and potatoes) in a district of the city for over ten years. She is requesting this loan to increase her stock of merchandise due to the growing demand of her customers. This increase in sales will allow her to increase her revenue.

Part of the income she earns will be used to reinvest in her business, and the rest will be used to pay for the needs of her family and raise their standard of living.

loans.use: to purchase fresh food (palm oil, macabo, also known as cocoyam, yams, lemons, and potatoes) for resale.

loans.name: Nasra

texts.en:
Nasra's husband is a welder by profession. She has requested a loan from Kiva's field partner BRAC Pakistan to help her husband. As the stock of his welding material is not enough to work efficiently, he needs to purchase more products to offer better and more professional services to his customers. This will going to help him to attract more customers, and to get a good profit in the future.

Nasra herself is a 55-year-old housewife. She always keeps smiling, even in the bad days of life. She strongly believe that ups and downs are a part of life, so there is no need to get worried; just keep yourself happy in every stage of life.

She wants to help her husband because he is the only earner for the family, and the income generated from his shop plays a very important role in meeting the daily household expenses. Presently his net income is not enough to pay for the daily and monthly expenses, which include electricity bills, gas and water bills, food expenses, children's education expenses, etc. 

So Nasra has requested a loan to improve her husband's business. The Kiva loan would be helpful for him in purchasing a welding machine and a variety of welding tools.

Nasra wants to thank all Kiva lenders for their kind support. She says that the Kiva lenders are like angels, and the blessing of God in her life.

loans.use: To purchase a welding machine and welding tools for her husband's welding shop.

loans.name: Sarwa Wiguna Group

texts.en:
Because two of the group members resigned, now the Sarwa Wiguna group continues their loan with eight members and the same loan size, with some of the members having an increased amount.

Still chosen as the head of the group, Ni Ketut used her loan to purchase feed only. From the profit last period, she purchased a sow. Now she has two sows and four fattening pigs. She hopes she can sell the pigs next month, and the sows can give birth to very healthy piglets. Her main goal is to become a piglet seller. 

Her entire family supports her business because the business helps her family’s welfare, and they can live happily.

loans.use: to purchase superior quality feed for her sows and piglets.

loans.name: Songa Group

texts.en:
Ashura, who is in her early 30s, is single, with a boy who is enrolled in school. She has been managing her life expenses by having a beauty salon business for five years now. She is doing great in her business and her family, as well. Ashura works from 8am to 6pm daily and is able to make a fair return each month.

This will be Ashura's second loan request from Tujijenge Tanzania, which she will use to buy needed beauty salon equipment. She used the previous loan to add to her business equipment and she has successfully paid back all of her loan. 

With the profit earned, she covered her son's school fees and home expenses. Ashura dreams that, one day, she will be able to own a grocery business. 

Ashura will share this loan with her loan group, 'Songa Group,' which consists of ten members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy needed beauty salon equipment.

loans.name: Responsabilidad Y Progreso Group

texts.es: La Sra. Nancy  de 41 años de edad, es viuda y tiene 5 hijos de los cuales 2 aún dependen de ella. Lleva 2 años como cliente de Edaprospo y se dedica a la  venta de pasteles. Comenzó por medio de la motivación de su hija, quien  la incentivo  a que ponga su propio negocio  como una persona independiente. También se dedica la  venta de comida. Con su esfuerzo y trabajo, Nancy  ha logrado construir su casa y a darles una  mejor calidad de  vida a su familia. Ella cubre los gastos de alimentación, educación, vestimenta y servicios   su hogar. Su plan para el futuro es construir  el segundo piso de su casa y que sus hijos estudien en la universidad. Ella usa el préstamo para la compra de materia prima. Nancy pertenece a la alcancía comunal “Responsabilidad y Progreso”, el cual está conformado por 6 personas y lleva el cargo de presidenta, ella es la persona que se encuentra de pie en el grupo. La Sra. Nancy  es la persona que se encuentra de pie con una casa de color blanco al costado de la otras señoras.
texts.en:
Nancy, age 41, is a widow with five children. Two of them are still dependent upon her.  She's been with EDAPROSPO for two years.  She sells cakes.  Her daughter encouraged her to start and motivated her to set up her own business as an independent person.  Nancy also sells food.  With her effort and her work, Nancy has managed to build her house and to give her family a better quality of life.  She covers the expenses for food, education, clothing, and household services.  Her plan for the future is to build a second floor onto her house.  She also plans for her children to attend the university.

She is using the loan to buy raw material.  Nancy belongs to the Responsibilidad y Progreso communal bank.  The bank is comprised of six people, and Nancy is the president.  She is the person standing in the group.  Nancy is standing with a white jacket, and she is next to the other women.

loans.use: to buy raw material.

loans.name: Ayabavi

texts.fr: Revendeuse de produits de premières nécessités (riz, sucre, huile végétale) depuis 2008 Ayaba est mère d’01 enfant d’ 01an. Elle a 34ans et a pour époux un vétérinaire. Madame s’approvisionne d’habitude au Grand Marché de Lomé et revend dans sa boutique. Ce cinquième prêt lui servira à acheter des marchandises vu que son stock s’épuise pour vendre à sa clientèle. Elle espère ouvrir d’autres boutiques et assurer l’épanouissement de la famille.
texts.en: Ayaba has been selling first necessity goods (rice, sugar, vegetable oil etc) since 2008. She has a one-year old child. She is 34 years old, and her husband is a veterinarian. Ayaba usually stocks up at the big market of Lomé and sells out of her shop. This fifth loan will allow her to restock her merchandise as she has run out of some items and meet customer demand. She hopes to open other sales points and ensure the well-being of her family.

loans.use: to buy basic food products.

loans.name: Tegal Badeng Indah Group

texts.en:
The Tegal Badeng Indah group is led by Ni Made, a mother of two children, one in elementary school and the other in kindergarten. Her husband works as driver.

Ni Made has a small kiosk in front of her house, and she also runs a pig business. She arises each morning at 5:00 a.m. to feed and maintain her pigs and then performs her housework, after which she opens her kiosk. She will use her portion of the loan to purchase piglets and feed.

Ni Made and the group hope they can increase their income because the price for pork is now quite high and enjoys strong demand in the market. Ni Made has a dream to enlarge her kiosk with profits arising from her pig business.

loans.use: To purchase piglets and feed

loans.name: Apélété

texts.fr: Père de famille, Mr Apélété est marié à une revendeuse. Il est aussi revendeur mais lui s’est beaucoup plus penché sur la vente des produits chimiques. Il exerce seul l’activité au marché et sa difficulté est la concurrence sur le terrain. Pour garder ses clients, mieux satisfaire à leurs demandes, il sollicite de WAGES un prêt pour s’approvisionner en marchandises (produits chimiques). Il voudrait être grossiste des produits chimiques à son lieu d’activité et assurer le bien – être de la famille. Il est âgé de 40ans.
texts.en: Mr. Apelete is married   and has children. His wife is a vendor. He is also a vendor but specializes mainly in chemical products. He works alone at the market, and his challenge is high competiton. In order to keep his customers and better meet their needs he is seeking a loan from WAGES to stock up on merchandise (chemical products). He would like to become a chemical products wholesaler locally and to provide for the well-being of his family. He is 40 years old.

loans.use: to buy chemical products.

loans.name: Erika Lorena

texts.es:
La Joven  Erika tiene 31 años de edad, es soltera y no tienen hijos que dependan de ella, vive en un barrio de Tegucigalpa, en el centro de Honduras, es muy responsable y trabajadora.
Erika su negocio es la venta de ropa y se dedica a esta actividad desde hace 9 años, ella compra su mercadería en un país vecino, sus clientes  son todos los vecinos y amigos que le visitan a diario para adquirir sus productos.
Erika está solicitando su préstamo para la compra de pantalones, camisas, blúmeres, calzoncillos, braseares, faldas, etc. para tener más mercadería y poder cubrir la demanda de sus clientes y así obtener los ingresos que le permitan mejorar un poco su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
Erika espera que esta inversión le permita poder salir adelante y la vez mejorar su negocio, su sueño es que su negocio sea uno de los más reconocidos de su comunidad.



Tegucigalpa, Honduras – Agosto del 2013
texts.en:
Erika, age 31, is a single young woman who does not have dependent children.  She lives in a neighborhood in Tegucigalpa in the center of Honduras.  She is very responsible and hard-working.

Erika’s business is selling clothes, and she has been engaged in this business activity for nine years.  She buys her merchandise in a neighboring country.  Her customers are all of the neighbors and friends who visit her daily in order to get her products.

Erika is requesting a loan to buy pants, shirts, underwear, bras, and skirts, etc.  She will do this in order to have more merchandise and to be able to cover her customer demand.  This way she will get more income that will allow her to improve, a bit, her quality of life and that of her family.

Erika hopes that this investment will allow her to be able to get ahead and to improve her business.  Her dream is for her business to become one of the most well-known in her community.

Tegucigalps, Honduras – August 2013

loans.use: to buy pants, shirts, underwear, bras, and skirts, etc. for her business.

loans.name: Archelle Lynn

texts.en:
Archelle Lynn is 31 years old and lives in Brgy 3, Tangub City. She is married, with two children. 

Archelle Lynn has a shop that is a sari-sari store. She has had this business for two years. 

She requested a loan for additional capital for her business, to buy more inventory.

Archelle Lynn has been a member of Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) for two years. In the future, Archelle Lynn hopes to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy more inventory for her store.

loans.name: Vikindu Group

texts.en:
Rajabu, who is in his early 50s, is married and has five children who are in school. Since 2011, Rajabu has been running a carpentry business. He also has another business selling cold soft drinks. He works from 8am to 9pm daily and is able to make a fair profit per month. This is his fourth loan request withTujijenge Tanzania, which he will use to buy more carpentry wood and soft drinks. With the previous loans, all of which he paid back successfully, Rajabu made some business improvements like making cleanness in his carpentry premise, bought soft drinks and wood.  He also used it to buy a business fridge. With the profit received, Rajabu managed to pay school fees and home expenses. 

Rajabu dreams that one day will be able to own a carpentry company. He will share this loan will his loan group " VIKINDU" which totals 7 members . The members of the group will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: buy lumber and soft drinks

loans.name: Dougoudeme Ii Group

texts.fr:
Les membres du groupe  DOUGOUDEME II  sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de   26 ans, 3 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles polygames à DIOMANA, un des villages de KEBILA, Préfecture de KOLONDIEBA, 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur septième prêt avec l’institution, les prêt passés ont été bien remboursés.
La spéculation cultivée est le sésame  avec   MAYATOU  1ère debout à gauche sur la photo.
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter des intrants, la semence et payer les frais de labour pour exploiter  2 hectares. 
La production est vendue au niveau du village et à   KEBILA  après la récolte à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 145.500FCFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The members of the group "DOUGOUDEME II" are married women, who average 26 years of age and three children each, all living in polygamous families in DIOMANA, a village in KEBILA, Préfecture de KOLONDIEBA (3rd administrative region of the Republic of Mali). The women are collaborating with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso to carry out their farm work during the rainy season. They are on their seventh loan with the institution. The past loans were indeed paid back. 

The crop grown is sesame, as is the case with MAYATOU, who is first from the left in the photo. With her loan, she intends to purchase some farm inputs and seeds and to pay for plowing to make use of 2 hectares.

After the harvest, the produce is sold to men and women customers in the village and in KEBILA. She plans on making an average profit of 145,500 francs CFA per planting. This profit will enable her to pay back the loan and also to help her husband to cover day-to-day expenses.

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs and seeds and to pay for plowing fields

loans.name: Dionicia

texts.es: Dionicia, de 50 años,esta casada y es madre de 4 hijos pero actualmente solo vive con su esposo en su casa propia. El trabajo de Dionicia consiste en la venta de plátanos, Yucas, café  y otros productos de su terreno agrícola, viene realizando esta actividad desde hace  10 años. Decidió empezar un nuevo proyecto con ganas de sobresalir, ahora prepara sus hectáreas de tierra que heredó de su padre y esta sembrando cacao. También cuando esta en su casa se dedica a la venta de distintos productos comestibles. Le gusta lo que hace, pues le permite tener tiempo para poder estar al cuidado de sus animales, su casa y su esposo, además que desde que empezó con su negocio le está yendo bien en su economía, ya que tienen dos ingresos para su hogar y desea seguir creciendo, por eso tiene en mente ampliar sus ventas. Este es su primer crédito con Kiva, por ello espera de su colaboración para continuar con sus objetivos, por otro lado se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual. Con el monto solicitado de 1500 soles para la compra  abono orgánico y así nutrir sus sembríos.
texts.en:
Dionicia, age 50, is married and has four children.  However, she currently lives alone with her husband in her own house.  Dionicia sells bananas, yuccas, coffee, and other products from her farmland.  She has been engaged in this business activity for ten years.  

She decided to start a new product with the desire to excel.  She is now preparing the hectares of land that she inherited from her father, and she is planting cacao.  Also, when she is at home, she sells different food products.  She likes what she does.  It allows her to have time to be able to take care of her animals, her house, and her husband.  Since she started with her business her finances are going well for her.  This is because they have two incomes for their household.

She wishes to continue growing.  In order to do so she plans on expanding her sales.  This is her first loan with Kiva.  She hopes to have your collaboration in order to be able to continue with her objectives.  She pledges to make her payments punctually.  She will use the requested 1,500 soles to buy organic fertilizer to nourish her crops.

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizer.

loans.name: José

texts.es: Gracias al crédito de kiva Jose en la cosecha pasada pudo aumentar su producción ya que compro fertilizantes que le ayudaron a que sus plantas produjeran mas café y pudo pagas a jornaleros que le ayudaron en la poda y chapeo para que las plantas estuvieran en optimas condiciones y la finca limpia para la temporada de cosecha, para esta nueva etapa de créditos Jose solicita para la compra de plantas ya que necesita reforestar una parte de su finca en la cual tiene muchas plantas viejas que ya no tienen buena producción también necesita comprar fertilizantes que le ayudaran a sus plantas nuevas a crecer y a las que están produciendo aumenten considerablemente con ello vera un aumento  en su producción lo cual le traerá mejores ganancias económicas.
texts.en:
Thanks to the Kiva loan for the previous harvest, José was able to increase production because he bought fertilizer that helped his plants produce more coffee and he was able to pay day laborers to help him weed and prune so that the plants could be in optimum conditions and the farm was cleared for the next planting season.

In this new loan cycle, José is requesting in order to buy plants because he needs to replant part of his orchard that has many old plants that are no longer producing well and he also needs to buy fertilizer that will help his new plants to grow and the ones that are in production to increase considerably.  This will lead to increased production that in turn will produce higher economic profits.

loans.use: to buy plants and fertilizer.

loans.name: Juan Carlos

texts.es: Juan Carlos, está casado, tiene la edad de 34 años y vive con su esposa y su hijo que son su mayor prioridad. El con el crédito va realizarle una mejora a su local para establecer una soda y también comprar mercadería y utensilios que le faltan para su establecimiento. El tiene pensado establecer su puesto de soda en muy buenas condiciones para así poder ir aumentando su clientela. A la vez también quiere aprovechar que se encuentra frente de un colegio y genera muchas ventas por los estudiantes. El tiene como meta aumentar sus ganancias y darle a su familia una mejor calidad en el futuro. Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. El no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en:
Juan Carlos is married.  He’s 34-years-old living with his wife and son who are his greatest priority.  He will use the loan to make some improvements to his locale to set up a soda stand and also to buy merchandise and utensils he needs for the establishment.  He’s thinking about opening a soda stand in very good condition in order to gradually increase his clientele.  At the same time he wants to take advantage of the fact that he’s located across from a school and students generate very good sales.  His goal is to increase profits to give his family belter quality of life in future.

This is the first loan he’s gotten from Fudecosur.  He’s had no previous loans with state banks and Fudecosur offered the best terms and a much lower interest rate.

loans.use: to improve his stand's infrastructure and to buy merchandise.

loans.name: José Manuel

texts.es: José Manuel pudo pagar las labores culturales la cosecha pasada que le ayudaron a mantener en optimas condiciones su finca para la temporada de cosecha y con las ganancias obtenidas pudo empezar a construir su vivero y así poder comercializar plantas de café con los demás socios y  tener una ganancia económica extra, en este nuevo ciclo José Manuel pide un  crédito para la compra de fertilizantes los cuales le ayudaran a que las plantas de su vivero crezcan sanas y a las que tiene en edad productiva aumenten considerablemente su producción esperando con ello mas ganancias económicas con las cuales seguirá trabajando en su vivero.
texts.en: During his last crop cycle, Jose Manuel was able to pay farmhands to help him maintain his farm in optimal condition for the harvest season.  With the earnings he obtained he was able to start building his nursery, which enabled him to sell coffee plants to other members of his cooperative to earn some extra income.  In this new loan cycle, Jose Manuel is requesting a loan to buy fertilizers to help him grow healthy plants in his nursery and have increased production from the plants on his farm.  He hopes that with this loan he will increase his earnings and will be able to continue working in his nursery.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers

loans.name: Justina

texts.es: Justina, de 40 años, es madre de 03 hijos que ya son independientes y vive en su casa propia a lado de su esposo. El trabajo de Justina consiste en el cultivo de Yucas, cacao, café y otros productos de su terreno agrícola, sufrió algunos contratiempos en su vida, debido a que su esposo perdió su empleo como obrero  y no  había dinero para la canasta familiar, es por eso que desde hace un 09 años decidió empezar un nuevo proyecto con ganas de sobresalir. Decidió empezar a sembrar productos de la región en su terreno el cual tiene mucha acogida por las personas que recurren diariamente al mercado. Le gusta lo que hace, pues le permite tener tiempo para poder estar al cuidado de su vivienda, además que desde que empezó con su negocio le está yendo bien en su economía. Este es su primer crédito con Kiva, por ello espera de su colaboración para continuar con sus objetivos, por otro lado se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual.Con el monto solicitado de 1500 soles, comprará abono orgánico para sus sembríos.
texts.en:
Justina, age 40, has three children who are independent.  She lives in her own house with her husband.  Justina grows yucca, cacao, coffee, and other products on her farmland.  She has suffered some setbacks in her life because her husband lost his job as a workman.  There was not enough money for the family’s basic needs.  That is why, nine years ago, with the desire to succeed, she decided to start a new product.  

She decided to start planting regional products on her land.  It is very well-received by the people who go to the market daily.  She likes what she does.  It allows her to have time to be able to take care of her house.  Also, since she started her business, her finances are going well for her.

This is her first Kiva loan.  She is hoping for your collaboration in order to continue with her objectives.  She pledges to make her payments punctually. She will use the requested 1,500 soles to buy organic fertilizer for her crops.

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizer.

loans.name: Hercules

texts.en:
Hercules is a 31-year-old  married man from Talibon, Bohol. He has 3 children ages 1, 5 and 7. He does farming and grows and sells rice as a source of livelihood. He has been farming rice for almost 2 years. 

Hercules lacks capital to sustain his main source of income which is farming . So he requested a loan of 6000 PHP to buy  fertilizers and  pesticides. In the future, Hercules would like to improve his farming business to have a bountiful harvest so he can continue send his children to school.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and  pesticides

loans.name: Clarita

texts.en:
Clarita, a 54-year-old mother of four, lives in Nacional, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. Her husband operates their farm, which is the main source of income for the family.  Clarita helps him to manage their garden of eggplants and sell it in town to make a living. They have been doing in their farm since they got married and Clarita has been engaged her garden for  years. 

Clarita successfully repaid her previous loans.  She took a new loan of 15,000 PHP from Gata Daku MPC to cover the cost of farm weeding maintenance and to buy fertilizer to get an abundant harvest. She plans to cultivate all of the vacant lot on their land to generate more revenue and able to save for the better future of the family.

loans.use: pay for weeding and buy fertilizer

loans.name: Kétodji

texts.fr: Kétodji est un jeune homme de 38ans. Marié, il a 05 enfants dont 04 scolarisés. Il a démarré en 2000, la vente des CD et DVD dans une boutique et sollicite son premier crédit pour renforcer son activité. Il voudrait à l'avenir agrandir son activité et mieux éduquer ses enfants. Sa femme est revendeuse d'igname.
texts.en: Kétodji is a young man, 38 years old, and married, and he has five children, of whom four are in school. He started off in 2000 selling CD's and DVD's in a shop. He is requesting his first loan to bolster his business. For the future, he would like to expand his business and to educate his children further. His wife is a retailer of yams.

loans.use: to purchase CD's and DVD's to sell

loans.name: Kolab's Group

texts.en:
Kolab is 27 years old and married. She has two little children to cater for. For her kids' sake, she grows rice on a half-hectare area and cassava on a two-hectare area.  She has been involved in the current business for three years, earning about 26,000 KHR per day. 

Kolab, who has never been with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) before, is leading a group of three to get this new loan. The total amount of her group loan is 3,400,000 KHR, of which 1,000,000 KHR is her loan portion. Kolab will spend her loan portion to pay for plowing and weeding fees for her cassavas. She hopes that she can make more income from her current business so that she can grow peppers for additional income.

loans.use: pay for plowing and weeding fees

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ponhea Krek district

loans.name: Jewander

texts.en:
Jewander is a young, single entrepreneur who lives in Rizal, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. After finishing her studies, she opened and managed a general store in town to earn a living. After two years of running the business, it looks good and improving. 

Jewander took a loan of 15,000 PHP from Gata Daku MPC to purchase canned goods, flour, sugar, noodles and milk in addition to her working inventory capital. She planned to expand her business using her generated revenue and hopes to have a better living in the near future.

loans.use: restock her store

loans.name: Esterlita

texts.en: Esterlita is 30 years old and a mother of four children. She lives in Mialem, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental with her family. Her husband is a farmer operating their own farm and she helps generate income with her vegetable garden. In 2012, she joined Gata Daku MPC and borrowed a loan of 5,000 PHP to buy fertilizer such as manure. She hopes to have plenty of harvest from the farm to sell and use it for her children’s education.

loans.use: buy fertilizer

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy merchandise

loans.name: Amina

texts.en:
Amina Ali is a 43-year-old, married Iraqi woman. She is the mother of five children. She is a tailor and works from home. Amina started her business in 2003 to help her husband support the family. Amina has a very good reputation in her neighborhood. She decided to take out a loan to develop her business and increase her profits so that she may continue assisting her husband with providing additional income to improve the living conditions of her children.

The story of Amina and her business is just one of the many examples of Izdiharona for Economic Development's clients who have been able to improve their business with a small business loan product, specifically designed to meet the needs of small businesses where a relatively small amount of capital can provide significant business improvement.

loans.use: to buy a new sewing machine and fabric for her business.

loans.name: Ka's Group

texts.en:
Originally from the Dambae district of Kampong Cham province, Ka is 48 years old and a married mother of five children. Her main source of income is from two hectares of cassava and rice farming. She has been involved in her current business for 28 years. 

Ka, a third-time borrower, is in the same group with two first-time borrowers to get a new loan from VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She has utilized her past loan wisely to pay for weeding and harvesting her crops seasonably. Now, she and her co-borrowers are seeking a loan for 1,000,000 KHR each. As the leader, she will spend her loan portion to pay for transplanting her crops, to buy fertilizer, and to pay plowing fee for her farmland.

loans.use: pay to transplant and farm her crops

loans.name: Farzana

texts.en:
Farzana has requested for a Kiva loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan to financially support her husband. He has been running a clothing business for  the past many years. He purchases various varieties of ladies clothing and sells them in the main market at a profitable price. He tries his best to offer good quality materials to his customers, because of that his customers love the varieties he offers. 

Farzana belongs to a deprived family. She has three children and is passing her life with lots of challenges. Currently, her husband is going through serious financial issues and he is unable to purchase more stocks of ladies clothing to sell. Because of this he is unable to generate income to pay for family expenses. He hasn't paid the electricity bill for the previous month due to lack of finances. 
 
Therefore, Farzana has asked for a Kiva loan to help her husband. With the help of this Kiva loan, he would be able to continue his work and continue generating income. He would purchase a variety of ladies unstitched clothing from different areas and sells them in his shop at a profitable price. Farzana sends best wishes to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: buy clothes to sell

loans.name: Ana

texts.en:
A $600 loan is offered to Ana to improve her business. She opened her local business in 2007 with her own working capital. She will use the loan to buy stocks to keep in her store, like a milling machine and corn milling.  

Ana is generating a good income from selling.  She has been thinking of running a big business after years of involving herself in doing business. 

Ana lives in a town with her family.  She is happy with this loan because Tuba Rai Metin offers loan for poor people to improve their living conditions.

loans.use: buy a rice milling machine and corn milling

loans.name: Lamou Gnima's Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupement est composé de femmes très engagées qui ont su développer depuis la création du banc villageois le 06 Juin 2002 en plus des activités génératrices de revenues essentiellement tournées vers le petit commerce, des liens forts de solidarité et d’entre aide.

Madame Gnima (assise à droite avec une main levée), est l’emprunteuse vedette de ce groupe. Elle s’active dans le commerce de fruits suivant  les saisons. Elle achète ses pour par sac ou panier auprès des producteurs en majorité des femmes ou des enfants. Pour la revente à ses clients basés dans les régions du centre et de la capitale.

Avec son nouveau crédit, elle compte acheter une vingtaine de sac de liane de pomme à 5 000 F CFA le sac pour la revente à 11 500 F CFA au minimum un sac.

Les bénéfices lui permettront de participer à la prise en charge des besoins de la famille en santé, scolarité pour les enfants.
texts.en:
This group is composed of very dedicated women who found out about development since the 'banc villageois' was created on June 6, 2002. In addition to revenue-generating businesses essentially focused on small-scale commerce, they [have in common] strong ties of solidarity and mutual assistance. 

Ms. Gnima (sitting at the right with her hand raised) is the featured borrower in this group. She is active in the commerce of seasonal fruits. She purchases her goods by the sack or basket from producers, who are mostly women or children. And then she resells her goods to customers based in central regions and in the capital. 

With her new loan, she intends to purchase about twenty sacks of bell-apples [also called water lemons)] at 5,000 francs CFA per sack to be sold for at least 11,5000 francs per sack.

The profits will enable her to help meet family needs in terms of healthcare and schooling and for the children.

loans.use: to purchase seasonal fruits

loans.name: Kurda

texts.en:
Kurda is a 24-year-old Iraqi woman. She is married and has three children. Kurda assists her husband in providing their family's income. She is a tailor and works from home. Kurda started her own business in order to assist her family and earn additional income for her family. She has a very good reputation in her neighborhood with her special talent and the quality service she provides to her clients. She is aiming to develop her business from this loan in order to increase her profit so that she may continue assisting her husband by providing additional income for her children.

The story of Kurda and her business is just one of the many examples of Izdiharona for Economic Development's clients who have been able to improve their business with a small business loan product, specifically designed to meet the needs of small businesses where a relatively small amount of capital can provide significant business improvement.
She asked to blur her face for cultural reasons.

loans.use: to buy new sewing machine, table, iron and fabric for her business..

loans.name: Daysi Antonia

texts.es: Daysi, es una señora humilde que ha venido luchando para salir adelante junto a sus hijos, es madre soltera, ha tenido varios obstáculos como problemas de salud entre otros. Su manera de ganarse la vida es por medio de una pequeña pulpería que tiene ubicada en su casa de habitación, el crédito que solicita lo necesita para invertir en este negocio comprando granos básicos, gaseosas, refrescos, cereales, verduras entre otros, que le permitan mantener la clientela y sufragar los gastos de la familia.
texts.en: Daysi’s a humble woman who has been struggling to get ahead alongside her children.   She’s a single mother and has had many obstacles like health problems among others.  Her way of earning a living is by means of a small grocery store she has installed at home.  She needs the loan she’s requesting to invest in the business with the purchase of basic grains, soft-drinks, snacks, cereals and vegetables, among others that will make it possible for her to keep her clientele and cover family costs.

loans.use: to buy stock merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Sambat's Group

texts.en: Sambat is 51 years old and a mother of five children. Her hometown is Dambae District in Kampong Cham, where her crop husbandry business is. Her cassava, rubber tree, and rice plantation return her about 22,700 KHR per day after her 11 years of experience with this business. This is the first microloan for Sambat with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She formed a group of two to get a new loan. As a leader, she will spend her loan portion to pay plowing fees and labor costs, as well as to buy fertilizer for her farmland. She highly hopes that she can gain a good yield from her crops and make a good profit.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for her farmland

loans.name: Naila

texts.en:
Naila has been running a beauty salon from the past many years. She is 43 years old and is a very talented woman. 

Naila has requested a Kiva loan from Kiva's partner, BRAC Pakistan, to purchase products for the salon. With the help of loan, she would be purchasing a variety of cosmetic products, including scrubs, facial creams, and hair products for the salon. By doing so, she would be able to continue her services and continue generating income. The income generated by her services plays a vital role in meeting the family's expenses.

Naila is feeling happy and satisfied after taking a Kiva loan.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of cosmetic products, including scrubs, facial creams, and hair products for the salon.

loans.name: Bessy Roxana

texts.es:
La señora Bessy tiene 32 años de edad, es viuda y tiene dos hijos que dependen de ella, sus ingresos provienen de la venta de productos de achinería, bolsos, etc. tiene 13 años de dedicarse a su negocio.
Doña Bessy trabaja en un supermercado de la ciudad y es ahí donde ofrece sus productos a sus compañeros de trabajo quienes le encargar su producto, está solicitando el préstamo para la compra de bolsos, cameras, cremas, blúmeres, peines, colas, ganchos, etc.
Doña Bessy espera que esta inversión le ayude a mejorar sus ingresos para poder seguir apoyando a sus hijos en los estudios y le ayude a mejorar un poco su calidad de vida.
Doña Bessy su  sueño es que su negocio sea unos de los más reconocidos y lograr tener un local propio para atender mejor a sus clientes.



Tegucigalpa, Honduras – Agosto del 2013
texts.en:
Bessy, 32, is a widow who has two dependent children.  Her income comes from selling merchandise, purses, etc.  She has had this business for 13 years.  Bessy works in a supermarket in the city and sells her products to coworkers who order from her.

She's requesting the loan to buy bags, creams, undergarments, combs, hair accessories, etc.

Bessy hopes this investment will help her increase her income so she can continue supporting her children in their studies and improve their quality of life.

Bessy's dream is for her business to be one of the best known.  She also wants to have her own store so she can better serve her customers.

Tegucigalpa, Honduras, August 2013

loans.use: to buy merchandise

loans.name: Agatha

texts.en: Mrs. Agatha Jacob is a widow with five grown-up children. She is hardworking everyday to live a decent and model life in her village. At present Agatha is determined to install a biodigester system. She has got cows producing 5 liters of milk everyday. Together with other expenditures, Mrs. Agatha spends the money she gets from her cows’ milk and other farm income sources to buy firewood for cooking and kerosene for lighting. Agatha has applied for a loan of $625 from TAHUDE Foundation to solve this challenge by installing a biodigester. She is able to pay back this loan within 12 months and the biodigester life span goes to 20 years! Our support to Agatha’s loan application will benefit her family and her community at large (to reduce deforestation, reduce corbondioxide emission, avoid health problems associated with smokes, and save expenditures on “wood energy and kerosene”).

loans.use: to purchase/install a 6 cubic meter biodigester.

loans.name: Alex

texts.en: Alex is a 40 years old young Tanzanian whose family is dedicated to farming and livestock keeping. He relatively lives a decent life compared to most of his neighbors. However, these days Alex and his family are passing through tough times as their family expenditure increases. As the dairy and farming represents his primary source of income, he is constantly looking at ways to reduce his operating costs. He has now decided to install a 6 cubic meter biodigester which allow his family to reduce energy and fertilizer costs, as well as give better treatment to their animal waste. Their cow manure will be processed by the digester into renewable methane-rich biogas and biofertilizer, allowing the reduction on dependence on costly and damaging kerosine and agrochemical fertilizers that degrade soils and contaminate groundwater.

loans.use: to purchase/install a 6 cubic meter biodigester.

loans.name: Furaha

texts.en: Furaha is a 26 years old young Tanzanian Entrepreneur. He is not yet married until, he says, “his life goals are fulfilled”. Furaha operates various businesses within his community and is highly supporting TAHUDE Foundation for implementation of renewable energy. Furaha is determined to install five biodigesters within his community. He is doing this for three reasons (i) he wants to be a role model in his community, (ii) part of his overall business advertisement, and (iii) for the sake of commission rate of 10% that TAHUDE gives him for each biodigester he installs. TAHUDE Foundation is convinced that Furaha can handle this project with a minimum supervision. Thus he has applied for a loan of USD 3,125. We hope the success of Furaha’s initiative will reduce the community’s dependence on depleting firewood/trees and consequently halt deforestation. Also each biodigester installed will cut-down expenditures/expenses of the families which took the wise decision of such investment.

loans.use: to distribute five biodigesters.

loans.name: Sebastian

texts.en: Sebastian is a 45 years old Tanzanian Businessman. He owns and strongly promotes renewable energy business. Standing with him in front of his office is the TAHUDE Foundation Director (in blue suit). Sebastian, in partnership with TAHUDE Foundation, has decided to install ten biodigesters in his local community/village back home. The customers are available and TAHUDE will pay Sebastian commission rate of 10% for each biodegester that he installs. A loan of USD 6,250 will enable Sebastian to implement this initiative. This will increase his social status in the community, promote his renewable energy business in rural community, and generate income through the 10% commission from TAHUDE Foundation. Sebastians’ initiative will reduce the community’s dependence on depleting firewood/trees and consequently halt deforestation. Also each biodigester installed will cut-down expenditures/expenses of the families which took the wise decision of such investment.

loans.use: to distribute ten biodigesters

loans.name: John

texts.en: John is a hard-working man who purely depends on agriculture and livestock keeping. He is one of the people who are really facing many life challenges in rural Tanzania, but is determined to change his situation. By observing the benefits that other people are getting by installing the biodigester, John has decided to invest in this technology as well. He requests TAHUDE Foundation to provide the loan of USD 625 for biodigester that will impact his life. He is able to pay back this loan within 12 months through his farm products and the biodigester life span goes to 20 years! Our support to John’s loan application will benefit his family and his community at large (to reduce deforestation, reduce corbondioxide emission, avoid health problems associated with smokes, and save expenditures on “wood energy and kerosene”).

loans.use: to purchase/install a 6 cubic meter biodigester.

loans.name: Elibariki

texts.en: Elibariki, a dairy farmer in Tanzania, is constantly looking to reduce his operational costs on daily bases. His cows produce sufficient milk even suitable for starting a small yogurt and cheese business. But he cannot think of these ideas due to the high cost of energy required. With the installation of 6 cubic meter biodigester, Elibariki will be able to generate clean-burning, renewable biogas from the several kilograms of manure his cows produce weekly, allowing him to significantly decrease his energy costs. Moreover, he will use the fertilizer generated by the system on his animal feed – plants remaining - allowing him to save on agrochemical fertilizer costs. This TAHUDE Foundation biodigester initiative has so much impressed Elibariki such that beside his own biodigester, he has decided to build one more biodigester for his parents. TAHUDE Foundation is grateful and appreciates his enthusiasm. His success will impact not only his family and parents but the community at large.

loans.use: to purchase/install two biodigesters.

loans.name: Eunice

texts.en: Eunice is a hardworking and innovative lady who works at creating harmony between herself and her community/environment at large. She is excited about showing her family and neighbors the importance of protecting nature, and her 6 cubic meter biodigester will allow her to continue her family farm while dramatically reducing its environmental impact. By using the digester to treat the abundant cow manure on her site, she will reduce greenhouse gas emissions and water contamination while concurrently allowing her family to displace kerosene and firewood with inexpensive and renewable biogas.

loans.use: to purchase/install a 6 cubic meter biodigester.

loans.name: Joefrey

texts.en: Joefrey is married with two children and lives in Canubay, Oroquieta City, with his family. His wife is a teacher, while Joefrey owns and manages a candle factory, making candles and selling them in town. He has been doing this for 15 years to make a living. He joined Gata Daku MPC recently and requests a loan of 20,000 PHP to buy raw materials and pay for machine repairs and maintenance costs. He plans to expand his business by selling products to different municipalities to generate more revenue and be able to support his children’s education in the future.

loans.use: to buy raw materials and pay for machine repairs and maintenance costs

loans.name: Reina America

texts.es:
Doña Reina tiene un nivel de educación primaria completo cursado hasta el sexto grado, es madre de 3 hijos quienes viven bajo su mismo techo en compañía de su esposo, la mayor tiene 11 años y cursa el quinto grado de primaria, la segunda esta en cuarto grado tiene 9 años, ambas estudian en la escuela de la localidad y la hija menor que tiene 2 años. El negocio que ellos como familia tienen es el cultivo de café ella aprendió a trabajar la tierra con sus padres desde que tenía 4 años. Ella tiene mucha experiencia en el cultivo de café sin embargo, apoya más a su esposo en el tiempo de corte ya que tiene que atender a sus hijos  por sus actividades escolares, alimentación, higiene, etc. La tierra que cultivan es propia y una parte está en la parte de atrás de su casa y el resto está ubicado aproximadamente a 10 minutos de su casa de habitación, llegada la hora de corta o recolección del grano se involucran todos los miembros de su familia y contratan más personal.

Ella ha solicitado un financiamiento para la compra de 3 QQ de urea, 3 QQ de fórmula 12-24-12, 2 sacos de fertilizantes, 3 litros de fungicida, 3 litros de plaguicidas, 3 litros de foliares entre otros que darán mantenimiento y protección a sus cultivos.  

Doña Reina desea que sus hijas cumplan su sueño de llegar más allá de donde ella y su esposo pudieron, quiere que se gradúen en la universidad, también sueña con dejarles las tierras para que ellas tengan un mejor nivel de vida.
texts.en:
Reina completed elementary school; she finished sixth grade.  She’s mother of three children living under her roof in company of her husband.  The oldest is 11-years-old and in fifth grade in elementary school, the second one is in fourth grade and is nine-years-old.  Both attend the local school and her youngest daughter is two-years-old.

The family business they have is growing coffee.  She learned to work the land with her parents when she was four-years-old.  She has much experience growing coffee but nevertheless she supports her husband during the cutting time because she has to tend to her children because of their schooling activities, feeding, hygiene, etc.  The land they cultivate is their own and part of it is behind their house and the rest is located about ten minutes away from home.  When the time comes for cutting and picking beans all the members of the family participate and they also hire more staff.

She’s requesting the loan to buy 3 quintals of urea, 3 quintals of formula 12-24-12, 2 sacks of fertilizer, 3 liters of fungicide, 3 liters of pesticide, 3 liters of leaf fertilizer among others that will provide protection and maintenance for her crop.

Reina wants her daughters to reach her dream of getting farther than she and her husband were able to; she wants them to graduate from university and she also dreams with leaving them land so that they can have a better standard of living.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies for her coffee crop.

loans.name: Gilberth Rafael

texts.es: Gilberth, está soltero, tiene la edad de 23 años y vive con sus padres que son su mayor prioridad. El con el crédito va comprar cerdos para engordarlos y también el alimento para su mantención. El cuenta con un chiquero listo para la explotación de este proyecto y está en óptimas condiciones. El espera poder obtener de su proyecto el máximo de ganancias para su bienestar y salir adelante con los pagos de su crédito. El piensa a futuro y espera generar ganancias para ahorrar Yy asi asegurarse su futuro de una mejor forma.Es el segundo préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. El no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en:
Gilberth, 23, is single and lives with his parents, who are his priority. He will use the loan to buy piglets and feed to fatten them. He has a pigpen for the project, and it is in good condition. He expects to maximize income from the project to provide for himself and to make his loan payments. He hopes to generate profits so that he can save and ensure a brighter future.

This is his second loan cycle with FUDECOSUR. He has never had state bank loans, but FUDECOSUR offered him a loan with better terms and much lower interest rates.

loans.use: to buy piglets to fatten.

loans.name: Anate

texts.en: Anate, her daughter, and her grandson are living in rural Tanzania. Though they are not financially privileged as some of their neighbors, they are committed to hardworking for survival and for making a better future. Anate has just learnt from TAHUDE Foundation biodigester initiative that if she adopt this technology she will be able to save of a lot of her daily family expenses on firewood and kerosene. She will also save time for other productive activities. He daily income is from come milk and from this she will be able to pay back her biodigester loan within 12 months. She expects to harvest many other benefits for this wise investment.

loans.use: to purchase/install a 6 cubic meter biodigester.

loans.name: Steve

texts.en: Steve is excited by the business opportunity that TAHUDE Foundation offers through 10% commission for each biodigester that any local community entrepreneur promotes and installs. Therefore, Steve has decided to take a Loan of USD 3,125 to install five biodigesters in his community. This will have a significant contribution towards environmental conservation in his community. Steve’s success in this project will be the pride of TAHUDE Foundation as well. Every household that will invest in Steve and TAHUDE’s initiative will be able to save daily expenses for energy needs. Biodigester also produces a very nice fertilizer for sustainable agriculture.

loans.use: to distribute five biodigesters

loans.name: Urio

texts.en: Urio is 27 years old young Tanzanian who has actively involved himself in farming and livestock keeping. He is so proud of himself on his agricultural produce and dairy product. Urio is always happy and has no thoughts of migrating to urban areas as many young people do in Tanzania. Nevertheless, with serious environmental degradation and climate change, Urio is realizing how his life is getting tight with time. With TAHUDE Foundation’s advice, Urio has realized one opportunity of reducing his daily expenses by converting his waste livestock dung into money. Thus, he has applied for a loan of USD 625 to build a biodigester that will help him cut exorbitant expenditure in energy and also he will get “free fertilizer” which is the end product released from the biodigester. This is an investment with multiple benefits.

loans.use: to install a 6 meter cube biodigester

loans.name: Ayubu

texts.en: Ayubu is a small farmer and livestock keeper living in a town outskirts where the urbanization is encroaching slowly. The urbanization of his community has forced him to reassess the feasibility of his small farm. By using this Kiva loan through TAHUDE Foundation to invest in a 6 cubic meter biodigester, he will be able to continue raising animals without inconveniencing his neighbors. The biodigester will allow him to process and treat his animal waste, virtually eliminating the odor and flies normally associated with piles of manure. By being able to continue farming in the face of urban encroachment, he will preserve his community’s traditional practices while doing so in an environmentally sustainable and neighbor-friendly manner.

loans.use: to purchase/install a biodigester

loans.name: Zakaria

texts.en: Zakaria is a young Tanzanian hard-working and well committed gentleman. From his childhood he was a man of determination. Meanwhile, with the TAHUDE Foundation initiative to promote installation of biodigesters, Zakaria has decided to install one. This will cut of their family expenditure and his parent and neighboring community will certainly appreciate his entrepreneurship. We hope the success of Zakaria’s initiative will reduce the community’s dependence on depleting firewood/trees and consequently halt deforestation

loans.use: to purchase/install biodigester

loans.name: Penia

texts.en: Penia and her husband with their ground child are fighting to say goodbye to their extreme poverty. They have been improving their livelihood with time. Their main activity is farming and livestock keeping. With the support of TAHUDE Foundation, Penia has one more opportunity to improve her family life by installing a biodigester. They are able to repay slowly within a year and for any unlikely failure to fulfill their responsibility TAHUDE Foundation will top-up their effort through our generous supporters/donors. This family is in need. The loan of USD 625 will help them reduce life expenses by installing the biodigester. So they will have extra productive hours and money that would have been spent in collecting firewood and buying kerosene. This will be a giant step for this family.

loans.use: to purchase/install a biodigester

loans.name: Jay

texts.en: Mr. Jay is one of the full committed Tanzanians who are determined to change their life. He owns a small business in his community where he sells various products mainly through his shop. Moreover, Jay runs a poultry business; even he has turkeys. He got cows and a farm. After hearing TAHUDE’s biodigester initiative, Jay has decided to purchase one through a one year long loan. A loan of USD 625 is sufficient for Jay to realize his dream. The biodigester will help Jay and his family to cut-down expenses on cooking energy/firewood and kerosene for lighting.

loans.use: to purchase a biodigester

loans.name: Gabriela

texts.es:
Gabriela, de 38 años, es madre de 03 hijos los cuales viven con ella en su casa propia junto a su esposo.El trabajo de Gabriela consiste en la producción de cacao,  plátanos, Yucas y otros productos agrícolas,  sufrió algunos contratiempos en su vida debido a que no tenia el capital suficiente para sembrar algún producto en su terreno, pero gracias a sus ahorros ha logrado salir adelante. Sus amigos, vecinos y familiares compran sus productos de su terreno dependiendo de la temporada en la que se encuentre.Le gusta lo que hace, pues le permite tener tiempo para poder estar al cuidado de su vivienda, además que desde que empezó con su negocio le está yendo bien en su economía, ya que tienen ingresos para su hogar, desea seguir creciendo, por eso tiene en mente ampliar sus ventas. Este es su primer crédito con Kiva, por ello espera de su colaboración para continuar con sus objetivos, por otro lado se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual.
Con el monto solicitado 500 soles, invertirá en abono organico para sus cultivos.
texts.en:
Gabriela, 38, is the mother of three children, who live with her and her husband in their own house. Gabriela grows cacao, plantains, yuca, and other crops. She has seen setbacks in her life, given that she has not always had enough money to plant her land, but she has managed to keep going thanks to her savings. 

Her friends, neighbors, and relatives buy her crops, depending on the season. She likes her work because she has time to take care of the house. Since she started this business, her financial situation has improved because she earns money for the household. 

She wants to keep growing her business and increasing sales. This is her first loan cycle with Kiva, and she hopes the partnership will help her work toward her goals. She promises to make her payments on time. She will use the loan of 500 soles to buy organic fertilizer to nourish her plantings.

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizer.

loans.name: Gilberto

texts.es: Gracias al crédito de kiva  Gilberto pudo reforestar parte de su finca ya que las plantas que tenia eran muy viejas y ya no tenían buena producción, para este nuevo ciclo de créditos Gilberto solicita para la compra de fertilizantes los cuales le ayudaran a que sus plantas nuevas crezcan y las grandes aumenten su producción y realizando estas tareas Gilberto aumentara su producción lo cual le dejara mejores ganancias económicas que le ayudaran a realizar su sueño que es ampliar su casa para poder vivir mas cómodamente con su familia.
texts.en: Thanks to the Kiva loan, Gilberto was able to replant part of his farm since the plants he had were very old and not producing well. Gilberto is requesting this new cycle of loans to purchase fertilizers, which will help his new plants grow and increase the production of his older ones. Accomplishing these tasks, Gilberto will increase his production, which will leave him with better economic profits. This will help him to achieve his dream, which is to expand his house to be able to live more comfortably with his family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers that will help him to increase his harvest and grow his plants.

loans.name: Kubrokhon

texts.ru: Женщина с прекрасной душой и прекрасными мыслями планирует организовать свой бизнес. С такой целью Куброхон обучилась на курсе «Добейся Успеха» организованной Ассоциация Деловых Женщин. Она участвовала на этом курсе и получила много позитива для себя. После завершения курса она получила сертификат. Она планирует организовать свой бизнес изготовлением и продажей лепешки и печенья. Ее муж работает в кондитерском цехе. Он будет помогать Куброхон по введению бизнеса. Теперь она готова начать бизнес, однако она не имеет денег, чтобы купить муку, сахар и т.п. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 2600 долларов США для покупки необходимых ингредиентов для организации бизнеса. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en:
This woman, with a beautiful soul and wonderful ideas, plans to set up her own business. With this aim, Kubrokhon attended the training "To get ahead", organized by the Association of Business Women. She took part in this training and received positive feedback. After completing the training she received a certificate. 

Kubrokhon plans to set up her own business, producing and selling cakes and cookies. Her husband works at a confectionery shop. He will help her with managing the business. 

Currently Kubrokhon would like to start her business, but she does not have money for purchasing flour, sugar etc. She requests a loan in the amount of 2,600 US dollar for the purchase of necessary ingredients for setting up the business. She awaits your kindness.

loans.use: To purchase flour, sugar and other ingredients for setting up a business

loans.name: Jessica

texts.en:
Jessica is a 32-year-old, married woman from Talibon, Bohol. She has three children, ages 12 years old, 13 years old, and 11 months old. 

Jessica engages in an animal-raising business. She raises and sells hogs and cows. She has been raising hogs and cows for almost five years. 

Aside from animal-raising, she does food-vending. She sells rice cakes to augment her income.

Jessica requested a loan of PHP 10,000 to buy an additional cow and feed and more ingredients for her food-vending business, like flour, sugar, and rice.

In the future, Jessica hopes to improve her living conditions and to provide her children with a quality education.

loans.use: to buy an additional cow and feed and more ingredients for her food-vending business, like flour, sugar, and rice.

loans.name: Top's Group

texts.en: Top, 34, and a resident from Kampong Cham province, is a mother of one young child. For the sake of her family, she earns money by rice cropping while her husband works at a construction site. She has been involved in her current business for more than 10 years and it returns her about 25,000 KHR per day. This is her first loan with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) and she has formed a group of three female members to get the loan. As the leader, she will spend her loan portion to buy potash for her farmland. She hopes to gain a good yield from her business so she can make more income.

loans.use: To buy potash for her farmland

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Cheung Prey district

loans.name: Siheang's Group

texts.en: Siheang is a citizen from Kampong Cham province who makes a living growing crops to support her household, especially her two dependent children. Her cassava, rice, and cashew plantation returns her about 40,000 KHR per day. Siheang and her joint members have never been with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) before and they are seeking loan amounts of 1,000,000 KHR each. As the leader, Siheang will spend her loan portion to buy fertilizer for her cassava. She hopes to grow her cassava in a timely manner to get a good income to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for her cassava

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ponhea Krek district

loans.name: Sandra Marisela

texts.es:
Sandra en una joven de 27 años la cual es madre de 3 hijos los cuales dependen de ella y su compañero de hogar, el mayor tiene 9 años y está cursando el segundo grado en la primaria, el segundo hijo tiene 7 años y cursa el primer año de la primaria y la última tiene 2 años. Ella tiene un grado de educación secundaria cursado hasta el 3 de ciclo común y con mucha experiencia se dedica específicamente al cultivo de café, ella sabe realizar todas las actividades relacionadas con el negocio ya que sus padres se han dedicado a esta actividad por muchos años. Sin embargo solo apoya a su esposo hasta la recolección y el traslado del grano ya que tiene que cuidar a sus pequeños, además se dedica a la siembra de maíz y frijoles aunque la producción es para consumo de su hogar. Sus cultivos están ubicados aproximadamente a 10 minutos de su casa de habitación, llegada la hora de corta o recolección se involucran solo ellos dos ya que sus hijos están muy pequeños para apoyarles. Las personas que le compran su producto son intermediarios que se dedican a la compra-venta de café.

Ella solicita un financiamiento para la compra de 2 QQ de urea, 2 QQ de fórmula 12-24-12, 2 QQ de fórmula 18-26-0 y 1000 plantitas de café (chapola) la cuales planea sembrar para extender sus cultivos.

Sandra tiene como meta lograr establecer un negocio de abarrotería para así logra que sus vecinos no tengan que trasladarse hasta otra comunidad para hacer sus compras y así generar más ingresos y mejorar su nivel de vida. Esto vendrá a mejorar sus ingresos y podrá darles un mejor nivel de vida a sus hijos y una mejor educación.
texts.en:
Sandra, 27, is the mother of three children, who depend on her and her life partner. The oldest child is nine and in second grade; her second child is seven and in first grade; and the youngest is two. Sandra finished the third year of middle school. 

She has a lot of experience growing coffee and can do all the chores related to the business, as her parents grew coffee for many years. Her husband helps her harvest and transport the coffee beans, while she takes care of the children. She also grows corn and beans for her household's consumption. Her cropland is about 10 minutes from her house. Just she and her husband do the cutting and collecting, since the children are too young to help them. They sell the harvest to coffee dealers. 

Sandra has applied for a loan to buy two gallons of urea, two gallons of 12-24-12 formula, two gallons of 18-26-0 formula 18-26-0, and 1000 additional coffee seedlings. Her goal is to open a grocery store so that her neighbors don't have to travel to other towns to do their shopping. This would also increase her earnings and help her offer her children a higher standard of living and a better education.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies for her coffee crops.

loans.name: Mohirakhon

texts.ru: Мохирахон 40 лет. Она добросовестная и целеустремленная женщина. Мохирахон разведенная женщина и на воспитании имеет 4 детей. Детям 20, 18, 15 и 12 лет. Она более 2 года работает в батальоне делопроизводителем. Скоро ее дочь Шахло выходит замуж и они должны сыграть свадьбу. Шахло работает кондитером в кондитерском цехе. Мохирахон тратит все свои деньги для обеспечения своих детей и их образования и поэтому она не имеет сбережения для проведения свадебного торжества своей дочери. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 5000 сомони. Она ждет вашу доброту и надеется на ваше милосердие.
texts.en:
Mohirakhon is 40 years old. She is a conscientious and purposeful woman. Mohirakhon is a divorced woman, and she is raising four children. The children are 20, 18, 15 and 12 years old. For more than two years Mohirakhon has worked as a clerk for the Armed Forces. 

Soon Mohirakhon's daughter Shahlo is getting married and they should celebrate the wedding. Shahlo works as pastry chef at a confectionery shop. Mohirakhon spends all her money on supporting her children and their education and therefore she does not have savings for holding a wedding party for her daughter. She requests a loan in the amount of 5,000 somoni. She awaits your kindness and hopes for your charity.

loans.use: To hold a wedding party for her daughter

loans.name: Pacita

texts.en:
This is Pacita. Her previous loan was a big help in her business. She was able to buy more golf balls needed in her business. Her income from business helps meet her family's everyday expenses. She has been in this business for 15 years now. She and her husband are working hard to provide for their everyday needs. She also has a variety store for additional income.

She would like to apply for another 50,000 PHP loan to buy more quality golf balls to sell. More items to sell will result in better profits. Her profits from business will definitely help her to sustain her family's daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart. 

Pacita dreams that her business will continue to exist and hopes to have a good life with the guidance of God. She meets with her co-fellowship members.  All CCT community partners are organized into fellowship groups of 15 to 30 members that meet on a weekly basis. They gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for more quality golf balls to sell.

loans.name: Ricky
