texts.en: Ricky is a fisherman from the town of CPG, Bohol. He is a married man and has been in the fishing business for more than three years now. This is the source of his income. Ricky is asking for a loan to buy new fishing nets, lead weights, hooks, and other items. With this loan, he will be able to enhance his catch thus giving him more fish to sell in the market. In the future, Ricky hopes of expanding his fishing venture and making it a stable source of his income.

loans.use: to buy new fishing nets, lead weights, hooks, and other items

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a new computer and printer to create advertisements and spread the word about R. H. Public Relations, LLC.

loans.name: Vula

texts.en:
Vula is an impressive young woman from Nazareth. She opened a business for private tutoring, after-school group classes and an activity center. Vula has a degree in science education and is currently completing her masters degree in special education. She opened her center to help students succeed in their studies. She offers low prices so low-income families and students with learning difficulties can gain from the tutoring and lessons and succeed in school.

Vula needs this loan to purchase air conditioners,  paint for the classrooms, computers for the lab, tables and chairs.

Vula wants to further expand her center and one day open additional  branches throughout the country.

loans.use: To purchase air conditioners,  paint for the classrooms, computers for the lab, tables and chairs.

loans.name: Chanthy's Group

texts.en:
Chanthy is 26 years old and a married mother of a small child.  The main sources of family income are from cassava farming and from her husband's occupation, working as a paid worker at a rubber plantation. Cassava farming is the business that Chanthy has had for five years. 

Chanthy has been with VisionFund Cambodia (Kiva’s partner) for one past cycle already. She has repaid her previous loan wisely to improve her lifestyle better than before. Now, she leads a group of six members to get a new loan.  

Chanthy is seeking KHR 1,200,000, while her co-borrowers are seeking KHR 1,400,0000 each. She will spend her second loan, as group leader, to pay for weeding fees for her cassava farm. She hopes to gain a good yield from her crops and to make more money.

loans.use: to pay for weeding fees for her cassava farm.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Tbaung Khmum district

loans.name: Pascual

texts.es:
Pascual nació en la ciudad de Paucartambo y vive junto con su familia en la ciudad mencionada, él tiene 32 años de edad y tiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene dos hijos, él es un padre trabajador y emprendedor que saca adelante a su familia con el esfuerzo de su trabajo entonces sus actividades económicas es la agricultura y ganadería y en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar un torito para hacerlo engordar para luego venderlo en alguna feria, él agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio pues valora el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas mensuales con mucha responsabilidad.
 
Él pertenece al banco Comunal “San Marticito” de la Asociación Arariwa de la ciudad de Paucartambo.
texts.en: Pascual was born in the city of Paucartambo, where he lives with his family. Pascual is 32 years old and is in a civil marriage from which he has two children. He is a hardworking and enterprising father who works hard to help his family get ahead. Pascual makes a living farming and raising livestock. In this moment, he needs a loan to buy a bull to fatten and later sell at the fair. He is very grateful to everyone who forms a part of his dream. Pascual values this loan and pledges to be responsible and make all of his monthly payments on time. He belongs to the communal bank group "San Marticito" of the Arariwa Association from the city of Paucartambo.

loans.use: to buy a bull.

loans.name: Otgon

texts.en:
Mrs. Otgon, 58 years old, lives with her husband and children in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. The family resides in their own house on a plot of land. She has been teaching history to students in high school, and this year was promoted to manager of education. Her husband works as a bus driver for a living. 

She is requesting a loan of 7,000,000 MNT to purchase a low pressure heater and insulation materials such as fiberglass and foam. As a result, she and  her husband can insulate their house and install a low pressure heater into the house. By doing so, the family will use less coal for heating, thus contributing to the efforts against air pollution by releasing fewer pollutants into the air. Otgon is a very hardworking individual who strives for a better future.

loans.use: to purchase insulation materials and a low  pressure heater.

loans.name: Elnur

texts.en: Elnur is 28 years old and single. He is an IDP (internally displaced person) from Fizuli city. Now he lives in the Fizuli region with his family. Elnur started his business two years ago raising calves. Now he needs a loan of 1,700 AZN to repair his farm. In the future, Elnur wants to have more sheep and  calves for his farm. This will be more profitable for his business. Elnur is thankful to Komak and Kiva for supporting him.

loans.use: to repair his farm

loans.name: Paulina

texts.es:
Paulina continua con el negocio de venta de frutas y le va muy bien,  Pualina agradece infinitamente a todos los inversionistas que le apoyaron con el préstamo anterior pues le ayudo con el capital del negocio entonces en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar mas frutas como por ejemplo manzanas.

Paulina vive en la ciudad de Challabamba. (El distrito de Challabamba está ubicado en la provincia de Paucartambo del departamento del Cusco, Perú). Ella tiene 40 años de edad y tiene una relación de unión libre.
texts.en:
Paulina still has her business selling fruit, and it is going very well. Paulina is incredibly grateful to all of the investors who supported her with the previous loan, as she was able to obtain business capital. She currently needs a loan to buy more fruit, such as apples.

Paulina lives in the city of Challabamba. (The district of Challabamba is located in the province of Paucartambo in the departament of Cusco, Perú). She is 40 years old and has a common-law marriage.

loans.use: to buy fruit, such as apples.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy chicken, meat and vegetables for her business.

loans.name: San Hilario Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “SAN HILARIO”; Este banco se ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia Zinaida tiene 32 años de edad, 03 hijos y es casada, la socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de ropa al por mayor, la socia lleva buen tiempo con su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia distribuye su mercadería a sus clientes que le solicitan, la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa siendo de esta forma que la socias saca adelante a su familia.

La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de casacas para su negocio.

Los otros socios  se dedican al negocio de venta de productos lácteos, venta de ropa, farmacia, trabajadores independientes, docentes, brindando el servicio de taxi.

La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The members belong to the “San Hilario” communal bank; this bank is located in the district of Cusco, belonging to the province of Cusco and department of Cusco.

The member Zinaida is 32 years old, has three children and is married. She alternates her daily activities with the business of selling clothing wholesale. She has had her business for quite a while, and it is going well thanks to the dedication she gives to her business each day. She distributes her merchandise to her customers who request her. She is a responsible and earnest person, as this is how the members get their families ahead.

Zinaida is asking for the loan to buy jackets for her business. The other members make a living from the sale of dairy products, the sale of clothing, a pharmacy, as independent workers, teaching, and providing taxi services.

Zinaida is grateful to the people who are part of her dream through this loan, and she pledges to make her payments in a punctual manner.

loans.use: to buy jackets for her business

loans.name: Zhana

texts.en:
Zhana is 24 years old and lives with her father, her retired grandmother, and her brother in Kutaisi. Several times she has requested loans from local financial institutions for her hair care business start-up but without any success. Her loan requests were rejected each time because of her low income and lack of experience in this new business. The only source of income for her family is the small monthly salary earned by Zhana’s father working as a mini-bus driver. Her brother studies at high school and needs a lot of money for student expenses. 

Zhana has high education but she is unable to find a job with her profession and generate an income, so she requested a loan from Credo to start a beauty salon. Her loan request was approved in the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisions the provision of business start-up and re-start-up credits with reasonable conditions for the country's vulnerable poor who do not have access to standard credit products since they are regarded as “high-risk borrowers” because of their low income.

Zhana will purchase equipment for her beauty salon and start up a hair care business. She will hire experienced stylists, and according her estimations, the business will be profitable and will increase the income of her family. The increased profit will be reinvested in the same business. Her family will be able to increase their spending to satisfy their daily needs and improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to start up a beauty salon

loans.name: Paata

texts.en:
Paata is 37 years old. He is a refugee  and lives in the village of Mokhisi with his wife and three children (3, 10 and 15 years old). Paata works at the local mill and gets a small monthly income. In addition, he runs a small-scale agricultural business and grows various vegetables. 

He works hard all day long but his earnings are not enough to cover the cost of food and everyday expenses. For this reason, Paata decided to start a dairy farm. Paata's loan request was approved as part of a new joint initiative between Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program provides loans with reasonable terms to start-up businesses. These loans are provided to the country's vulnerable poor, who do not have access to credit products because they are regarded as “high risk borrowers” due to their low incomes. 

The loan will be used to purchase a milk cow. Paata will place the cow in the cattle shed located in his yard and he will sell the dairy products at the local market. Thanks to this loan, he will improve his quality of life and increase his income. His goal is to provide his family with better living conditions and his children with an education. Paata awaits your generosity.

loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow.

loans.name: Ioseb

texts.en:
Ioseb is 65 years old and married. He lives with his wife and grown daughter in the town of Makhinjauri. Ioseb gets a retirement pension from the government, but as his pension is the only source for the family, he works as a taxi driver with his own car to earn additional income. The car is very old and often needs repairing, so Ioseb is unable to work regularly and generate profit. He is a very enthusiastic and is a hardworking person with a great desire to ensure his family members with a normal standard of living.

Ioseb is requesting a 2,200 USD loan to change his car and purchase new one. All of the financial institutions rejected his loan request because of his unstable financial condition. After several unsuccessful attempts, Ioseb applied for a loan from MFO Credo. His request was approved within the framework of their Start Up program, which is a joint initiative with Kiva that focuses on helping the vulnerable poor to start or re-start businesses. Ioseb will continue working as a taxi driver and transport people in return for a service fee. He is thankful to Kiva lenders for giving him a chance to generate income.

loans.use: to change his car and purchase new one

loans.name: Chultem

texts.en:
Mr. Chultem is 29-years-old. He lives with his wife and child in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. He has been working as a supply manager for one year. 

Before this job, Mr. Chultem was running a pharmacy. His wife is currently unemployed and stays at home looking after her daughter. 

Mr. Chultem is requesting a loan of 4,200,000 MNT to purchase planks, paints and bricks in order to renew the old fences and house. As a result, his family can live in comfortable place.

loans.use: to purchase planks, bricks and paints.

loans.name: Sayragul

texts.ru: Cайрагуль 45 лет лет, вдова, воспитывает 3 детей (2 дочери, 1 сын). Сайрагуль имеет средне-техническое образование. Соседи отзываются о ней как о доброжелательной и ответственной женщине. После смерти мужа Сайрагуль взяла себя в руки, стойко перенесла потерю мужа и взяа на себя всю ношу по уходу и обеспечению детей и благосостоянию семьи в целом. Две дочери живут и работают в России, помогают семье материально, ежемесячно высылая свою зарплату. Сын проживает с матерью. Сайрагуль в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи, с 1996 года занимается животноводством, начав этот бизнес с 1,200 сом (KGS). Опыт в разведении и содержании скота очень большой. Благодаря упорному труду Сайрагуль в хозяйстве у нее имеется: 2 дойные коровы, 1 лошадь, 1 жеребенок и 1 телка. Ее хозяйство приносит около 6,000 сом (KGS) в месяц, что служит основой для покрытия расходов на питание и бытовые нужды семьи. В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Сайрагуль обратилась в Микрофинансовый банк «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 40,000 сом (KGS) на покупку бычков. Доходы от кредита Сайрагуль планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение своего хозяйства, а также, в будущем намерена сделать ремонт дома, в котором проживает вместе со своей семьей.
texts.en:
Sayragul is 45 years old, a widow, and has raised three children (two daughters and one son). Sayragul has secondary technical education. The neighbors speak of her as a friendly and responsible woman. After the death of her husband, Sayragul pulled herself together, bravely endured the loss of her husband and took the whole burden of caring for and supporting her children, and the welfare of the family as a whole. The two daughters live and work in Russia, and they help family financially, sending their salary every month. The son lives together with his mother. 

As main income for the family, Sayragul has worked with livestock breeding since 1996, after having started this business with 1,200 som (KGS). She has long experience in breeding and keeping livestock. Thanks to persistent work, Sayragul has two dairy cows, one horse, one foal and one heifer on her farm. Her business brings in around 6,000 som (KGS) per month, which serves as the basis for covering food and household expenses for the family. 

With an aim to further develop her business, Sayragul turned to the microfinance bank "Bai Tushum & Partners" for a loan in the amount of 40,000 som (KGS) for the purchase of bull-calves. Sayragul plans to invest the income from the loan in further developing her business, and in the future she also intends to repair her house where she lives with her family.

loans.use: to buy bull-calves

loans.name: Saul

texts.en:
Saul dreams of becoming a professional but without a degree he knows it may never be possible. Saul was accepted into Simon Bolivar and now with the chance to achieve his dream is concerned about affording his school supplies. He expects to graduate in December, 2014 but without a loan he is unsure how he will be able to continue affording his education. 

Saul shares that it is important to him to graduate on time so he can enter into the job market as soon as possible. With this loan, Saul plans on purchasing his much needed textbooks and school supplies. With the proper books, Saul feels he will be able to study more effectively and earn better grades. 

Saul's parents were never able to complete their primary education. For his family of 3, finances have always been tight. Saul is unsure how he will be able to finance his education on his own without the assistance of a Vittana Loan. Saul is married with his own child but this has not stopped him from pursing his dreams. With a professional degree and a career in business, he will be able to provide his family with a better life. 

Saul hopes to be able to contribute towards his family's income in the near future. Saul currently works 30 hours a week as a teacher to help afford his school and living expenses.

This loan is administered by Vittana's partner BancoFie.

loans.use: to pay for textbooks

loans.name: Kemhean's Group

texts.en:
Kemhean is 53 years old and married. She is blessed with three children who are working at a rubber plantation. Though she struggles for a living, she does rice growing on a one hectare area; this is the business that she has been with for 23 years, earning about 25,000 KHR per day. 

This is not the first microloan for Kemhean with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She has fully repaid her past two loans wisely to improve her living conditions. 

She forms a group of three to get a new loan from VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). As the leader, she will spend her loan portion to pay labor costs and plowing fees. She hopes that she can get her crops in on time,  and achieve a better yield than last year.

loans.use: To pay labor costs and plowing fees

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Tbaung Khmum district

loans.name: Gulsifat

texts.ru: Гулсифату 39 лет. Она замужем и на воспитании имеет 4 детей. Она вместе семьей живет бедно, так как ее муж строитель и не имеет постоянное место работы. Он имеет сезонную работу. Гулсифат занималась шитьём женской одежды, но так как клиентов у нее было мало, она начала новый бизнес изготовлением и продажей пирожков. Она имеет точку продажи и этим она зарабатывает деньги и обеспечивает свою семью. Ее старшая дочь Хилола учится в университете, и она должна оплатить за учебный договор. Так как Хилола не имеет денег, Гулсифат решила помочь дочери. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 2000 сомони для оплаты учебного договора дочери. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en:
Gulsifat is 39 years old. She is married and raising four children. She lives in poverty with her family, as her husband is a builder and does not have a permanent place to work. He has seasonal work. 

Gulsifat used to work with sewing women's clothing, but as she had few customers, she started a new business of making and selling pies. She has a selling point and through that she earns money and supports her family. Her eldest daughter Khilola studies at the university, and she needs to pay for tuition. As Khilola does not have money, Gulsifat decided to help her daughter. 

Gulsifat requests a loan in the amount of 2,000 somoni to pay for her daughter's education. She awaits your kindness.

loans.use: To pay for her daughter’s education

loans.name: Maribel

texts.en:
Maribel is a 30-year-old married woman from Talibon, Bohol. She has two children, ages 11 and 3.

She runs a sari-sari (variety) store. Maribel sells various items like powdered milk, sugar, soaps, biscuits, noodles, seasonings, and beverages. She has been running a variety store for almost four years. 

She requested a loan of 9,000 PHP to buy more stock like canned goods, soft drinks , seasonings, and fertilizers so she can maintain the inventory of the store, and also attract more customers.

In the future, Maribel would like to expand her sari-sari store business to provide her children with good food and a quality education.

loans.use: to buy more stock like canned goods, soft drinks, seasonings, and fertilizer

loans.name: Momo

texts.fr: Afin d'acheter des machines et des tissus pour son activité, Momo demande un premier crédit à WAGES pour atteindre ses objectifs. Il est couturier de profession et à la fin de son apprentissage a ouvert un atelier dans lequel il répond aux besoins de ses clients. Son souhait est de rendre sa famille heureuse tout en gardant pérenne son activité. Marié, il a 03 enfants dont 02 sur les bancs d'école. Il est âgé de 34ans.
texts.en: In order to buy (sewing) machines and fabric for his business, Momo has asked for a first loan from WAGES so that he can reach his goals. He is a tailor who, after his apprenticeship, opened a workshop where he can respond to his customers' needs. His wish is to make his family happy while keeping his business sustainable. He is married and has three children, two of whom are in school. He is 34 years old.

loans.use: buy (sewing) machines and fabric.

loans.name: Bibi

texts.en:
Bibi is married with seven children; only one is in school, the rest are adults. She owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food.

Bibi has operated a retail shop business for the past five years, selling household consumables like wheat flour and maize flour from home to her neighbours. She faces a challenge of delayed payments by creditors in her business.  She dreams of expanding to a wholesale shop in the future.

With the Kshs 40,000, she wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, and cooking oil to sell. 

She joined Yehu for financial support.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, and cooking oil to sell.

loans.name: Moeurn

texts.en:
Moeurn is 52 years old and a villager from the Sa Ang district of Kandal province. She has seven children, six of whom still rely on her as they are in school. Her family relies solely on her single agribusiness, rice farming on one hectare area. She has involved in this business since she was 22 years old, and now she is able to earn up to 15,000 KHR per day. 

This is the second microloan  for Moeurn with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She used her past loan wisely to improve her business and her living in a gradual manner. 

Now, she is seeking a new loan of 1,000,000 KHR to buy potash, rice seed, and to pay a plowing fee. 

She hopes to plant her crop seasonably, and make a good yield with a high profit.

loans.use: To buy potash, rice seed, and to pay a plowing fee

loans.name: Nancy

texts.es:
La socia se sigue dedicando al negocio de elaboracion de productos lacteos como quesos, yogurt y manjares ,la socia vende en las diferentes ferias el queso,yogurt y manjares,la socia por medio de este negocio quiere salir adelante,el sueño de la socia es tener un local donde pueda vender los quesos,yogures y manjares.La socia solicita el credito para comprar leche,huevos y azucar para elaborar los quesos,yogures y manjares.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Nancy continues to earn her living making dairy products like cheese, yogurt, and sweets, which she sells at different markets.  She wants to use the business to get ahead.  Her dream is to have a locale where she can sell her products.  She plans to use her loan to buy milk, eggs, and sugar to make cheese, yogurt and sweets 

She is happy for the loan and promises to make all her payments.

loans.use: to buy milk, eggs, and sugar to make cheese, yogurt and sweets

loans.name: Zuma Group

texts.en:
Happy, who is in her early 30s, is married with two children, one of whom goes to school and the other is a baby.  She has been a food vendor for five years;  she works from 6.00 am to 6.00 pm daily and is able to make a fair monthly profit.

This will be Happy's fifth loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  She used the previous loans to stock the missing items in the food store. So she managed to cook more food and sell it to more people.  

She is doing very well.  She has paid back all her loans successfully.  She used the profit to buy a bed, a mattress, a TV set, a deck, and household expenses.  She wants to use this loan to buy more rice, cooking oil, beans, wheat flour, baking flour, and charcoal.  She dreams of buying her plot of land and building her own house.

Happy will share this loan with her loan group, 'ZUMA', which consists of ten members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy more rice, cooking oil, beans, wheat flour, baking flour, and charcoal.

loans.name: Ret's Group

texts.en:
Ret is 47 years old and a married mother of three children, residing in the Srey Snom district of Siem Reap province. 

She struggles for a living via rice and cassava farming. This business has returned her about KHR 25,000 to support her entire family.  

This is Ret's fourth loan with VisionFund Cambodia (Kiva’s partner). She has fully repaid her past loan wisely to improve her lifestyle, better than before. 

With her new loan, she leads a group of three. As the leader, she will spend her loan portion to buy rice seed, potash, and insecticide for her farmland. She hopes that she can make a good yield, with high profit for her family.

loans.use: to buy rice seed, potash, and insecticide for her farmland.

location.town: Siem Reap Province, Srey Snom district

loans.name: Babie Shiella

texts.en:
Babie Shiella is 29 years old, with four children, living in Upper Langcangan with her family. Her husband is a fisherman while she runs a “sari sari” store to make a living. 

In three years of this business, Babie Shiella earns PHP 4,000 monthly. She became a new member of Gata Daku Multi-Purpose Cooperative (GDMPC) and borrowed a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy biscuits, soft drinks, milk, and sardines, in addition to her working inventory capital. 

She hopes she will be able to expand and improve her business for the future of the entire family.

loans.use: to buy biscuits, soft drinks, milk and sardines.

location.town: Upper Langcangan, Oroquieta City, Misamis Occident

loans.name: Ismatboy

texts.ru: Исматбой шофер с 20-летним стажем работы, проживает в городе Исфара. Ему 46 лет. Он женат и имеет сына в возрасте 19 лет. Его жена домохозяйка. Исматбой сам обеспечивает семью. Он с 1993 года работает в жилом коммунальном хозяйстве города Исфары водителем санитарной машины. У него есть один помощник. Исматбой серьезный и ответственный человек. Он ценит свою работу. Сейчас ему необходимо отремонтировать свой автомобиль. С этой целью он обратился за кредитом в организацию ХУМО. Исматбой хочет купить запасные части автомобиля и после ремонта продолжить свою деятельность.
texts.en:
Ismatboy is a driver with 20 years of experience in his work. He lives in the city of Isfara. He is 46 years old, married, and has one son of the age of 19. His wife is a housewife, and Ismatboy supports the family by himself. 

Since 1993 Ismatboy has worked in the public utility service of the city of Isfara as a driver of a sanitary vehicle. He has one assistant. Ismatboy is a serious and responsible man. He values his work. Currently he needs to repair his vehicle. With this aim he applied for a loan from the organization Humo. Ismatboy would like to purchase spare parts for his vehicle, and after repairing it, continue his work.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts for repairing his car

loans.name: Veronica

texts.es:
La socia se sigue dedicando al negocio de tienda de abarrotes,la socia vende productos de primera necesidad como arroz.azucar,leche y galletas,la socia ya tiene 7 años en este negocio y le va muy bien,el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de tienda de abarrotes.La socia solicita el credito para comprar arroz,azucar,leche y galletas.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Veronica continues to make her living in the grocery store. She sells basic items such as rice, sugar, milk and biscuits. She has already spent seven years in the business and it is going very well. Veronica's dream is to expand the grocery store. She is seeking the loan to buy rice, sugar, milk and biscuits.

Veronica is pleased about the loan and promises to meet the repayments.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, milk and biscuits.

loans.name: Pablo

texts.es: Gracias al crédito de kiva Pablo pudo comprar fertilizantes que le ayudaron aumentar su producción y tener una buena cosecha la cual a su ves le dejo buenas ganancias económicas y con los ahorros que tenia pudo comprar un terreno para sembrar plantas de café,para esta nueva etapa de créditos Pablo solicita para pagar las labores culturales que le ayudaran a mantener en optimas condiciones su finca también necesita para comprar plantas ya que compro un terreno el cual quiere reforestar con plantas nuevas las cuales en 3 años le estarán dando una buena producción.
texts.en:
Thanks to the Kiva loan, Pablo was able to buy fertilizers and helped him increase his production and have a good harvest which in turn returned good profits, and with the savings that he made, he was able to buy a plot of land to sow coffee plants. 

For this new stage of loans that Pablo is seeking to pay the cultural work which will help him to keep his farm in tip-top conditions, he also needs to buy plants as he bought a plot which he needs to reforest with new plants which in 3 years' time will return a good crop.

loans.use: to pay laborers to help him to sow and weed his farm and buy plants to reforest a plot of land he has just purchased.

loans.name: Delia Lorena

texts.en:
Delia has always dreamt of becoming a lawyer. She was accepted into the Universidad La Salle and now with the chance to achieve her dream is concerned about affording graduation fees. She plans on graduating in December, 2013 but without a loan from Vittana she fears that she will need to defer receipt of her university degree. 

Delia plans on using the loan to cover the cost of her graduation fees. Often there are fees for earning your title in law before graduating. In addition to her responsibilities at school, Delia currently works 30 hours a week and earns $10 a day. With a degree in law she expects to earn $20 a day. With two older siblings, Delia is unsure how she will be able to afford her graduation fees on her own without the assistance of a Vittana Loan. To help afford her school and living expenses, Delia currently works as a secretary.


This loan is administered by Vittana's partner Banco Fie.

loans.use: to pay for graduation fees

loans.name: Fabiana

texts.en:
Fabiana dreams of becoming an international trade manager, but without a degree, knows it may never be possible. Fabiana was accepted into INCOS, and now, with the chance to achieve her dream, she is concerned about affording tuition fees. 

She plans on graduating in December 2014, but without a loan from Vittana, she thinks that she may need to take time off work and save until she can return to school. With this loan, Fabiana plans to buy her school books. Up until now, she has been managing to get by without them, but it has become a challenge. With books and school supplies, she feels she will be able to get better grades. 

One of her biggest challenges has been making time to work and go to school. To help afford her school and living expenses, Fabiana currently works 30 hours a week as an office assistant and earns $13 a day. With a degree in international trade management, she expects to earn $25 a day. 

Fabiana's parents were never able to complete their primary education. For her family of five, finances have always been tight. With two older siblings, Fabiana is unsure how she will be able to afford her tuition fees on her own without the assistance of a Vittana loan. 

This loan is administered by Vittana's partner, Banco Fie.

loans.use: to pay for her school books.

loans.name: Edelmira

texts.en:
Edelmira dreams of becoming a professional. She was accepted into the Instituto De Educacion Superior, and now, with the chance to achieve her dream, she is concerned about affording tuition fees. She expects to graduate in December 2013, but without a loan, is unsure how she will be able to continue affording her education. She shares that her alternative would be to take time off from school to work and save money until she could return. 

Edelmira shares that it is important to her to graduate on time so she can enter into the job market as soon as possible. With this loan, Edelmira plans to cover the cost of her graduation fees. Often, there are fees for earning your title in business before graduating. 

To help afford her school and living expenses, Edelmira currently works as a secretary. In addition to her responsibilities at school, she works 40 hours a week and earns $8 a day. With a career in business, she expects to earn $13 a day, a substantial increase from before. 

Unfortunately, Edelmira's parents never had the opportunity to complete their high school education. Without the opportunity for a higher degree, her parents never had the chance to move up. Growing up, finances have always been tight. As the youngest of nine, with two older siblings attending college already, Edelmira is unsure how she will be able to finance her education on her own without the assistance of a Vittana loan. 

Edelmira is married with her own children. With a professional degree and a career in business, she hopes to be able to provide her family with a better life. 

This loan is administered by Vittana's partner, Banco Fie.

loans.use: to pay for graduation fees.

loans.name: Gabriela

texts.en:
Becoming a professional has always been Gabriela's dream. To achieve her goal, Gabriela has enrolled in the Universidad Autónoma Juan Misael Saracho. She expects to graduate in December 2014 but without a loan, she is unsure how she will be able to continue affording her education. She shares that her alternative would be to take time off from school to work and save money until she could return. Gabriela shares that it is important to her to graduate on time so she can enter into the job market as soon as possible. With this loan, Gabriela plans to buy her school books. Up until now, she has been managing to get by without them but it has become a challenge. With books and school supplies, she feels she will be able to get better grades. In addition to her responsibilities at school, Gabriela currently works 30 hours a week and earns $4 a day. With a degree in business, she expects to earn $20 a day. Gabriela's parents were never able to complete their primary education. For her family of three, finances have always been tight. With two older siblings, Gabriela is unsure how she will be able to afford her school books on her own without the assistance of a Vittana Loan. Gabriela currently works as a vendor to help afford her school and living expenses.

This loan is administered by Vittana's partner BancoFie.

loans.use: to pay for books

loans.name: Alan Mijail

texts.en:
Alan dreams of becoming a professional. To achieve his goal, Alan has enrolled in the Universidad Mayor De San Andrés. He plans to graduate in June 2014, but without a loan from Vittana he fears that he will need to defer his graduation. With his loan, Alan plans to purchase his much needed textbooks and school supplies. With the proper books, Alan feels he will be able to study more effectively and earn better grades. With two older siblings, Alan is unsure how he will be able to afford his school books on his own without the assistance of a Vittana Loan.

This loan is administered by Vittana's partner BancoFie.

loans.use: to pay for books

loans.name: Cirila

texts.es:
La socia se sigue dedicando al negocio de restaurant,la socia prepara diferentes platos como pollo al horno,estofado de pollo y sopas,la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m,la socia ya tiene 7 años en este negocio y le va muy bien,el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de restaurant.La socia solicita el credito para comprar insumos para cocinar como arroz,verduras,pollo y carne.


La socia esta feliz con el prestamo otorgado y se compromete a pagar sus cuotas.
texts.en:
Cirilia continues to work in the restaurant, she prepares different dishes such as roast chicken, chicken stew and soups. She works from 8:00 a.m to  6:00 p.m. She has seven years of experience in this business and it is going very well for her. Her dream is to expand her restaurant business. Cirilia is seeking the loan to buy cooking supplies such as rice, vegetables, chicken and meat. 

Cirilia is grateful for the loan given and pledges to repay it in a timely fashion.

loans.use: to buy cooking supplies such as rice, vegetables, chicken and meat.

loans.name: Eusebio

texts.es: Eusebio de 59 años de edad, está casado con Graciela y tienen un hijo que ya es mayor e independiente, razón por la cual solo vive con su esposa en su casa propia. La actividad que realiza Eusebio es la venta de de artículos de ferretería como alambres de púas, tubos, pegamentos, entre otros. Para eso se levanta muy de temprano en las madrugadas y se dirige a su local  el cual queda en el mercado de la ciudad, porque los clientes llegan desde muy temprano para adquirir sus productos. Se inició hace más de 10 años con un capital propio y hasta el momento lo viene realizando solo. Se decidió empezar éste negocio por la necesidad de contar con un oficio y obtener ingresos para sostener los gatos de su familia. Este es su primer crédito con Kiva, y se siente agradecido con el apoyo financiero que recibe para seguir adelante, además se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual. Con el monto solicitado de 2000 nuevos soles, comprará mercadería para su ferretería tales como clavos, martillos, madera, entre otros.
texts.en:
59-year old Eusebio is married to Graciela and they have an adult son. As he is independent, Eusebio and his wife live alone in their own house. He earns his living selling hardware such as barbed wire, pipes, adhesives etc. He gets up very early and then sets off to his stall located in the local market as his customers also start arriving early in the morning to buy supplies.

Eusebio started this job more than ten years ago using his own capital, and still works alone. He decided on this business as he needed a job and an income to support his family. This is his first loan with Kiva and he feels very grateful for this financial assistance to help him get ahead. He promises to pay back the money punctually. With the S/. 2000 loan money Eusebio plans to buy stock for his hardware stall such as nails, hammers, wood etc.

loans.use: Buy stock for his hardware stall such as nails, hammers, wood

loans.name: Dina

texts.en:
This is Dina, 61, resident of Batasan (Commonwealth), Quezon City, Philippines. Single, she works hard to provide for her everyday needs.

Dina operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is a retail store that sells inexpensive items, often with a single price for all items in the store. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a PHP 5 worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of PHP 500 in sales every day.

She is requesting a PHP 10,000 loan to help her continue in the operation of her business. She will use the loan to buy groceries, toiletries, and beverages to expand her product inventory.

Dina hopes to expand her business and dreams to have a good life. Every week, she meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business and draws strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

All Center for Community Transformation (CCT) community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items, toiletries, and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Thy's Group

texts.en:
Thy, 52 and an industrious mother of seven children, is a villager from Kampong Cham’s Tbaung Khmum district. Her daily income is about KHR 25,000 per day to support her daily cost of living. This income is from her rice-cropping business and from working for others, for a fee. 

This is the first loan for Thy’s Group, consisting of two borrowers with VisionFund Cambodia (Kiva’s partner). Thy and her joint borrower are seeking the same loan amount, KHR 1,000,000 each. 

As the leader, Thy will spend her loan portion to build a decent latrine for her family and to buy potash for her farmland. She hopes that she can own a proper latrine to improve the hygienic practices of her family.

loans.use: to build a decent latrine for her family.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Tbaung Khmum district

loans.name: Le

texts.en:
Le was born in 1953. She has a son who has got married. He is a worker. Le and her husband are divorced. Le is a retired worker. Her income is about 3,000,000 VND per month. Besides that, she also raises chickens to earn more money. Her challenge in work is lacking capital to repair her house and to raise chickens. Her dream is having good health and more savings for her future. This loan is one of the steps that helps her reach this dream. She will use this loan to buy more chickens to breed, to gain earnings and save profit for her dream.

Le is a hardworking woman. Le has participated in SEDA’s microfinance program since 2012. In the last loan cycle, she borrowed 5,014,000 VND and repaid on time. In this loan cycle, she wants to borrow 6,322,000 VND to buy more chickens to expand her poultry farm.

loans.use: to buy more chickens to expand her farm

loans.name: Besik

texts.en: Besik, 36, is married and lives with wife and two children (2 and 5 years old) in the village of Sanakhshire. Besik is the only one who makes money in his household by doing construction work and completing custom projects locally. Besik is a very enthusiastic man and wants to generate more income and help the family. Their existing income is not enough to cover everyday expenses. So, Besik decided to start up a grocery store, but found that he didn't have enough money to do so. Unfortunately, Besik was unable to obtain a loan from existing financial institutions, as they require a stable income and business experience as a precondition for a loan. But Besik has now received his loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and Credo. This start-up loan program provides start-up and re-start up loans with simple terms to the country's vulnerable poor who do not have access to credit. With a loan of 2,500 USD, Besik will rent commercial space in his district and purchase basic groceries for starting up a store. He will care for his clients and treat them in a kind and friendly way. With this determination and his loan he expects to improve his income and give his family members better living conditions.

loans.use: to start up a grocery store.

loans.name: Benkadi Ii Group

texts.fr:
Les membres du groupe BENKADI II sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de   49ans, 3enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles polygames à TOULOMADIO, un des villages  de KEBILA, Préfecture de KOLONDIEBA, 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur troisième prêt avec l’institution, les prêt passés ont été bien remboursés.
La spéculation cultivée est l’arachide  avec MINATA  1ère à gauche sur la photo.
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter des intrants, la semence et payer les frais de labour pour exploiter  2 hectares. 
La production est vendue au niveau du village et à Kebila  après la récolte à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 145.500FCFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The members of Benkadi II Group are married women who, on average, are 49 years old, have three children, and all live in polygamous families in Toulomadio, a village in Kebila, within Kolondieba prefecture in Mali's third administrative region. The group members partner with microfinance institution [MFI] Soro Yiriwaso in order to successfully complete their agricultural activities during the rainy season.

The group is on its third loan with the MFI, and the previous loans have been properly repaid.

The crop to be grown is groundnuts, by Minata, first on the left in the photo. With her loan, Minata plans to purchase farm inputs and seeds, and to pay the cost of labor, for two hectares. The crop will be sold in the village and in Kebila after the harvest, to male and female customers. 

Minata expects to see an average profit of 145,500 CFA francs per crop. This profit will allow her to repay her loan and to help her husband with the day-to-day expenses.

loans.use: To purchase farm inputs, seeds, and labor for the farming season.

loans.name: Koffi

texts.fr: Mr Koffi vit avec sa femme et leurs 02 enfants de 19 et 23ans à Lomé. Il revend des fournitures scolaires et également fait la photocopie. Pour mieux répondre aux besoins des clients, mr Koffi fait sa toute première demande à WAGES pour acheter de la  photocopieuse. Il désire assurer les besoins vitaux de la famille et agrandir son activité avec le profit qu'il réalisera. Avec une ancienneté de 07ans dans l'activité, mr Koffi est âgé de 43ans.
texts.en:
Koffi lives with his wife and their two children, aged 19 and 23, in Lomé. He resells school supplies and also makes photocopies. In order to better meet the needs of his customers, Koffi is making his first loan request with WAGES to purchase a photocopy machine.

Koffi wants to provide for the basic needs of his family and also to grow his business with the profit he will earn. With 7 years experience in this business, he is 43 years old.

loans.use: purchase a photocopier

loans.name: Idayatou

texts.fr: Jeune femme de 26ans, Idyatou est maman de 02 adorables enfants âgés de 06 et 02ans. Seul l'ainé va à l'école pour le moment. Son conjoint est revendeur de portables. Pour contribuer aux besoins de la famille, elle revend des produits de beauté au marché cela depuis 2008. Elle espère qu'avec le profit tiré de son premier crédit réinvestir dans l'activité et aider son mari à assurer l'éducation de leur enfant.
texts.en:
Idyatou is a 26-year-old woman and the mother of two adorable children aged six and two. For the moment, only the eldest attends school. Idyatou's spouse is a mobile phone retailer.

To contribute to the family's expenses, Idyatou has been selling beauty products in the market since 2008. She hopes to reinvest in her business with the profit from her first loan, and to help her husband provide for their child's education.

loans.use: To purchase beauty products.

loans.name: M'gora

texts.fr: Mr M'Gora revend depuis 2008 des oignons au marché.  Il sollicite son second crédit à WAGES pour acheter plus de marchandises afin de mieux répondre aux besoins de la famille. Marié, il a un enfant d'01an. Son désir est de rendre sa famille très épanouie et de maintenir son activité stable.
texts.en: Mr. M'Gora has been selling onions at the market since 2008. He is seeking his second WAGES loan to purchase more merchandise in order to better meet the needs of his family. Mr. M'Gora is married and has a one-year-old child. His wish is to bring joy to his family and to have a steady business.

loans.use: To purchase onions.

loans.name: Siem's Group

texts.en: Siem is 38 years old and a villager from Kampong Cham province. She has five children, one of whom is still in school and relies on her. She has a half hectare of rice crops, from which she can generate about 27,000 KHR per day. Siem and her co-borrower, in the a group of two, are new to VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). They are seeking for 1,000,000 KHR each. As the leader, she will spend her loan portion to pay a plowing fee and to buy potash for her crop. She hopes that she can make more income.

loans.use: to pay a plowing fee and to buy potash for her crop.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Cheung Prey district

loans.name: Felipe De Jesús

texts.es: La cosecha pasada Feipe de Jesús pudo mejorar su producción gracias a la compra de fertilizantes que le ayudaron a mejorar la calidad de sus plantas y con ello mejoro su producción considerablemente para estos nuevos créditos Felipe de Jesús solicita de nuevo para la compra de fertilizantes ya que cada año las necesidades de nutrientes de las plantas son mas y hay que mantenerlas en optimas condiciones para que sigan aumentando su producción también requiere crédito para la compra de plantas ya que en algunas partes de su finca las plantas ya están viejas y deben ser cambiadas por plantas nuevas implementado estas acciones obtendrá buena cosecha y mejores ganancias económicas las cuales le ayudaran a ir mejorando su calidad de vida y las de los suyos.
texts.en:
The previous harvest, Felipe de Jesús was able to improve his production thanks to the purchase of fertilizers which helped him to improve the quality of his plants and in doing so he considerably improved his production. 

Felipe de Jesús is once again seeking a loan to buy fertilizers as each year the plants need more nutrients and they need to be kept in optimal conditions to continue increasing their production. He also needs the loan to buy plants as there are some areas in his farm where the plants are old and need to be changed with new ones. Through these actions, Felipe will have a good harvest and better profits which will help him to improve his quality of life and that of his family.

loans.use: to buy plants for replanting and fertilizers which will help him to improve his production.

loans.name: Sédikatou

texts.fr: Sédikatou est veuve âgée de 52ans. Elle a 03 enfants. Le premier a 31ans et le dernier 25ans. Elle est revendeuse de profession. Elle vend à domicile des produits de mercerie. C’est pour renforcer son activité qu'elle fait son quatrième prêt pour acheter des produits de mercerie. Avec les profits qu’elle va réaliser, elle veut élargir l’activité tout en assurant les besoins vitaux de la famille.
texts.en: Sédikatou is a 52-year-old widow with three children. Her eldest child is 31 and the youngest is 25. Sédikatou works as a retailer, selling notions from home. Sédikatou is taking a fourth loan to purchase [more] notions in order to strengthen her business. With the profits, Sédikatou wants to expand her business while providing for her family's basic needs.

loans.use: To purchase notions.

loans.name: Delia

texts.en: Delia earns a living through her hog-raising business, which she has run for more than five years now. She is a married woman and lives with her family in the town of Ubay, Bohol. Delia is asking for a loan to buy more piglets to raise and to purchase feed for the pigs. With this, she will be able to improve her hog-raising business and make it a success. Moreover, she wants to save money for the schooling of her children and to repay her loan on time.

loans.use: to buy more piglets and feed

loans.name: Rodulfo

texts.en:
Rodulfo is a farmer from Bohol, Philippines. He is a married man and has been in the farming business for more than 10 years now. This is the source of his income.

Rodulfo is asking for a loan to buy seedlings, fertilizer and to pay the labor costs for the farm. With this, Rodulfo will be able to improve the productivity of the farm, thus augmenting his yield and income. In the future, Rodulfo hopes to make his business a success.

loans.use: to buy seedlings, fertilizer and to pay the labor costs for the farm

loans.name: Sophy's Group

texts.en: Residing in Kampong Cham province’s Tbaung Khmum district, Sophy is in her late 20s and the mother of one little kid. Sophy makes a living through rice farming, and her husband supplements the family income by working for others for a fee. The current business, which Sophy has been with for 10 years, has returned her about 18,000 KHR per day. Sophy and her fellow group member are in a first-cycle loan, seeking  300,000 KHR and 500,000 KHR, respectively, with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). As the leader, Sophy will spend her loan portion to buy potash and insecticide for her farmland and to pay plowing fees. She hopes that she can increase the income from her business.

loans.use: to buy potash insecticide and to pay for plowing of her farmland

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Tbaung Khmum district

loans.name: Umazi

texts.en:
Umazi is married with no children. She lives in her own house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food.

For the past three years, she has operated a food selling business, cooking food and selling it from her cafe. She faces a major challenge of stiff competition for her business.

With the KES 30,000 she wants to purchase sugar, beans, rice and tea leaves for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase sugar, beans, rice and tea leaves for resale

loans.name: Ma Eufracia

texts.es:
Doña Eufracia es una mujer de 31 años de edad emprendedora que junto con su esposo y sus 5 hijos se dedican a las diferentes actividades de cultivo y producción  de granos básicos como ser: maíz, frijol y siendo su principal actividad el café. Ella aprendió la agricultura hace más de cinco años siendo su esposo el que le enseñara a trabajar la tierra en las diferentes actividades como, limpieza, abono, corte, etc. Sus siembras maíz y frijol son cultivadas en la misma propiedad donde está ubicada su casa de habitación y sus cultivos de café están a una distancia de 5 kilómetros de su casa habitación a la cual se trasladan a pie diariamente. Doña Eufracia  solo curso hasta tercer grado ya que no tubo apoyo financiero por parte de sus padres siendo ellos de escasos recursos. Sus sueños son educar sus 5 hijos para que ellos tengan una mejor calidad de vida y que obtenga un nivel educativo universitario, sus 4 hijos mayores le ayudan a cultivar granos básicos mientras no están en sus actividades estudiantiles y 1 hijo esta pequeño.

Doña Eufracia actualmente solicita un financiamiento a la cooperativa COMIXMUL para la compra de: 3 cargas de urea, 4 cargas de abono 18-46-0, 5 cargas de abono 12-24-12, 4 litros de abono foliar, 2 galones de herbicidas, 6 cargas de maíz y frijol para cultivar ya que es necesario asistir y dar mantenimiento a sus cultivos como también extenderlos para generar mayores ingresos para su hogar y su familia.
texts.en:
Eufracia is an enterprising woman aged 31. Together with her husband and five children she grows crops such as corn and beans but coffee is the main crop. She learned about farming more than five years ago from her husband who taught how to do different activities such as weeding, fertilizing, pruning etc. The corn and bean fields are located close to her house, but the coffee is grown about five kilometres away so she goes there every day on foot.

Eufracio only completed grade three as her parents are poor and couldn't afford anything further. Her dream is that her children get an education and have a better standard of living. She would like them to attend university. Her four older children help on the farm when they aren't studying, and the youngest is still small.

She is now seeking a loan from the COMIXMUL Cooperative to buy 3 loads of urea, 4 lots of 18-46-0 fertilizer, 5 lots of 12-24-12 fertilizer, 4 liters of leaf fertilizer, 2 gallons of herbicide, and 6 loads of corn and beans to plant. Eufracia knows it is important that the crops are well cared for so that she earns more money for her home and family.

loans.use: Buy farming supplies and seeds for her coffee farm

loans.name: Laureana

texts.es:
La socia Laureana pertenece al banco comunal MI PERU,la socia continua con su negocio de pizzeria,la socia lleva buen tiempo con su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa siendo  de esta forma que la socia saca adelante  a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de insumos como queso, jamón entre otros para su negocio.
La socia se siente agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Laureana is a member of the Mi Peru Community Bank. She continues to run her pizzeria, and the business is doing well thanks to the effort she puts in every day.  As a responsible and hardworking person she is helping her family get ahead.

She is seeking a loan to buy cheese, ham etc. for her business.

Laureana is grateful for this financial opportunity and promises to pay back the loan according to the schedule.

loans.use: Buy ingredients such as cheese and ham for her pizzeria

loans.name: Paul

texts.en:
Paul, aged 56 years, is a new client at this branch and he comes from Nyabikuku, Nyakagyeme Rukungiri District. He is married with 6 children and is a tutor at a technical college in same career. His major business activity is agriculture, mainly poultry and banana farming.

He was advanced 1,000,000 UGX from UGAFODE Microfinance Limited (MDI) to boost his agricultural endeavors.

He thanks UGAFODE for considering him for a loan, which he is going to inject into his poultry farm to increase his income. In the photograph, Paul is with his wife.

loans.use: to buy young chicks for rearing and later selling

loans.name: Armen

texts.en:
Armen lives in the village of Akhuryan with his wife and two daughters. He used to go abroad and work for awhile providing his family with money. But starting from 2010 he has been involved in agriculture and it is the only source of income. Armen keeps 20 colonies of bees, 5 pigs and 10 piglets. Near the village where Armen lives, he owns a plot of agricultural land where wheat and barley are cultivated. He works hard to gather a good harvest and sell it locally. He gets high quality honey and as honey is a must have product for each household in the community, Armen is able to sell it at a good price. 

Now, this farmer with a great credit history behind him has requested a loan to purchase 10 colonies of bees, barley and wheat seeds, and fertilizer. These purchases will greatly support Armen to enlarge his farming business and improve his family's living conditions.

loans.use: to pay for 10 colonies of bees, barley and wheat seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Moses

texts.en:
Moses is aged 27 years, single, and a resident of the Nateete a Kampala suburb. Moses went to school up to the secondary level, and in the midst of his education his parents ran bankrupt, so he decided to resort to business.

Moses commenced a business in 2009 on a busy street with an aim of generating daily income. Having seen a gap in his business of inadequate capital, he resorted to borrowing from Ugafode and is applying for a loan of ugx. 1,000,000 to buy more sugar cane from the villages to meet the demand of his customers, which he says is "very high." He normally serves passersby, clients and neighbors along a busy street, but even more so students from a nearby school. 

Moses’ major challenges are inadequate capital, competition and seasonal changes in farming. He is hardworking and always focuses on his business in order to have increased profits. In set is Moses at his business.

loans.use: To buy sugar cane to resell

loans.name: Rose

texts.en: Rose is married with six children and all her children go to school. She also takes care of additional family members (old parents). She has a restaurant business and has been in this business for three years. She has applied for a loan of 500,000 Uganda shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy more bunches of green bananas, beans, fish, tomatoes, beef, rice and sweet potatoes. She works from home seven days out of every week and sells to all categories of people but on a retail basis. Her major business challenges include thieves and transportation. She aspires to own a fully stocked restaurant and also to build her own house. She resides in a rented house and the family has access to electricity but not to piped water. Her monthly expenses include rent and school fees.

loans.use: To buy more  bunches of green bananas, beans, fish, tomatoes, beef, rice and sweet potatoes

loans.name: Modesto

texts.es: Modesto, tiene 50 años de edad y vive con su esposa e hijo en el municipio de Victoria. Siempre se ha dedicado a la agricultura realizando trabajos de jornal y también a la venta de carne. Ahora lleva 10 años de dedicarse al cultivo de maíz y frijoles como negocio propio, la producción la vende en el mercado local de la zona. El préstamo solicitado es por 12,000 Lempiras y lo va invertir en la compra de abono para el cultivo del maíz y frijoles para que la producción y la calidad del producto mejoren. Su plan es seguir mejorando en el cultivo de maíz y frijoles, también ser un gran productor de estos granos y mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia.
texts.en: Modesto is 50 years old and lives with his wife and son in the town of Victoria.  He has always been a farmer, working the fields and also selling meat.  He has been raising corn and beans for 10 years as part of his own business, and sells his harvest at the local market.  He is asking for a loan of 12,000 Lempiras to buy fertilizer for his corn and bean crops, so that the quality of his harvest will improve.  His plans are to improve his crops, become a great producer, and improve his family’s quality of life.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer.

loans.name: Sophy's Group

texts.en: Age 40 and a farmer from Kampong Cham province, Sophy is a married mother of three schoolchildren. For her entire family, especially her kids, she does rice planting and works for others for a fee for additional income. She is able to earn up to 20,000 KHR per day from her current business, which she has had for ages. Sophy has never been with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) before. She has joined a group of two to get a loan. She is seeking 350,000 KHR while her joint member is applying for 1,200,000 KHR. As the leader, Sophy will spend her loan portion to buy fertilizer and insecticide and to pay for plowing. She expects to gain a good yield with high profit for her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and insecticide and to pay a plowing fee

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Tbaung Khmum district

loans.name: Sameth's Group

texts.en: Sameth is a villager from Kampong Cham province where she grows rice as well as works for a salary. She is 51 years old, married, and earns about 18,000 KHR a day. She also leads a two-person group which is requesting a loan from VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). They are second-time borrowers and seeking 600,000 KHR each. Sameth, who successfully repaid her previous loan, will use this new one to buy fertilizer and to pay a plowing fee. She hopes to earn a good income for her family so that she can keep her children in school.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and to pay a plowing fee.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ou Reang Ov district

loans.name: Ratna Sari Group

texts.en: The Ratna Sari group is requesting a new loan for 20M IDR. They will use this loan to buy new piglets, renovate barns and buy high-quality feed. Their goal is to acquire enough money to continue expanding their businesses on their own. They are very grateful to receive support from Kiva lenders and MUK. The group's leader, Ni Putu, will use her portion of this loan to buy two superior piglets and feed.

loans.use: to buy two high-quality piglets and feed

loans.name: Edward

texts.en:
Edward, a second-time client with Ugafode, is 25 years old. He resides in the city outskirts and is single but focused. He utilised his previous loan so well and now wants another loan. Edward deals in the business of selling windscreens,which he started in 2009 in a busy market, with an aim of improving his daily income; and in addition to that, he carries out a service of installing them. His major customers are mainly those people with vehicles from various parts of the country. However, Edward’s major challenges in the business are inadequate capital and competition in the market.

Edward got a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan shillings to purchase more windscreens from the town to add to his business to meet the demand of his customers,which is speculated to be high in these coming months.

Edward is hardworking, determined and focused, and wants lenders to keep funding him so that he can grow his business.

loans.use: To buy stock of windscreens for selling.

loans.name: Chan's Group

texts.en:
A married mother of five children from Ponhea Krek district of Kampong Cham province, Chan is a local farmer who does rice and cassava farming on two hectares each. She is able to earn up to KHR 28,000 per day from the current business that she has had for ages. 

This is a first-time loan for Chan’s Group with VisionFund Cambodia (Kiva’s partner). They are applying for the same loan amount of KHR 500,000 each. 

As the leader, Chan will spend her loan portion to buy potash for her crop husbandry. She hopes that she can gain a good yield with a good profit for her family, so that she can buy an additional plot of farmland to expand her crop farming.

loans.use: to buy potash for her crop husbandry.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ponhea Krek district

loans.name: Ammaoy

texts.ru: Аммаой добрая и целеустремленная женщина. Ей 56 лет. Она замужем и имеет 2 детей. Аммаой занимается продажей национальных мужских халатов «чапан». Она не имеет свою собственную точку и обычно продает у своих партнеров по бизнесу или на руках. Она давно мечтает иметь свою торговую точку, чтобы свободно продала свои товары. Скоро ее сын Изатулло собирается жениться, и Аммаой должна организовать свадебное торжество своего сына, но так как она имеет маленький доход, она не в состоянии организовать свадебное торжество. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 4000 сомони для проведения свадебного торжества своего сына. Она мечтает, чтобы ее сын и невестка стали счастливыми.
texts.en: Ammaoy is a kind and driven woman.  She is 56 years old, married and has two children.  Ammaoy is involved in selling men's national robes "chapan."  She does not own a retail outlet and usually sells at her business partners' or by herself.  She has been dreaming of having her own retail outlet for a long time, so that she could freely sell her merchandise.  Her son, Izatullo, is planning to get married soon, and Ammaoy has to organize the wedding celebration for her son, but because she has a small income, she cannot organize the wedding.  She is requesting a loan in the amount of 4000 somoni to hold a wedding for her son.  She dreams that her son and daughter-in-law become happy.

loans.use: to hold a wedding for her son

loans.name: Five Stars Group

texts.en:
Fatuma, who is in her early 20s, is married and living with her husband; together they are blessed with one kid. 

For five years now, Fatuma has been running a shop selling different dry food items like beans, sugar, maize flour, baking flour and others. She works from 6:00 a.m. to 10:00 p.m. daily and is able to make a good profit per month. 

This will be Fatuma's first loan request from Tujijenge Tanzania. She will use the loan to increase her shop inventory. She is looking for this increment in order to serve more customers. Fatuma dreams that one day she will be able to buy her own plot of land for building a business premises.

She will share this loan with her loan group, “Five Stars”, which totals five members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to increase her shop inventory.

loans.name: Jovia

texts.en: Jovia is a repeat borrower having borrowed before from UGAFODE Microfinance through its Ishaka Branch. She is married and has eight children who are all studying. Her major source of income is pineapple growing which she has given her best effort to be able to get income to sustain her family. She gives the business four hours each day and in addition to this business she also grows bananas as a way of supplementing her income. Jovia started growing pineapples in 2000 in rural Bushenyi District. Her main objective in starting the business was to get money to pay school fees for her eight children.  Her clients are mainly the people in her local cell and she sometimes gets customers from different villages when they are passing by. Jovia hopes to use the money to buy mulch and fertilizers so that she can have improved yields.  Her biggest challenge is the unfavorable climatic conditions which affect her income negatively.  She is honest and this has helped her a lot in conducting her business.  She has high hopes that her business will do better if the loan of UGX 2,000,000 is given to her.In set is Jovia in her pine apple garden.

loans.use: To buy mulch and organic fertiilzers

loans.name: Emmanuel

texts.en: Emmanuel is a new client with a retail business which he started in 2010.  He is a married man with two children, aged four and two. He is a shrewd and vigilant man who started the retail business to be able to have a sustainable source of income so he could cater to his needs and the needs of his family. In addition to his major source of income, he also does a motorcycle transport business to supplement on his monthly income. The business is done in rural Ishaka –Bushenyi district, and his clients are people in that particular area. He hopes to use the money (ugx.1,500,000) to buy merchandise so that he can make more profits and educate his children. Emmanuel’s major challenge is competition from other businessmen who sell the same products as his. However, he is determined to outdo his competitors.  He hopes that, with the Kiva loan, his dreams will become reality soon.

loans.use: To buy retail stock items of salt, soap, sugar,  among other daily household items

loans.name: Paul

texts.en:
Paul is a business man, 28 years old,  with a family of four children and a wife.
Paul has been running a retail shop for the past five years in Mutukula town; he is proud to have attained enough expertise to keep it going. He also does agriculture in his home area and that has also considerably contributed towards his income.

He also says he wants the facility to expand his retail shop and hopes his income is going to increase with this facility.

His main challenge affecting the smooth flow of his business is lack of enough capital to meet the ever changing demand of his customers; he is happy that the institution has enabled him get funds.

Finally, he acknowledges the work done by Ugafode, especially enabling him get funds which he would not have acquired because he lacks security.

loans.use: To buy stock of retail items for sell

loans.name: Santiago

texts.en:
This loan will help Santiago sign a contract he recently received from the State of Florida. 

Santiago began his own residential and commercial construction company, SAMG Builders Inc, in 2010. After moving to the U.S. from Honduras eight years ago, Santiago wanted to find a job where he could provide for his family—both in the States and in Honduras, and contribute to his Central Florida community. SAMG Builders Inc. offers free consultations and a full range of construction and landscaping services—from minor home repairs to complete renovations—through hired subcontractors. Santiago recently won a bid with the State of Florida and now needs a loan to secure enough capital to officially obtain the contract. This project will increase his business sales and reputation significantly, allowing him to grow his company and accept more contracts in the future. 

To view more about Santiago’s company SAMG Builders Inc, visit: http://samgbuildersinc.com/

loans.use: to purchase materials to fulfill large contract bid from the State of Florida

loans.name: Mary Jane

texts.en:
Mary Jane is a 35-year-old married woman from Talibon, Bohol. She is the mother of a 9-year-old child. She runs a plastic supplies store. She sells various items like cellophane, native brooms, pots and plastic ropes. 

She requested a loan of 26,000 PHP to buy more stock like various kinds of cellophane, chlorine and other products, to attract more customers. 

In the future, Mary Jane would like to expand her business to provide her family with good living conditions.

loans.use: to buy more stock like various kinds of cellophane, chlorine and other products.

loans.name: Hoeurn's Group

texts.en:
Hoeurn is 59 years old and a married mother, blessed with three children. For her family, working for others for a fee and rice growing are the main source of income, and she can get 30,000 KHR per day to cover her daily cost of living. Her prior loan was her original loan with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner).  After the successful past loan which she has repaid, she can sustain her living and has made progress. 

Now, she is leading a group composed of four women to get a new loan. She and one of her co-borrowers are seeking 1,200,000 KHR each whereas the remaining members are taking 1,000,000 KHR each. Hoeurn will spend her loan portion to buy fertilizer and to pay for plowing fee plus transplanting fee. She hopes to gain a good yield with high profit for her family.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and to pay for plowing fee plus transplanting fee

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ou Reang Ov district

loans.name: Emelia

texts.en:
Emelia has earned a living through her food vending business for more than a year now. She lives with her family in the town of Ubay, Bohol. Emelia cooks and sells home-cooked foods to the people in her place. This is the source of her income.

Emelia is asking for a loan to buy flour, sugar, and other cooking ingredients. With this, she will be able to cook and sell more, thus augmenting her sales and income. In the future, Emelia has hopes of making her business a success and sustainable. Moreover, she wants to save money for the schooling of her children and to repay her loan on time.

loans.use: to buy flour, sugar, and other cooking ingredients

loans.name: Joenila

texts.en:
Joenila, of Poblcaion 2, Oroquieta City, has been running a motorcycle transportation business for many years to support the needs of her only child. She successfully repaid her previous loan from Gata Daku Multi-Purpose Cooperative (GDMPC). The loan contributed much to improve her services and earn a living. 

Joenila borrowed a new loan to cover the costs of motor maintenance. She plans to expand her business and buy another unit of motorcycle, to gain more revenue.

loans.use: to cover the costs of motor maintenance.

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David, 38, is married and lives with his wife, mother and three children ages 11, 12 and 13 in the village of Dzirula.  David is a construction worker, and works at the local bridge building company. Besides that, he runs a small scale agricultural business and grows nuts in his garden. David owns a dairy cow and makes cheese with the milk produced. The cheese and the harvested nuts are sold locally.
 
David is an enthusiastic man, and wants to generate more income. The existing funds, though, are not enough to cover everyday expenses.  So, David decided to start up a grocery store, but found that he didn't have enough money to do so. Unfortunately, David was unable to obtain a loan from existing financial institutions, as they required a stable income and business experience as a precondition to a loan. However, David has now received his loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and Credo. This start-up loan program provides start-up and restart-up loans with easy terms to the country's vulnerable poor who do not have access to credit. 

With a loan of 2500 GEL (Georgian Lari), David will hire commercial space in his district and purchase basic groceries for starting up a store. He will care for his clients and treat them in a kind and friendly way. With this determination and his loan, he expects to improve his income and give his family members better living conditions.

loans.use: to start up a grocery store.

loans.name: Lillian

texts.en:
Lillian is a married woman with two children, one who goes to school and another who is still young. She lives at her own house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is household consumables.

For the past four years, she has operated a clothes selling business, selling from door to door to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of high cost of transportation. She dreams of expanding and establishing a boutique business in the future. 

With the loan that she is requesting she wants to purchase bales of clothes for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bales of clothes for resale

loans.name: Rubina

texts.en:
Rubina's husband is a tailor by profession. He owns a tailoring shop in the market. He is the father of three children. 

The income from his work is the only source by which he meets the family’s expenses. He has to pay for electricity bills, water and gas bills, the children's educational expenses, traveling expenses, and food expenses on a monthly and daily basis. However, his monthly income is too low to cover the daily expenditures of his family, due to which he has to face lots of challenges.

Therefore, he is planning to purchase one more tailoring machine with the help of a Kiva loan, to grow his business. By doing so, he would be able to deal with more customers and complete the orders quickly and in less time. 

Rubina prays for the success of her husband's business. She wants to thank all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase a tailoring machine for stitching purposes for her husband's tailoring business.

loans.name: Lilian

texts.en:
Lilian lives in Gango, Ozamiz City, with her family. She is 34 years old and has three children. Her husband works as a driver, while she runs a general store selling goods in their community to earn a living. She has been in this business for more than ten years. 

She joined Gata Daku MPC recently and took out a loan, in addition to her existing working capital. An amount of 10,000.00 PHP was used to purchase goods like noodles, canned, bottled and sachet products for basic home use. She hopes to double her income to use it as working capital for the business.

loans.use: to purchase goods like noodles, canned, bottled and sachet products for basic home use

loans.name: Chi's Group

texts.en:
Chi was born in 1979. She has three children. The oldest son is learning at the 11th grade. The others are aged 2 and 6. She and her husband sell beer to earn a living.
