Chi’s husband earns about 3,000,000 VND (Vietnamese dong), and Chi earns about 5,000,000 VND per month. Chi has done this job for 10 years. Besides that, Chi also is a paper maker to earn more money. Her family’s total earnings are about 8,000,000 VND per month. Her challenge in life and work is lacking capital to sell beer. Her dream is to grow her children up well and have a successful future. This loan is one of the steps that helps her reach this dream. 

She would like to use this loan to buy more beer, to gain earnings and save profits for her dream. Chi is a hardworking woman and a passionate businesswoman. She has participated in SEDA's microfinance program since 2005. In the last loan cycle, she borrowed 9,810,000 VND and repaid on time. In this loan cycle, she would like to borrow 11,118,000 VND to buy more beer and other kinds of beverages to expand her beverage stall. She will use the profit to grow her children up well.

Other members who are part of Chi’s group include the following:

Hang is 37 years old. She has a child. She is a barber. She wants to borrow 11,118,000 VND to invest in her barbershop.

Lan is 31 years old. She has two children. She sells fruit. She wants to borrow 6,322,000 VND to sell fruit.

Nguyen is 40 years old. She has two children. She grows rice. She wants to borrow 6,322,000 VND to sell rice.

Thuy is 32 years old. She has two children. She sells fruit. She wants to borrow 6,322,000 VND to sell fruit.

Son is 57 years old. She has three children. She grows rice. She wants to borrow 5,014,000 VND to sell scrap in a market.

Du is 47 years old. She has two children. She grows rice. She wants to borrow 5,014,000 VND  to sell rice.

Hanh is 37 years old. She has two children. She sells fruit. She wants to borrow 11,118,000 VND to sell fruit.

loans.use: to buy more beer and other kinds of beverages to expand her beverage stall.

loans.name: Peninah

texts.en:
Peninah, aged 24 years, is married and has been blessed with two children ages 3 years and eight months. She owns a house that  has  neither electricity nor piped water. 

For the past three years, she has operated a retail shop business, selling household consumables to local customers. She faces a major challenge of high cost of transportation in her place of operation. 

With the KES 20,000 loan, she wants to purchase wheat flour, beans, maize flour and soft drinks. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase wheat flour, beans, maize flour, soft drinks.

loans.name: Samol's Group

texts.en:
Samol, in her late 40s, is a resident of Kampong Cham province. She earns a living through rice farming and working as a paid-worker. She can earn up to 35,000 KHR from the business that she has had for ages. 

Samol is in a first-time loan with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She leads a group of four female members to get a new loan. She will spend her loan portion to buy fertilizer and to pay for plowing fees. She hopes to earn more income to support her family.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and to pay for plowing fees

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ou Reang Ov district

loans.name: Kimnay's Group

texts.en:
Kimnay is 54 years old and a citizen from Kampong Cham province. She is a widowed mother, with four children. Her main source of income to support her living is working for others for a fee and rice farming. She is able to earn up to KHR 28,000 from her current business. 

Kimnay’s first loan was with VisionFund Cambodia (Kiva’s partner), as well. Her original loan has enabled her to improve her business and her living in a timely way. Additionally, she could afford to buy a cow to support her farmland. 

Now, she leads a group of five members to get a new loan. The total amount of entire group loan is KHR 4,800,000. 

For Kimnay, the group leader whose loan portion is KHR 1,200,000, she will use her loan to buy fertilizer and to pay for plowing and transplanting fees. She believes that she can gain a good yield, with high income.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and to pay for plowing and transplanting fees.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ou Reang Ov district

loans.name: Juan Carlos

texts.es: Gracias al Crédito de kiva Juan Carlos pudo comprar plantas para reforestar una parte de su finca en la cual ya tenia plantas viejas que no producían también  pudo pagar a los jornaleros que le ayudaron en la limpieza de su finca para que se mantuviera en optimas condiciones en tiempo de cosecha,  para estos nuevos créditos Juan Carlos solicita para la compra de fertilizantes los cuales le ayudara en sus plantas nuevas a crecer mas rápidamente y a las que están en etapa de producción a aumentarla también necesita crédito para el pago de las labores culturales las cuales le ayudaran a que su finca se encuentre limpia y las plantas en buen estado para el momento de cosecha.
texts.en:
Thanks to his Kiva loan Juan Carlos was able to buy plants to replant part of his farm.  He had various old plants that weren't producing anymore.  He also paid the day laborers who helped him weed his farm to keep it in optimal conditions for the harvest.

Juan Carlos is requesting this new loan to buy fertilizer to help his new plants grow more quickly and to expand the plants that are currently producing.  He also needs a loan to pay for the agricultural labor that keeps the farm weeded and the plants in good condition for when it's time to harvest.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and to pay day laborers

loans.name: Hang

texts.en:
Hang was born in 1992. She lives in Yen Phong, Bac Ninh. She is studying in a Graphic Designer major of the National University of Art Education (http://www.spnttw.edu.vn/). Her course lasts 45 months and she will graduate in 2015. She is the first person in her family to study at the university. Standing beside Hang in this photo is her mother. Her mother cooks food to sell and her father is a construction worker. Her family’s income is 10,000,000 VND per month. 

Hang is aware that studying will give her opportunities to find a good job and earn more money. She chooses this job because she thinks that this major is lacking in workers in Vietnam. After graduating, she can find a stable job, earn much money to afford for her family, and improve her family’s living standard. She wants to borrow 10,206,000 VND to pay for her education fees and buy a computer to support her studies. If she couldn’t access this loan, her studying would have to be interrupted. Besides lacking education fees, she has other difficulties like lacking learning equipment. She appreciates the human value of this program and she will try her best to study and work for the best future. She wants to contribute her small ability to the art industry of Vietnam.

loans.use: to pay for her education fees and buy a computer to support her studies.

loans.name: Dorothy

texts.en:
Dorothy is a 24-year-old lady from Nyamonye region in the western part of Kenya. She supports four people in her family and is married to Daniel. Together they are blessed with two children who are 4 and 2 years old respectively.

Dorothy sells plastic materials, a business she has been doing for the last six years to earn income. She is applying for her first loan with KADET LTD. She will use the loan to purchase more stock of plastic materials like basins, plastic plates, and chairs. She will use the anticipated profit to plough back into the business.

Her dream is to become a successful business lady within her location and take good care of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of plastic materials.

loans.name: Dominic

texts.en:
Dominic is 53 years old, from Naivasha and is married to Ruth.  They have five children who are in school.

Dominic is in a transport business and owns a motorbike which he has been using to provide transport services for the past 4 years. 

Dominic repaid his previous loan on time and has applied for his fourth loan from Kadet Ltd. to enable him to buy a motorbike. With the anticipated profit, he plans to expand his farming business.

He hopes to build a better house for his family in the near future.

loans.use: to buy a motorbike

loans.name: Arlene

texts.en:
Arlene, 38 years of age, is married and they are blessed with one child. She has managed to sell dried fish in their village for almost 1 year.  In this business she's earning a net income of 3,000 PHP.

Due to insufficient funds, she decided to ask for a loan amounting to 10,000 PHP to purchase three sacks of dried fish. She's hoping that her requested loan will be granted so that she can improve her business to earn more profits.

loans.use: to purchase three sacks of dried fish

loans.name: Solida

texts.en:
Solida is a rural villager from Prey Veng’s Peam Chhor district. He is 21-years-old and single. To make a living, He has been working for a company for almost a year. He is able to earn about USD $6 per day to meet his family’s needs. 

Solida is a first-cycle client with Kiva partner, VisionFund. He is applying for an education loan to cover the entire tuition fee for him to study at university. 

Solida hopes that this loan will enable him to obtain a higher education background and end up with a good job after graduation in order to support his family.

loans.use: to cover the entire tuition fee for him to study at university.

location.town: Prey Veng Province, Peam Chhor District

loans.name: Lean's Group

texts.en:
An industrious mother of six children, Lean is a villager from Thmor Koul district of Battambang province. The main source of income for her family is one hectare of rice paddies, farming and working for others for a fee. Lean is able to earn up to 26,700 Cambodian Riel (KHR) per day. 

Lean is an eight-time borrower and is part of a group of two, with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) to take out a new loan. Lean has utilized her past loans wisely to improve her family's living conditions. 

Now, Lean and her co borrower are seeking for 200,000 KHR and 500,000 KHR each. As the leader, she will spend her loan portion to buy potash for her farmland. She expects a good yield from her crops and makes a good income to better off her lifestyle.

loans.use: To buy potash for her farmland

loans.name: Sophal's Group

texts.en:
A villager from a rural area located in the Moung Russey district of Battambang province, Sophal is 33 years old and married. She has five children, two of whom are dependent on her and still in school. 

The primary source of her family’s income is from rice farming. Having been in this business for 20 years, she can earn about 15,000 KHR per day and manages to save about 7,000 KHR each day after expenses. 

Sophal has been a member of VisionFund for two cycles already, and she wisely and successfully used the first loan to improve her family’s livelihood and relieve the financial burden. 

Now leading her group to apply for another loan, Sophal, who is the leader, will use her portion to buy fertilizer and pesticides for her farmland. She hopes to make more healthy rice to increase her family’s income, to improve her living condition, and keep her children in school.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and pesticides for her farmland

loans.name: Len's Group

texts.en:
Originally from a rural village in the Tbaung Khmum district of Kampong Cham province, Len is a 22-year-old married mother of two children who are still small. Rice farming has been the main source of her family’s income, and to better support the family and help to earn more income, her husband works as a paid worker in the local area. Together, they can earn about 25,000 KHR per day to meet the family’s needs; they manage to save about 10,000 KHR each day for future needs. 

Len’s group consists of two members who just joined VisionFund this cycle. Now she is leading her group to ask for a loan. 

As the leader, she is going to use her portion to buy fertilizer for her farmland and use a portion of it to repair her farming supply. She hopes to earn more income from her rice paddy to improve her standard of living.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for her farmland

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Tbaung Khmum district

loans.name: Lorna

texts.en:
Lorna is 42 years old, married with four children and one of whom is in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Lorna has a fish vending business in the Philippines. Lorna requested a 25,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase more fish for resale. 

Lorna has been in this business for 15 years. She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more fish for resale.

loans.name: Marine

texts.en:
Marine lives in Haghartsin Village in Tavush Region, and jointly with her husband, has been engaged in agriculture for many years. Their livestock currently includes cows, pigs, piglets and chickens. Near the village where Marine and her family live, they own a plot of agricultural land, where they cultivate corn and potatoes and grow different types of fruits (plums, nuts, apples, and pears).

Marine and her husband work really hard to gather good a harvest, sell it locally and sustain their living. They have an 11-year-old son, who attends school and sometimes helps his parents with cattle breeding.

Marine has taken a loan from a financial institution before, but because of the family's poor conditions, she wasn't able to pay it back. However, over these years of tireless work, she was able to own her farm, which is profitable enough to cover monthly payments. Marie has now been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF International. The second-chance loan program provides loans to people who have bad credit history behind them and have no access to credit products. With the loan's help, she plans to purcahse a cow and use its milk in cheese production.

Let's help this hard-working family to prove that everybody can overcome life’s difficulties through hard and devoted work.

loans.use: to pay for a cow

loans.name: Fotima

texts.ru: Фотима всю свою жизнь посвятила своему сыну. Она вдова, так как ее муж умер несколько лет назад. Фотима имеет одного сына. Она более 25 лет занимается шитьём национального матраса «курпача» на заказ. Она имеет большой опыт по данному бизнесу и своих постоянных клиентов. Местные жители предпочитают ее услугу, так как она шьёт матрасы красиво и качественно. Ей уже 56 лет и ей трудно приходится шить «курпача». Она хочет женить своего единственного сына, который зарабатывает в Российской Федерации. Она хочет, чтобы ее сын и будущая невестка жили вместе с ней и помогали по домохозяйству. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 1500 сомони для проведения свадебного торжества своего сына. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: Fotima devoted all of her life to her son.  She is a widow since her husband died several years ago.  Fotima has one son.  She has been involved in sewing national mattresses "kurpach" to-order for over 25 years.  She has a lot of experience in this business and regular customers.  Local residents prefer her services because she sews mattresses beautifully and with good quality.  She is already 56 years old and it is difficult for her to sew "kurpach." She wants to marry off her only son, who works in the Russian Federation.  She wants her son and future daughter-in-law to live together with her and help her with the household.  Fotima is requesting a loan in the amount of 1500 somoni to hold a wedding for her son.  She awaits your kindness.

loans.use: to hold a wedding for her son

loans.name: Corazon

texts.en:
Corazon is very thankful for the financial assistance extended to her. Her business is an appliance repair center. She also has a direct selling and a buying and selling business. Her income from her businesses helps her family in their everyday expenses.  

She would like to apply for another 30,000 PHP loan for her to buy spare parts and supplies and to maintain her shop. Her profits from business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs and cover the educational expenses of her children. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Corazon hopes that her business will continue to flourish and dreams of having her own house and lot. She meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her life and business every week, and that is where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies. 

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for spare parts and supplies for her appliance repair shop

loans.name: Leangheng's Group

texts.en:
Leangheng is 55 years old and a widowed mother of four children. She grows rice and works as a paid worker to support her big family as a single mother. She can earn up to 25,000 KHR per day, from which she has lived for ages.

This is not the first loan for Leangheng with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). The past loan that she has paid back has unburdened her family’s difficulty at a good pace. For this loan cycle, she is confident in taking a new loan again from VisionFund by leading a group of two.  As the leader, she will spend her loan portion to buy potash and to pay for a plowing fee. She hopes that she can get more income to support her life.

loans.use: to buy potash and to pay a plowing fee

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ou Reang Ov district

loans.name: Jamila

texts.en:
Jamila, age 43, is a housewife. She adores her family, and her husband works very hard so that his family can have a good and respectable life. Her husband is a scrap dealer. This business is the only source of income for the family.

Jamila is requesting a loan from Kiva partner BRAC Pakistan with the goal of improving her husband's business. He will use the loan amount to purchase scrap iron, aluminum and plastic bottles for his business.

With the profits expected from this loan, he intends to invest in household needs. Jamila hopes that the loan will be helpful for her husband's business. She is thankful to Kiva lenders and to BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to purchase scrap iron, aluminum and plastic bottles

loans.name: Chaily's Group

texts.en:
Chaily is a local farmer from Kampong Cham province. She covers her daily food consumption via rice cropping on a one hectare area and by working for others, for a fee. This is the business that she has occupied for ages.  

Chaily is a second-time borrower with VisionFund Cambodia (Kiva‘s partner). The past loan which she has repaid has enabled her to support her living and her business on-time. She managed to buy household appliances for her family, too. 

Now, in a group of four, she is the leader. Chaily and her joint borrowers are each seeking the same loan amount of KHR 1,200,000. 

Chaily will spend her loan portion to buy fertilizer, to pay for plowing fees, and to buy insecticide for her farmland. She hopes to replant her crop in a timely manner and to get a good yield.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, to pay for plowing fees, and to buy insecticide.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ou Reang Ov district

loans.name: Somnang's Group

texts.en:
Somnang, 31, is a mother of one child, residing in Kandal province’s Sa Ang district. 

To overcome the family’s hardship, she and her husband catch fish for resale as the main source of income. This is the business that she has had for several years. 

Somnang and the other two borrowers in the group are third-time borrowers with VisionFund Cambodia (Kiva’s partner). Somnang has utilized her past loan wisely, to improve her living at a good pace. Now, she and her co-borrowers are each seeking the same loan amount of KHR 1,000,000. 

As the leader, Somnang will spend her loan portion to buy necessary fishing materials to support her business. She hopes to make more income from her business, so she can improve her lifestyle.

loans.use: to buy necessary fishing materials to support her business.

loans.name: Shorena

texts.en:
Shorena is 37 years old and lives in the village of Nichbisi with her family: her husband and student daughter. Shorena is a teacher and works at the local public school teaching the Russian language. Besides, she owns a small flat in her district, which is rented out and gives the family additional income.

Shorena’s husband is unemployed at the moment, highly impairing his situation. With this startup loan, Shorena will purchase a cargo van and her spouse will start a transportation service business. He will carry and transport different things depending on the needs and requests of his customers and generate income. The couple hopes that the new business initiative will significantly increase the family income and they will improve their standard of living.

Shorena wants to thank all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase cargo van for her husband to use in transportation service business

loans.name: Sophat

texts.en:
Sophat is a widowed mother of a son who is studying in a local university. She lives in Phnom Penh's Steung Meanchey district. She supports her living and covers her child’s tuition fee from her meatball-selling and balut-selling (a developing duck embryo that is boiled alive and eaten in the shell, which is called “Pong Tea Kon” in Cambodia). 

This is Sophat's second time with VisionFund Cambodia (Kiva's partner). Due to the past loan which she successfully repaid, she can manage her business in a timely manner and improve her living. 

Now, she applies for an education loan from VisionFund Cambodia to pay for her son's tuition. He is majoring in laboratory medicine. Sophat hopes her son will a obtain a good job after graduation.

loans.use: to pay for her son's tuition.

loans.name: Gladis

texts.es:
La socia Gladys se sigue dedicando al negocio de venta de sandalias y zapatos,la socia vende en diferentes lugares o lleva a diferentes mercados,la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 5:00 p.m,la socia ya tiene 5 años en este negocio y le va muy bien,el sueño de la socia es tener un local donde pueda vender los zapatos y sandalias.La socia socilita el credito para comprar sandalias y zapatos.


La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
The borrower, Gladis, continues working selling sandals and shoes. She sells in different places or in various markets. She works from 8:00am until 5:00pm. She has been in business for 5 years already and is doing very well. Her dream is to have a facility where she can sell shoes and sandals. She is asking for a loan to buy sandals and shoes.

The borrower is happy about the loan and she promises to make her payments according to plan.

loans.use: to buy sandals and shoes for her business

loans.name: Onik

texts.en:
Onik lives with his wife and two school-age sons (nine and sixteen years old) in Noravan, Armavir.

He keeps two pigs and cultivates watermelon, cabbage and cucumber. Onik sells the harvest and gathers income, which is vital to sustain the family. In order to tackle financial difficulties, Onik also works as an operator at a local company.

Onik took a loan from a local financial institution before and was unable to repay it due to his family's weak financial situation and his unemployment. But after years of tireless work, he has been able to find a good job and owns a farm which is profitable enough to cover monthly payments. Onik has now been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF international. The second-chance loan program provides loans to people who have bad credit history and have no access to credit products.

This loan is very important for Onik to be able to enlarge his farm by purchasing three oxen, forage for feeding them and fertilizer, which is crucial for  the successful cultivation of the land. Onik awaits your support.

loans.use: to pay for three oxen, forage and fertilizer

loans.name: Kisenyi United New- Group

texts.en:
Grace is an old Client of UGAFODE Microfinance and has so far borrowed thrice from Ishaka Branch. She is 42 years old but still has the zeal to work and achieve her dream of buying herself a car and making life in her evening years more comfortable. She is the mother of three, aged 14, 10 and 8 and they all go to school. Grace is a member of Kasenyi United group which is found near a landing site.  The group is comprised of both males and females who have teamed up to help each other develop. Grace, just like most of the group members, does fishing as her major source of income and she gives this business a maximum of six hours per day. She started fishing in the year 1991 with high hopes of making profits and hence catering to her needs and the needs of the children. 

Grace has additional income from a bar which is in the same area and which she operates when she is off the fishing business, especially in the evening. She hopes to use the money to buy more fish nets and drinks for her bar so that she is able to catch more fish and serve her customers better and hence make more sales which would result in high profits. Grace’s clients are the residents of Kasenyi cell and Kigabo. Her major challenges are the debts which come as a result of people drinking at her bar and not paying and the thieves who are quite many in the area. Her honesty and hard work have helped her to attain the business success which she is proud of. Despite the success registered so far, she feels she has not yet achieved her dream but is hopeful that the UGAFODE  loan of UGX 2,500,000 (two million five hundred thousand shillings) will help her a lot.

loans.use: To buy fishing nets

loans.name: Rimber

texts.es:
El socio continua dedicándose a su negocio de agencia de viajes, el socio lleva años con su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, él socio vende diferentes paquetes turísticos como Machupicchu, Valle Sagrado entre otros, él socio desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando  a su familia.
El socio solicita el crédito para comprar tickets de tren.
El socio se siente agradecido y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en:
Rimber continues working in his travel agency business.  He has been in the business for years and it's going well for him thanks to the effort he puts into his work every day.  He sells different tourist packages such as Machu Picchu, Valle Sagrado, and others.  He wants to be able to continue working so he can continue helping his family.

He's requesting the loan to buy train tickets.

He's grateful and promises to makes his payments on time.

loans.use: to buy train tickets

loans.name: Lola

texts.es:
Lola, de 49 años de edad, está casada con Cesar quien es contador de profesión, fruto de esa unión tienen 02 hijos de 18 y 16 años de edad respectivamente con quienes vive en su casa propia. La actividad que realiza Lola es el cultivo de palmas aceiteras, para eso cuenta con un terreno de 10 hectáreas en las cuales tiene sembrado  palma aceitera la cual está en producción, ya que lleva en el negocio poca más de 04 años, y ahora se dedica a la cosecha y venta de su producción, contando con el apoyo de su esposo en el administración de su negocio.
Le gusta su negocio pues le permite contar con un ingreso económico adicional con el cual solventar sus gastos, así como el sentirse ocupada y una mujer empresaria, tiene muchas ganas de sobresalir. Este es el su cuarto préstamo con Kiva, por ello espera de su colaboración, para continuar con sus objetivos, además se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual. Con el monto solicitado de 1500 nuevos soles, comprará abono orgánico para sus sembríos.
texts.en:
Lola, 49 years old, is married to Cesar who is an accountant by profession. They have 2 children, 18 and 16 years old who live with them in their own house. Lola works growing oil palms, and she has 10 hectares of land on which she has oil palms in production. Since she has been in business a little more than 4 years, she is now harvesting and selling the crop. Her husband helps her in the management of the business.

She likes her business because it gives her an additional income for her expenses and for feeling busy as a businesswoman. She is eager to excel.

This is her fourth loan through Kiva and she is hoping for your assistance so she can continue with her plans, and she agrees to make her payments punctually. With the requested amount of 1500 soles, she will buy organic fertilizer for her crops.

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizer

loans.name: Beatrice Bazilio

texts.en:
Beatrice Bazilio is a client of Finance Sudan Limited. She is 38 years of age and a mother of three children, all of whom go to school. 

Beatrice Bazilio is a businesswoman who bakes and sells scones at the market. She has been doing the baking business for over two years now. Her customers have increased because she now supplies her scones to hotels, offices, and other homes. 

Due to this increase, she is borrowing a loan of SSP 1,000 (South Sudanese Pounds) to buy more baking flour and other additives, so that she can satisfy her growing number of clients. She says the loan will help her to further expand her business and be able to employ other people to help her in the business. She will also be able to pay her children's school fees and improve the living standards of her family.

loans.use: to buy more baking flour and other additives to bake and sell scones.

loans.name: Florencio

texts.es:
El socio Florencio se dedica a su negocio de agencia de turismo y tambien el socio vende paquetes turisticos a diferentes turistas que llegan de diferentes lugares,el socio trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m,el socio ya tiene 5 años en este negocio,el sueño del socio es ampliar el negocio de agencia de viajes.El socio solicita el credito para comprar boletos turisticos.

El socio agradece a  KIVA por permitirle seguir trabajando y desarrollándose en su actividad económica.
texts.en: The member, Florencio, is engaged in his tourism agency business and also sells tour packages to various tourists that come from different areas.  He works from 8:00 a.m. to 6:00 p.m. and has already been in this business for five years.  Florencio’s dream is to expand his travel agency business and he requesting the loan to purchase tourist tickets.  He thanks Kiva for permitting him to continue working and developing his business.

loans.use: to purchase tourist tickets.

loans.name: Nilda Araceli

texts.es:
La socia Nilda se sigue dedicando al negocio de crianza y comercializacion de cuyes,la socia los hace engordar y crecer y luego los vende en las diferentes lugares o mercados,la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 5:00 p.m,la socia ya tiene 7 años en este negocio y le va muy bien,el sueño de la socia es tener un local donde pueda vender los cuyes.La socia solicita le credito para comprar cuyes.

La socia esta feliz con el prestamo y se compromete a cumplir los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
The borrower, Nilda, is still working in the business of breeding and selling guinea pigs. She fattens them and then later sells them in various locations and markets. She works from 8:00AM until 5:00PM. She has been in this business for 7 years and is doing very well. Her dream is to have a facility where she can sell guinea pigs. The borrower is asking for a loan to buy guinea pigs.

She is happy about the loan and she promises to comply with the payment plan.

loans.use: to buy guinea pigs to fatten and sell

loans.name: Sok

texts.en: Sok, 50, is the married mother of seven children. Her main source of income is from two hectares of rice cropping and a cow raising business. She has been involved in her current business for ages and it has returned her almost 6 US dollars per day. Sok is not a new borrower with VisionFund (Kiva's partner). She has utilized her past loan wisely to upgrade her lifestyle better than before. With this new cycle, she is seeking an education loan to pay for her daughter's tuition fees. Her daughter is studying for her bachelor degree majoring in banking. Sok hopes her daughter will get a good job after graduation.

loans.use: To pay for her daughter's tuition fee

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.es:
La socia sigue dedicándose al turismo, la socia lleva buen tiempo dedicándose a esta actividad el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su trabajo, la socia vende diferentes paquetes turísticos como tours Machupicchu, Valle Sagrado entre otros, la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa siendo de esta forma que la socia saca adelante  a su familia.

La socia Elizabeth está solicitando el préstamo para comprar boletos turísticos.

La socia Elizabeth se siente agradecida con KIVA por permitirle mantenerse y desarrollarse en su actividad comercial.
texts.en:
The borrower still works in tourism and has been working in this field for some time and is doing well thanks to the effort she puts in each day to her work. She sells different tourist packages such as Machu Picchu tours, Sacred Valley, and more. She is a responsible and diligent person and being this way she brings up her family.

The borrower, Elizabeth, is asking for a loan to buy tourist tickets. Elizabeth is grateful to Kiva for allowing her to maintain and develop her business.

loans.use: to buy tickets to sell tourists in her tourism business

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Jose Victor

texts.es: Jose de 30 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposa y su hija de 4 años de edad, él se dedica a realizar viajes en su microbús por las diferentes colonias donde el reside, muchas personas lo buscan por la responsabilidad que el tiene a la hora de manejar, por esa razón se he hecho de muchos clientes que lo prefieren para realizar los viajes, con lo que gana de su trabajo logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, José está solicitando un crédito para la  compra de llantas y pintar su vehículo ya que esa es su única fuente de trabajo y asi darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
José, 30, lives in his own house with his wife and daughter, 4.  He makes a living providing transportation in his microbus in the different neighborhoods where he lives.  A lot of people seek him out because he's a responsible driver.  This is why he has acquired a lot of customers who prefer him for their transportation.  With what he earns from his job he's able to pay for some of the household expenses.

José's requesting a loan to buy tires and paint his vehicle.  It's his only source of income and this way he can give his family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy tires and to paint his vehicle

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: El cliente vive en casa propia junto a sus padres y hermanos.  El se dedica a la compra de ganado desde hace varios años, es una persona honesta, responsable, amable y trabajadora por esta y muchas cualidades mas,  es muy reconocido en  la zona, además de su ardua labor con el ganado, gracias a su trabajo  y la ayuda de su padre y hermanos ha logrado solventar algunos de su familia, el cliente solicita un crédito para la compra de mas ganado, vitaminas y concentrado para la alimentación, para continuar laborando con actividades relacionadas y mejorar sus ingresos, su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
This borrower lives in his own home with this father and brothers. He works selling cattle. He is well known in the area for being honest, responsible, kind and hardworking, among many other qualities. He says that thanks to his hard work with his cattle business and with the help of his father and brothers, he has been able to pay for some of the family’s expenses.

The borrower is requesting this loan to buy more cattle, as well as vitamins and nutritional supplements for their food. His goal is to continue his work and related activities to improve his income, and to improve his and his family’s quality of life.

loans.use: to buy more cattle, as well as vitamins and nutritional supplements for their food.

loans.name: Gina Isabel

texts.es:
La socia se sigue dedicando al negocio de tienda de abarrotes,la socia vende productos de primera necesidad como arroz,azucar,leche y galletas,la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 10:00 p.m,la socia ya tiene 8 años en este negocio y le va muy bien,el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de tienda de abarrotes.La socia solicita el credito para comprar arroz,azucar,leche y galletas.

La socia se encuentra agradecido por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Gina Isabel continues to run her grocery store. She sells basic necessities such as rice, sugar, milk and crackers. She works from 8 a.m. to 10 p.m. She has been running her store for eight years now, and it is going well for her. Her dream is to increase the size of her store.

Gina Isabel is requesting this loan to buy rice, sugar, milk and crackers. She says that she is very grateful for this opportunity with Kiva and the field partner, and that she promises to make her payments on time.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, milk and crackers for her store.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: El cliente es una persona muy amable y trabajador, vive con su compañera de vida encasa propia, él trabaja muy duro en su propia parcela donde siembra maíz, maicillo y frijol; sus productos son de muy buena calidad, cuando su cosecha ya esta lista sale a comercializarla a los diferentes mercados que están cerca de su lugar de residencia. El cliente solicita un préstamo a INTEGRAL para contar con el dinero necesario e invertir en la compra de insumos agrícolas como controles de plaga, fertilizantes, abonos, semillas, herbicidas entre otras cosas que necesita para su siembra, él ansía aumentar sus ventas para poder percibir mayores ganancias y tener  una mejor estabilidad económica.
texts.en:
The borrower is known for being very kind and hardworking. He lives with his life partner in their own home. He works very hard in his fields, where he grows corn, sorghum and beans. He says his products are of very high quality. When his harvest is ready, he takes it to sell it in the various markets that are near where he lives.

The borrower is requesting this loan to buy fertilizer, manure, seeds, pesticides, herbicides and other things he needs for his crops. He would like to increase his sales and profits so as to have more economic stability.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, manure, seeds, pesticides and herbicides, etc.

loans.name: Adelina

texts.en:
Adelina, 60 years of age, is married and they are blessed with eight children. 

She has owned and operated a vulcanizing shop in their village for almost 22 years. With this business she's earning a net income of Php 1,000 a week. Due to lack of capital she's requesting a loan from those generous lenders amounting to Php 25,000 to purchase interior tires for her business. 

She's hoping that her requested loan will be granted so that she can better expand and improve her business.

loans.use: To purchase interior tires for her business

loans.name: Leticia

texts.es:
La señora Leticia tiene 51 años de edad, es madre soltera y tiene 3 hijos que dependen de ella, vive en casa propia ubicada en un barrio de Tegucigalpa en la zona centro de Honduras, es una mujer muy trabajadora.
Doña Leticia se dedica a la elaboración y venta de tortillas desde hace 25 años, sus ventas son de lunes a domingo y sus clientes son los vecinos y amigos de su colonia, sus ventas son en su mayoría por encargo y la otra parte le ayuda una de sus hijas a venderlas en una pulpería.
Doña Leticia también lava y plancha a unos vecinos todos los fines de semana y esto le genera un ingreso mas para su hogar, está solicitando el préstamo para la compra de ladrillos, cemento, grava, varillas y madera porque quiere realizarle unas mejoras a su cocina y a su lugar de trabajo.
Doña Leticia espera que esta inversión y ayude a mejorar un poco su calidad de vida y la de su familia y poder así en un futuro seguir mejorando su vivienda.



Tegucigalpa, Honduras – Agosto del 2013
texts.en:
Señora Leticia is 51 years old. She is a single mother and has three children who depend on her. She lives in her own house located in a neighborhood of Tegucigalpa in the central zone of Honduras. She is a very hard working mother.

Doña Leticia has been preparing and selling tortillas for 25 years. Her sales are from Monday to Sunday, and her customers are her neighbors and friends in her district. The majority of her sales are on demand, and for the rest, one of her daughters helps her sell them in a grocery store.

Doña Leticia also washes and irons for some neighbors every weekend, and this generates additional income for her household. 

She is applying for the loan to buy bricks, cement, gravel, [reinforcing] rods, and wood because she wants to make some improvements in her kitchen and in her work area. Doña Leticia hopes that this investment helps her to improve her quality of life and that of her family a little bit and that in the future she will be able to continue improving her house.

Tegucigalpa, Honduras – August,l 2013

loans.use: to buy bricks, cement, gravel, [reinforcing] rods, and wood for her house

loans.name: Ramaz

texts.en:
Ramaz, 62, is married and lives with his wife in the village of Tabagrebi. His wife is provided with a retirement pension. Ramaz runs a small scale agricultural business. In particular he owns beehives with colonies and sells the honey. In addition, he has a vineyard and a small plot of land where various vegetables are grown. Ramaz is a very hardworking and enthusiastic man who wants to generate more income, so he decided to start up a grocery store but found that he didn't have enough money to do so. 

Unfortunately, Ramaz was unable to obtain a loan from existing financial institutions, as they required a stable income and business experience as a precondition for a loan. But Ramaz has now received his loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and Credo. This start-up loan program provides start-up and re-start-up loans with easy terms to the country's vulnerable poor who do not have access to credit. With a loan of 2000 USD Ramaz will purchase stock of basic groceries for starting up a store in his village. He will care for his clients and treat them in a kind and friendly way. With this determination and his loan he expects to improve his income. Ramaz awaits your generosity.

loans.use: to purchase basic groceries for starting a store

loans.name: Channy's Group

texts.en:
Channy is 46 years old and a breadwinner in the family, consisting of herself, her husband, and five children. Nowadays, only three children depend on her as they are in school. 

She and her husband are carpenters. This couple has engaged in their current business for ages and it has returned her about 20,800 KHR per day. This is the fifth loan for Channy and the third for her joint-borrower with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She has fully paid back her past loan wisely to support her business and keep her kids in school. 

For this cycle, she is the group leader. She will spend her loan portion to buy wood and necessary tools to support her family’s business. She hopes this purchase will support her business on time and help her get back a good income.

loans.use: To buy wood and necessary tools to support her family’s business

loans.name: Anahit

texts.en:
Anahit is the devoted mother of two children. She lives in Isahakyan village with her husband, son, and daughter. 

The family has been involved in agriculture for many years. Anahit breeds cattle (12 cows, sheep, pigs, chickens) and cultivates wheat and potato. Anahit is specialized in the production of cheese. She uses milk in cheese production and sells it locally to gather income for the family. 

Now Anahit needs financial support for purchasing forage and feeding her livestock. As this is Anahit's first loan, it has been approved within the framework of the new joint initiative of Kiva and SEF. The first-chance-loan program provides loans to people who didn’t have access to credit products before, because they have no credit history. The loan will greatly assist Anahit to continue her farming business.

She hopes that Kiva lenders will give her an opportunity to gather more income and ensure a better life for her family.

loans.use: to pay for forage for feeding the livestock

loans.name: Ma Matias

texts.es:
Doña Matías es una mujer de 32 años de edad casada la cual goza de una excelente salud suficiente energía y muchos ánimos para trabajar. En la comunidad es caracterizada por una mujer muy amable, respetuosa y servicial la cual trabaja junto a su esposo y sus 5 hijos. En familia se dedican a la siembra y cultivo de café ya que ella aprendió desde pequeña en compañía de sus padres. Fueron ellos los que le enseñaron a trabajar la tierra ya que no pudieron apoyarla en sus estudios porque eran de escasos recursos económicos entonces ella decidió aprender a trabajar y ayudarle a su familia para salir adelante y los ingresos por parte del trabajo de la tierra son pocos y la distribución económica era específicamente para la alimentación. Sus cultivos de café están ubicados a 5 kilómetros de distancia de su casa de habitación al cual se trasladan pie todos los días. Sus sueños como madre de familia es poder educar a sus hijos para que ellos puedan vivir en buenas condiciones y darles una mejor y mayor calidad de vida con un nivel educativo superior.

Doña Matías solicita un financiamiento a la cooperativa COMIXMUL para  la compra de 4 QQ de urea, 4 QQ de abono 18-46-0, 4 QQ de abono 12-24-12, 6 litros de abono foliar, 3 galones de herbicidas entre otros para poder asistir sus cultivos y obtener una mejor producción y una mejor ganancia de la venta de la misma.
texts.en:
Matías is a 32 year old married woman. She enjoys excellent health, is energetic and very motivated to work.  In the community, she is characterized as a very friendly, respectful, helpful woman who works along with her husband and five children.  Her family is engaged in coffee planting and cultivation, which she learned from her parents when she was very young.  As her parents had limited financial resources and could not support her education, they taught her how to work the land.  Then she decided to learn to work and help her family get ahead.  However, the income from working the land was a small amount and the money was distributed specifically for food.  Every day, she walks to her coffee crops, which are located five kilometers from her home.  As mother of the family, her dream is to be able to provide her children with higher education so that they can live in good conditions and have a better, higher quality of life. 

Matías is requesting a loan from the Comixmul cooperative to purchase 4 quintals of urea, 4 quintals of 18-46-0 fertilizer, 4 quintals of 12-24-12 organic fertilizer, 6 liters of foliar fertilizer, 3 gallons of herbicides, and other items to help their crops.  In this way, she will obtain a better production and, therefore, higher profits from the sales.

loans.use: to purchase organic fertilizer, foliar fertilizer, urea and other items  to cultivate coffee.

loans.name: Caren Vanessa

texts.es:
La señora Caren tiene 33 años de edad, es soltera y tiene 2 hijos,  vive en su casa propia ubicada en un barrio de Tegucigalpa en la zona centro de Honduras, es una mujer muy luchadora y responsable.
Doña Caren se dedica a la elaboración y venta de tortillas desde hace 8 años, sus ventas son de lunes a domingo se levanta a las 5 de la mañana a elaborar sus tortillas que le encargar sus clientes que son los vecinos y amigos de su colonia.
Doña Caren está solicitando el préstamo para la compra de ladrillos, cemento, grava, varillas, madera, clavos, alambre, láminas porque quiere construir un cuarto y también para comprar maíz, leña y cal para seguir elaborando su productos.
Doña Caren espera que esta inversión y ayude a mejorar un poco su calidad de vida y la de su familia y así seguir mejorando su casa y a la vez espera que esta inversión le ayude a sacar adelante a sus hijos.



Tegucigalpa, Honduras – Agosto del 2013
texts.en:
Caren is 33 years old, she is single, and has two children. She has her own home in a neighborhood of Tegucigalpa, in central Honduras. She is a responsible woman and a fighter. 

Caren has been making and selling tortillas for eight years. She works Monday through Sunday, getting up each morning at 5 o'clock to make the tortillas ordered by her customers, who are her local friends and neighbors.

Caren is applying for the loan in order to purchase bricks, cement, gravel, rebar, wood, nails, wire, and laminate because she wants to add a room to her home and also purchase corn, wood, and lime in order to continue making her product.

Caren hopes that this investment helps her to improve somewhat her quality of life and that of her family, to continue improving her home, and to help her children get ahead. 

Tegucigalpa, Honduras – August 2013

loans.use: purchase bricks, cement, gravel, rebar, wood, nails, wire, and laminate for her home.

loans.name: Lilia

texts.en:
This is Lilia. Her previous loan was a big help in her business. She was able to buy more recyclable materials for her business. Her income from business helped her in her everyday expenses. She has had this business for ten years now. She continues to work hard to provide for her everyday needs.

She would like to apply for another 30,000 PHP loan. She will be incorporating the loan in her current revolving fund used to buy scrap and recyclable materials. Her profits from business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart. 

Lilia hopes that her business will continue to grow and dreams to have a better living. She meets up with her co-fellowship members* to share stories of her life and business every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies. 

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for the recyclable materials needed in her business

loans.name: Mayja

texts.es: Mayja, de 42 años de edad, está casada con Denis quien es obrero y padre de sus 2 hijos de 4 años y 1 año de edad respectivamente. Juntos están cómodamente instalados en su casa propia. Mayja se dedica a la venta de comidas regionales. La  preparación la realiza en su casa y la venta de forma ambulatoria caminando con una bandeja por los comercios cercanos a su hogar. Se decidió a empezar con su negocio por la necesidad de contar con un ingreso adicional para apoyar a su pareja pues sus ingresos no eran suficientes,. Por tanto, viendo los buenos resultados que tiene, desea en un futuro abrir un restaurante pues le gusta la cocina. Este será su quinto préstamo con Kiva, por tanto agradece el apoyo financiero que recibe para salir adelante, además se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual. Con el monto solicitado de 700 nuevos soles, los invertirá en la compra de los ingredientes necesarios para la preparación de sus alimentos, como arroz, carnes y verduras.
texts.en: Mayja, who is 42 years old, is married to Denis, a laborer and father to two children who are ages four and one. Together they live comfortably in their own home. Mayja works selling regional foods. She prepares the food in her home and sells them as a street vendor, walking with a tray or cart around local stores near her home. She decided to start this business because she needed to find a reliable source of additional income to help her partner as his income was not sufficient. So, seeing the success she has had, she hopes to one day open a restaurant as she enjoys cooking. This will be her fifth Kiva loan, and she is grateful for the financial assistance that she receives to help her get ahead. Furthermore, she promises to make her regular payments. With the amount of 700 nuevos soles requested, she will purchase the necessary ingredients for preparing her meals, such as rice, meats, and vegetables.

loans.use: to purchase rice, meats, and vegetables.

loans.name: Keidy Johanna

texts.es:
La Joven Keidy tiene 25 años de edad, es soltera y tiene 2 hijos,  vive en casa propia ubicada en un barrio de Tegucigalpa en la zona centro de Honduras, es una mujer muy luchadora y responsable.
Keidy se dedica a la elaboración y venta de tortillas desde hace 9 años, sus ventas son los días sábados y domingos y vende por encargo sus clientes son los amigos y vecinos de su comunidad, aparte de dedicarse a la venta de tortillas también labora como conserje de un centro de salud de la ciudad y trabaja de lunes a viernes.
Keidy está solicitando el préstamo para la compra de 3 pailas, harina, leña y mantas materiales que necesita para realizar su actividad, espera que esta inversión le ayude a mejorar su negocio y por ende su calidad de vida y la de sus hijos.
Keidy su sueño es mejorar su casa.


Tegucigalpa, Honduras – Agosto del 2013
texts.en:
Keidy is 25 years old, single, and has two children.  She lives in the house she owns in a neighborhood in Tegucigalpa, in the central part of Honduras.  She is a determined and responsible woman.  

Keidy has worked making and selling tortillas for nine years.  She sells on Saturday and Sunday.  Her customers, who are her friends and neighbors in the community, place orders.  In addition to selling tortillas, she also works as a custodian at a health center in the city from Monday to Friday.  

Keidy is requesting this loan to purchase three frying pans, flour, wood, and cloths, which are materials that she needs to do her work.  She hopes that this investment will help her to improve her business and therefore her quality of life and that of her children.  Keidy's dream is to improve her house.

loans.use: to purchase 3 frying pans, flour, wood, and cloths for her business.

loans.name: María Carmen

texts.es:
La socia sigue dedicandose a su negocio de restaurant,la socia lleva años con su negocio el cual le trae satisfaciones tanto economicas como personales,la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa,la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.

La socia solicita el credito para la compra de insumos como aceite,arroz entre otros.

 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
María Carmen continues to work at her restaurant.  She has had it for many years and it brings her both financial and personal satisfaction.  She is a responsible and enterprising person.  She wants to continue working so that she can continue supporting her family.

María Carmen is requesting this loan to purchase ingredients such as oil, rice, and other items.

She is happy with the loan and promises to make her repayments on time.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients such as oil and rice.

loans.name: Maly's Group

texts.en:
Residing in Sa Ang district of Kandal province, Maly is 52 years old and has five children. She struggles for a living via rice farming to cover the daily cost of living. This is the business that she has had since she was 20 years old, earning about 33,000 KHR per day. 

Maly is not a first time borrower with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She has successfully repaid her past loan, which has upgraded her lifestyle better than before, and has provided decent food for her children. Now, she forms a group of four to get a new loan. As the leader, she will spend her loan portion to buy below-the-ground materials to build a proper latrine for her family. 

She hopes in the future her family will not be effected from any disease related to the lack of sanitation.

loans.use: To buy below-the-ground materials to build a proper latrine

loans.name: Angelica

texts.es:
La socia  es la señora Angelica, ella pertenece al banco “Manos Juntas” de la ciudad del Cusco - Perú del Cusco – Perú.  
La socia continua dedicándose al negocio de tienda de abarrotes, la socia lleva años dedicándose a este negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio a la vez continua distribuyendo mixtura como papel picado y serpentina (Cotillón para fiestas) a sus clientes que le solicitan, siendo de esta forma que la socia saca adelante  a su familia.
La socia solicito el crédito para la compra de arroz, azúcar entre otros para su negocio.
La socia Angelica está  agradecida con KIVA por permitirle mantenerse y desarrollarse en su actividad comercial.
texts.en:
The member, Angélica, belongs to Manos Juntas Communal Bank in the city of Cusco, Peru.  She still has her grocery store.  She has been in the business for years and it's going well for her thanks to the effort she puts into it every day.  She also continues selling party favors such as confetti and streamers.  This is how Angélica gets her family ahead.

She requested the loan to buy rice, sugar, and other products for her business.

Angélica's grateful to Kiva for allowing her to support herself and grow in her commercial activity.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, and other products

loans.name: Fortunata

texts.es:
La socia sigue dedicandose al negocio de tienda de abarrotes y a la venta de lechon (plato hecho a base de carne de chancho),la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa,la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.


La socia solicita el credito para la compra de arroz,azucar entre otros para la tienda de abarrotes.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Fortunata continues to manage her grocery store and sell lechon (a dish made from a whole-roasted suckling pig). This member is a responsible and earnest person, who hopes to continue working in order continue helping her family. 

Fortunata is requesting this loan in order to purchase rice, sugar, and other items for her grocery store. She is happy to receive the loan and promises to make her regular payments.

loans.use: purchase rice, sugar, and other items for her grocery store.

loans.name: Sokheorn

texts.en:
Sokheorn, a breadwinner in the family, with a little kid, resides in Sampov Meas district of Pursat province. She is a local farmer who grows rice on two hectares area. Her husband is a sculptor who spends his time on this work to earn additional income, as well as helping on the farmland. 

This current business that she has occupied for 10 years has returned her about 26,000 KHR per day. This is the third loan for Sokheorn with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She was very much satisfied with her past loan, which she has fully repaid, as she had working capital to support her business promptly.

For this cycle, she is seeking for her new loan to buy four sacks of fertilizer and to pay for plowing fees for her farmland. She will use a portion of her loan to buy more stone for carving for resale. She hopes to gain a good income from her business so as she can buy chicken for raising to supplement her income.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer, pay plowing fees, and buy stone for carving.

loans.name: Otgontsetseg

texts.en: Otgontsetseg, who is 33 years old, lives with her husband, daughter and parents in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. Using her previous loan, she paid her sister's university tuition fees. Now she is requesting a loan of 850,000 MNT to replace her apartment's old windows with vacuum insulated windows. During winter, the apartment loses heat through its windows. Installing vacuum insulated windows will make the apartment a more comfortable and warmer place to live. It is essential as her parents are getting older and keeping warm will help prevent cold-related sickness.

loans.use: to purchase vacuum insulated windows

loans.name: Shakarmo

texts.en:
Shakarmo is 60 years old. She is an industrious woman. She is widowed as her husband was dead some years ago. It was very difficult for her to provide her 3 children with all necessary things. 

She has always worked hard to earn an income. She is a teacher at the school. Shakarmo is a teacher of Physics. She has worked more than 10 years. Shakarmo is a very smart teacher and careful mother for her children. Now, her children are adults and help her keep the household. 

She wants to repair her house but her salary is small and it is not enough for buying building materials. She is asking for a loan of 600 USD to buy building materials such as cement, wood, etc. This is the second loan for her from IMON. She is an honest and kind woman. She awaits your support.

loans.use: To buy building materials such as cement and wood for repairing her house

loans.name: Jeondry

texts.en:
Jeondry is 33 years old, married, and has two children. He lives in Ozamis City, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. 

For the past three years, Jeondry has been operating a motorcycle transport business, earning 14,000 PHP a month. He successfully repaid his previous loan from GDMPC  which he used to purchase spare parts. 

Jeondry is requesting a loan of 20,000 PHP for the hospitalization costs of his wife.

He joined GDMPC in 2012. In the future, Jeondry hopes to improve his general living conditions and provide education to his children.

loans.use: to pay for the hospitalization costs of his wife.

loans.name: Magdalena

texts.en:
This is Magdalena, 63, resident of Batasan (Commonwealth), Quezon City, Philippines. She is married to Pacifico and they have children. They both manage their household and they help each other in generating income for their family.

Magdalena operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is a retail store that sells inexpensive items, often with a single price for all items in the store. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a 5PHP-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of PHP 500 in sales every day.

She is requesting a PHP 50,000 loan to help her continue in the operation of her business. She will use the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory.

Magdalena dreams that her business will continue longer and hopes to have a good life. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed for her business.

loans.name: Daisy

texts.en: Daisy is a 26-year-old married woman. She has 2 children who are 1 year and 4 years old. She describes herself as committed. She operates a grocery store where she sells tomatoes, onions, potatoes and other groceries. She has been involved in this business for 2 years. Her business is located in a viable area and her primary customers are from humble backgrounds. She describes her biggest business challenge to be a lack of capital to expand. She will use the KES 15,900 loan to increase her stock of tomatoes, onions and other vegetables. Her business goal is to open a shop within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will open a wholesale shop. This is her first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to increase her stock of tomatoes, onions and other vegetables

loans.name: Joel

texts.es: Gracias al crédito de kiva Joel pudo empezar a comprar plantas para reforestar su finca ya que su intención es cambiarse a productor orgánico, para esta nueva etapa de créditos Joel requiere para la compra de plantas y así poder seguir reforestando la parte que le falta de su finca para convertirse en productor orgánico al 100% ya que siendo orgánico le generara mejores ganancias económicas lo cual lo vera reflejado en un mejoramiento de su calidad de vida y la de los suyos.
texts.en:
Thanks to the Kiva loan Joel was able to start buying plants to replant his farm.  His goal is to become an organic producer.

For this new loan period Joel needs to buy plants to continue replanting the part of his farm that needs to be converted to 100% organic.

Being organic will generate better income, which will result in an improved quality of life for himself and his family.

loans.use: to buy plants to convert his farm to organic coffee

loans.name: Vanna

texts.en: Vanna is a young mother of three children, two schoolchildren and one little kid, living in Sampov Meas district of Pursat province. She is 25 years old and makes a living via rice cropping. Her husband has helped her to earn more income by driving a motor-taxi. The current business has returned her about  23,000 KHR per day. Never with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) before, she is taking out a first loan to buy five sacks of fertilizer and to pay for a plowing fee. She hopes to gain a good yield from her business so that she can run a small grocery business to generate additional income.

loans.use: To buy five sacks of fertilizer and to pay for a plowing fee

loans.name: Jackline Anderia

texts.en:
Jackline is a client of Finance Sudan Limited. She is married with four children and three of the children go to school. 

Jackline is a businesswoman who sells charcoal. Besides selling charcoal, she also sells cooking oil. 

Jackline heard about Finance Sudan from her neighbour. She was very pleased to learn that she could be given a loan. She therefore is borrowing a loan worth 1000 South Sudanese Pounds to buy more charcoal for her business. She says her business will expand with this loan and she will be able to pay for her children's school fees.

loans.use: To purchase more more charcoal and cooking oil

loans.name: Maria Rosa

texts.es:
Doña María es una mujer de 35 años de edad casada, trabajadora, emprendedora, humilde y con una gran salud la cual diariamente se levanta con deseos de trabajar y de vivir. Junto a su esposo y sus 3 hijos varones se dedican a realizar actividades como: abono, riego de fertilizante, fungicida, herbicida, corte, limpia etc. que conlleve a dar un mantenimiento y protección a sus cultivos de café. Ella aprendió la agricultura desde pequeña fueron sus padres los que le enseñaron a trabajar. Sus cultivos están ubicados a una distancia de 4 kilómetros de su casa de habitación adentrándose a la montaña al cual se trasladan a pie diariamente. Doña María tiene un grado de educación de primaria cursado hasta el tercer grado ya que por la falta de apoyo económico por parte de sus padres no pudo estudiar. Sus sueños son educar sus 3 hijos para que ellos tengan una mejor calidad de vida y que obtenga un nivel educativo superior con el cual puedan desempeñarse de una mejor manera en sus trabajos, empresas, etc. y que sean personas de bien en la vida.

Doña María actualmente solicita un financiamiento con el cual comprara 6 QQ de urea, 8 QQ de abono 18-46-0, 7 QQ de abono 12-24-12, 5 litros de abono foliar, 3 galones de herbicidas con los cual fortalecerá sus cultivos de café asegurando la cosecha al final de la temporada y protegiéndola de plagas y enfermedades como la roya.
texts.en:
Doña Maria is a woman of 35. She is married, hard-working, entrepreneurial, humble, and in great health. She gets up every day with the desire to work and to live. Along with her husband and her three sons, she carries out activities such as spreading compost, applying fertilizer, fungicides, and herbicides, pruning, weeding, etc., which are involved in maintaining and protecting her plantings of coffee. She learned agriculture when she was very little; it was her parents who taught her to work. Her plantings are located at a distance of 4 kilometers from her home, deeper into the mountains, where she goes on foot every day. Doña Maria has a primary school education, having completed third grade, since she was not able to continue to go to school due to the lack of economic support from her parents. Her dreams are to educate her three sons so that they can have a better quality of life and obtain a higher level of education that they can use to perform better in their work, businesses, etc., and so that they can be good persons in life.

Doña Maria is now applying for a loan with which she will buy 6 quintals [a quintal is approximately 100 lbs] of urea, 8 quintals of 18-46-0 fertilizer, 7 quintals of 12-24-12 fertilizer, 5 liters of foliar fertilizer, and 3 gallons of herbicides, with which she will strengthen her coffee crops, assuring the harvest at the end of the season and protecting it from pests and diseases such as rust.

loans.use: to pay for agricultural supplies to maintain and help her coffee plantings

loans.name: Rajabgul

texts.en:
Rajabgul is 52 years old. She is divorced and has 4 children. Rajabgul tries to provide them with a better quality of life, that’s why 3 years ago she began her own business, sewing traditional women's dresses. She has her own workshop in her house. 

Thanks to her good service, she has managed to gain many customers. Since she’s had her business, her family’s quality of life has been improving. She wants to make a wedding party of her son. Her son is going to marry a lovely girl. 

Rajabgul does not have the money to make the wedding party for her son. She is asking for a loan of 5,000 somoni. She awaits your support.

loans.use: To make a wedding party for her son

loans.name: Cherlyn

texts.en:
Cherlyn is married with 2 children. She is 38 years old and lives in Mayor's Village, Clarin, in the province of Misamis Occidental, Philippines.

To earn a living, Cherlyn operates a service-based business, providing transportation services to her local community. She has been doing this for years, and every month she earns 4,500.00 PHP from this work. Cherlyn has successfully repaid her previous loan from Gata Daku MPC for the repair of her existing vehicle for better service. She requests a new loan of 10,000.00 to cover the costs of licenses and renewal for motor registration.

Cherlyn has been a member of GDMPC since 2007. In the future, she hopes to double her income from her business, and that her children will be able to finish their studies.

loans.use: to cover the costs of licenses and renewal for motor registration.

loans.name: Fransisca

texts.en:
Fransisca is a married woman with two school going children. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are school fees and food.

For the past two years, she has operated a clothes selling business, where her potential customers are town dwellers and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality. Her dream is to open a cosmetic shop and be a clothes supplier.

With the Kshs 40,000 she wants to buy two bales of clothes for resale. She decided to join Yehu because of the affordable interest rates.

loans.use: to buy two bales of clothes for resale

loans.name: Chan's Group

texts.en:
A widowed mother from Sangke district of Battambang province, Chan is 59 years old and has four children. She strives for a living via rice trading, buying in order to resell. 

Chan has been with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) for ages, the past seven cycles. She has repaid her loan with success to support her living and her business better than before. Now, she forms a group of two to get a new loan of 1,400,000 KHR each. As the leader, she will spend her loan portion to buy more rice for resale. 

She hopes to stock more rice for resale so as she can get more income to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more rice for resale

loans.name: Intan I Group

texts.en:
Intan group has completed the first cycle of the Kiva program and all goes well. In cycle two, one of its members temporarily is not borrowing. So, now there is a total of 17 in the Intan group, which has diverse businesses, such as selling clothes and shoes, selling snacks, soybean production, food stalls open for business, and raising goats for sale. 

The group members support each other and complement each other. If one member is ill, they will be raising funds to help offset the cost of treatment for the sick person. They will visit the sick person, while handling the fund. They will use this loan plan to buy wholesale, meaning better production because of increased business capital.

This group is led by a mother who is called Menik. She has three children who are still in school. Menik has a business selling clothes, bags, shoes and bed covers. With this loan, Menik has an additional hope to build her own store and add lots of the latest models of clothes and bags to be sold to the public. 

These loans are also expected to increase the business and the income of each of the group members of Intan.

loans.use: to buy lots of models of clothes, bags and shoes.

loans.name: Riziki

texts.en:
Riziki is married with two children, both of whom are going to school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. 

For the past year, she has operated a clothes selling business, selling in her own shop to neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of the high cost of transportation in her place of operation. 

With the Kshs 30,000 she wants to purchase two bales of clothes for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase two bales of clothes for resale

loans.name: Lusia

texts.en:
Lusia lives in the capital city of Georgia with her grown son, daughter-in-law and an infant grandson. She is 59 years old and widowed. 

Lusia has been in the dressmaking business for the last twenty years and works for a small sartorial (tailoring business). She earns a monthly salary and feeds her family, but her earnings are too small and are not enough for covering other household expenses.

She is seeking a loan to buy a sewing machine and materials for tailoring. Lusia will work from her house after work and sew fashionable clothes, which will be sold at the local open market by her son. She will also work on special orders and serve the locals in return for a fee. 

The extra income that she raises from the business will improve her standard of living. Lusia hopes for your help and kindness.

loans.use: to purchase a sewing machine and materials for tailoring.

loans.name: Sopheap

texts.en:
As a resident from Takeo province, Sopheap is a 44-year-old married mother of two children. Her main sources of income come from from rice cropping, cow-raising, as well as her monthly income working as government worker. In addition, the family earns income through her husband’s occupation as a policeman. The current business has returned her about US$6 per day to cover their daily food and other necessary expenses. 

Sopheap is not a new borrower with VisionFund(Kiva’s partner). After the successful loan that she has fully repaid, she can maintain her agribusiness well and keep supporting her children in school. 

Now, she is taking out a new loan in order to support her daughter, who is pursuing her bachelor degree majoring in accounting. The loan will be used to cover the tuition fee. She hopes that this loan will fulfill her daughter's dream of getting a good job that is suitable with an academic background.

loans.use: to cover her daughter's tuition fee

loans.name: Loida

texts.en:
Loida is married with five children lives in Mialen, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She has been farming for many years as their main source of income, while her husband makes a living as a part-time driver.

Loida has successfully repaid her previous loans from Gata Daku MPC which she used for the improvement of her farm. This month, she has borrowed a new loan of 20,000 PHP to buy fertilizer such as manure for her growing corn production. In the future, she hopes for a bountiful harvest and to expand her area of cultivation.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and pay for weeding costs

loans.name: Thon

texts.en:
Thon, 54, is a widowed mother of six children who lives in a village in the Ponhea Krek district of Cambodia. She has been farming rice and raising pigs for several years.

This is the fourth loan Thon has taken through VisionFund. Having had a good experience with this lender, Thon is applying for a another loan, this one for 2,500,000 KHR, to spend on fertilizer for her crops and laborers to help her cultivate her farmland.

Thon really hopes that this loan will enable her to grow excellent rice so that she can sell her harvest for a higher amount. In this way Thon’s loans will help her family have a better life.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for her farmland and to pay for laborers on it

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ponhea Krek district

loans.name: Mujeres Activas Group

texts.es:
La señora Iris Adelma de estado  civil unida de hecho, de 50 años de edad, de escolaridad 6to. Magisterio, tiene 2 hijos y 1 de ellos está estudiando, se dedica al negocio de transporte extraurbano, inició este negocio con su esposo y hasta la fecha lleva 16 años de experiencia, cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo.

Organiza un grupo y decide solicitar un préstamo que lo utilizará para la compra de llantas para el vehículo, desea en el futuro tener otros vehículos de transporte para poder generar más ganancias, las demás integrantes del grupo se dedican a la venta de repuestos para carros, venta de comida y venta de productos por catálogo. Es importante mencionar que en la fotografia se ecuentran 6 personas pero solamente a 5 de ellas se le concedió el préstamo.
texts.en:
Señora Iris Adelma is in a common-law marriage. She is 50 years old and has a sixth grade education. She has two children, of whom one is in school. Her business is extra-urban transportation. She began this business with her husband and up to now has 16 years of experience. She has help from her husband.

She organized a group and decided to apply for a loan that she will use to buy tires for her vehicle. In the future she wants to have other transportation vehicles to be able to generate more earnings. The other members of the group work in selling spare parts for cars, selling food, and selling catalog products. It is important to mention that in the photograph there are six people, but only five of them are participating in the loan.

loans.use: to buy tires for the extra-urban bus
